pBlFGNFgedMDibkZql9v4Q.text: Food is so delicious!!! Can't go wrong no matter what you order! My boyfriend and I came for the first ti.e while in vegas and ordered the 8pz filet cooked to perfection and the sides we got were horseradish mash potatoes amazballs and the mac and cheese, all fabulous!! Our appetizers were the tacos and oysters, all so good!! So good we came back on our last night and tried there poke, Brussel sprouts, calamari and more oysters!! This place will definitely be a regular spot everything we visit vegas!! And we visit 1-2 times a year!

mJ_fE2IUBqSC9qHbkEastg.text: I was invited by Brain Malarkey for his hospitality event, I had such a great time! The food the drinks the atmosphere was just great, he was very involved and answered all our questions, I had a little sample of the small eats such as duck fat fries and chipotle ketchup , shishito peppers, cheese and meats, eggs and pork belly and shrimp and grits... All was very flavorful and my favorite was the cowboy caviar!!! Aka BULLS BALLS lol... Best tasting balls ever! Also I had the Chardonnay it was very smooth... I had the Peter rabbit and jalaberry strawpeno!!!! I'm definitely going back for my 1 year wedding anniversary and my 30th birthday!!!

Ju5PHcoWEMpnNgn1x8OkUw.text: We were sat promptly and the hostess was very nice.  Then we waited and waited.  Finally a server showed up.  He was very nice.  We ordered drink and they were good.  We then ordered appetizers and they were expensive and TINY.  I know that appetizers can be small, but they were smaller than I have ever seen.  The server was not attentive, never checked in on us.  We constantly had to ask the bus boy to get him.  The sliders were 2 tiny burgers and were tasty,  the ahi tacos were the size of those deep friend mini tacos from the frozen section at the store.  They were just ok.  The Ceviche was good also.  The guy who filled the water glasses was fantastic.  We drank a lot of water since we had to wait so long for drinks.

3-u_nGKGtW707vnWkAP8hQ.text: Braised short rib, eggs & bacon, calamari, quinoa, and other things. I ate a month ago so I forgot. I just remember the food was legit. The service was impeccable.

8unXjaXPc_iOB-U5tblEog.text: This place is delicious. Great casual atmosphere and a variety of food. For appetizers we ordered an avocado/crab dip and calamari that were both amazing! I ordered the tuna, rare, and it was perfect. My favorite part of dinner, the milk and cookies(not on the menu, but you have to order!). The only thing that threw me off was that this restaurant is supposed to work together with Omnia and they are 2 completely different atmospheres. They do not blend well at all. Overall, awesome restaurant.

DdjB96AFPJbqQSmWrAgh1g.text: This place have mediocre food that is grossly over priced. There are much better options around the Vegas strip. The only plus for this restaurant was that there was no wait to get in while other places had 1-2 hour wait. Now i know why.

wxUIoSAz0cgKtH4dwdFfIw.text: Our server was quite attentive until we only ordered 3 appetizers, a soda and a beer (for 2). Then he seemed annoyed and virtually disappeared.  The food was great and our "small bites" meal was still $60.

issJBwkVseXPpa20Tr8kFw.text: Great atmosphere, wonderful bites of food. It's pricey but it's Vegas! The duck fat fries with the homemade ketchup were out of this world. Fries were so good they really didn't even need the ketchup! We also loved the swordfish dish and the braised pork butt was so beautifully tender. I recommend starting with the calamari "steak" appetizer. AMAZING

PufX_hxnL2Boz1gUWWLNjg.text: Check it out between 5pm - 7pm for happy hour, they have some great deals and the food was fabulous. I would recommend their duck fat french fries and hummus. The bread that they serve with the hummus was fantastic, it was warmed and oiled lightly. The hummus had roasted chickpeas mixed in, grilled lemon, and was spot on. The potions were good sized and we ended up having enough that we didn't need any dinner later. The cocktails can get very pricy here (15++) but again they had some great craft cocktails for $9 during happy hour so split some appetizers and take advantage of the deals. Love this place!

Gm1AQ3KdKNvl-gI4RjgNxg.text: This place is awesome!!!! Right next to omnia, if you eat here you get Into the club for free. Ordered the pork belly, chicken lollipop wings and short rib. The wings and short rib stole the show!!!! So delicious.

Zr44K7mZrDqJfHGbS5_38w.text: Dang good. Dannnnnnng good. Went with some buddies. All got different entres and all were top notch. Got beer braised short ribs. Beef was so tender i never picked up my knife. Did I say dang good? Lindsey was super on her game. Knew the menu, made the experience top notch.

J2lsU2rIarhEUl6blUR1rw.text: Expected everything in Vegas to be overpriced... but undersized portions with terrible service? Only at this location. We have these back home in San Diego and they're always great. Our server treated us like crap because we were savvy to their happy hour menu. We still ordered off the regular and he treated us with such hostility. We ended up paying another $100 at a different restaurant to get what we wanted

IoMtrCY3-sXkZjiKXsP6Lw.text: I had dinner and the food was great. Highly recommend this place if you're in Vegas. it's not outrageously priced and a good atmosphere.

cKmTR3_-11efCq41-9TflA.text: I recently went to Searsucker with some work friends and it was great time! The food was great, the service was great and the atmosphere was fun!   The best way to describe the food here is that is something that you will recognize. It's not like some of the other Las Vegas restaurants where you have no idea what the dish consists of. We just ordered a bunch of different plates and shared. The Calamari steak was great! Sweet and tangy and cooked just right! We ordered the Chef's salad and the field greens and pear salad. Very simple salads, with the right flavor. The entrees were the NY Strip, scallops and scampi. The Scampi stood out because it was large, grilled prawns on a bed of squash spaghetti. Never had squash spaghetti before and that was pretty good! Light and overwhelming but a very pleasant flavor. Scallops were awesome! Not much more to say. The NY strip was cooked just right and came with a red wine sauce. All in all a great set of entrees. Desert was warm cookies and cold milk! An old classic but still delicious! The deconstructed key lime pie was my highlight of the night. Didn't expect much from it but it was an amazing flavor (Does come with coconut)!  Mark was our server and he did a great job taking care of us. He even recommended some drinks that had the same alcohol so that our group wasn't mixing! That's attention to detail!

1yCd1RDqdjh4NrBcbkwgeA.text: I had the Cobb with honey mustard dressing and it was fantastic and the ginger smash was perfect.  I watched a few people order happy hour items that all looked great!   Service (mine was Philip) was laid back not too slow but not all up in your business either.  I would come back.

2ByApQTRC5mI2BNbWmIU0g.text: We went for dinner before a show after reading many good reviews and we're not disappointed! The food was delicious and the wait staff was incredibly kind and knowledgeable about bith the menu and pairing options. I would highly recommend this place!

aqXm6102c-K9lx9s8a-WFQ.text: Been twice now and think it may be one of our favorite restaurants. Service has been excellent both times and the food was delicious. Exceptional wine list and large appetizers can make a meal. Price is just right for the creations. I have never been disappointed by size for money. Highly recommended the Vegas location..........as for the Austin location, we'll let's just say I'm a car ride away and haven't been yet.............

JhLeqPAYab5Gmmd81RVNwQ.text: My absolute favorite restaurant in Vegas!  Great cocktails and food. The mango mai Tai is a treat. Love this place so much we came back the next night!  You can get oysters by the piece, they come with a pomegranate mignonette that pairs so well with the creamy oysters. The biscuits with butter and bourbon infused honey are delish. The steak tartare was creative and tasty. I had the bone marrow the second night and it was amazing!  Perfectly cooked and the sweetness balanced the slight bitterness of the crispy Brussels sprouts. The staff was attentive and knowledgeable - the manager came by the table each night to make sure we were happy with our food. I highly anticipate my next visit to Vegas so we can eat there again!

N8iPsoK5-xjrZtOwgtiK1g.text: Place is not worth the price. Way over priced food and drinks. Place has a strange atmosphere and customer service was truly lacking. It takes you forever to get your order in and to get anyones attention. Their menu is difficult to understand and servers are wasting time explaining everything to customers. High end restaurant pricing with casual environment. Save your money and go elsewhere for the money you will drop here.  Very disappointed for the owner to be a winner of Top Chef.  What a let down.  Walk around the corner from this place in the Casino to Bobby Flay's, you will be 100X better off for the same price if not lower.

-yxjj1aIidYO9K4fcT1_Jg.text: Man, I became so tired of spending a ton of money on lackluster meals.  This was one of them.  It's like this restaurant thinks they'll never see you again, because you're a tourist and all, so the food is meh.  It's like they didn't even really try and they want to be something they're not.  Our female server was a doll, however.

lDtjNkRmVD27KQxmJAculA.text: I have nothing but wonderful things to say about the experience here. From the moment you walk in to the moment you leave you are VERY well taken care of in all aspects. We were greeted by the manager, Ashley, whom was very knowledgeable about the items on the menu from the food to the cocktails and ALL of her recommendations were WONDERFUL.  A+ to you and all of your staff !!!  Thank You !

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6lV8UJeHz5V91YEERVFBZQ.text: So close to five stars! The succulent short ribs are too die for as are the vinegar Brussels sprouts and walnuts... But both were served barely warm.  Friendly service.$$$+

xPEkm-XzxCR8Idk-3cEqmA.text: We took a group of ten and ordered virtually every appetizer on the menu. The cauliflower, macaroni, fig toast, hummus, and brussels spouts were pretty good. I wasn't a fan of the bone marrow or pigs ears (though the guy sitting to my left was). The caprese was ok (my wife really liked it, though). The bread part of the caprese was burnt and too hard in my opinion.   If all we'd gotten were appetizers and it hadn't taken 30 minutes to get them, it would be a four-star review.   However, and just speaking for my main course, it was nasty. The waiter did a good job selling me on the special--a portion of the 75 lb. pig they'd just roasted. They brought me a pile of pork, yes, but it was cold and very grisly. I couldn't eat more than a couple of pieces. Very disappointing.   The atmosphere was also very loud, and although the waiter knows the menu well, he spoke too fast and in a rote fashion--clearly a result of having repeated the same thing too many times, so between that and the loud background (music in addition to other people), we had to ask him to repeat himself several times.   I guess when you spend over $800 on a meal, you expect the food and service to be excellent.

tpy3o98-0IOPVEyI9F654w.text: First visit to Searsucker in Caesar's Palace and it was a good experience overall. The servers were very friendly and kept an eye on our table to make sure drinks stayed full. The place has an open cafe feel to it which was nice given its location next to the Sports Book.  The menu was interesting and had some interesting appetizers that I'd go back to try. This time I had the Bone Marrow and it was excellent. The table tried the salmon and skirt steak which looked good. I felt like a salad and asked them to finely chop and toss the Cobb salad and it was also very good.   All in all a good place with friendly staff.

IVZqNSqSCbs7FS47WSF9zw.text: Definitely returning to this location- best service we received on this trip to Vegas.   Extensive cocktail list, very unique drink options. Our server Chris (wonderful server) recommended the PB and J old fashioned... I don't even typically order them and this cocktail was so delicious and different. (Pictured below garnished with a pb and j sandwich).  Boyfriend order drunken skirt steak- cooked perfectly, tasted delicious (he only let me have a bite :) ). Tender, full of flavor and so juicy!   I ordered the salmon which they do cook to the temperature requested. So nice tender but skin had a perfect crisp.   For appetizer we did order the cornbread muffins with the best tasting butter I ever had and duck fat fries. I'm a Midwesterner so requested ranch with the fries. "All they had was a house made bacon ranch." And the problem is?... it was delicious!   Ordered ice cream sandwiches for dessert with a snickerdoodle cookie. Delicious!   Foods great, amazing service! Wanted to speak with manager to compliment Chris and the staff but we were going to see a show. (I did send an email in case Searsucker does read this). Highly recommend! Will be back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Kdc1B5syqGHBS5KEieb_bA.text: We had our wedding rehearsal dinner with our immediate family here and were blown away at how good their food and drinks were. Their old fashions we're some of the best we had ever. We did not have one piece of bad food all night. The pigs ears were to die for as an appetizer. But the highlight was the cowboy ribeye, perfectly cooked and juicy for every bite. One of the best steaks I've ever had. We will be going back if we make another trip to Vegas.

Qy_as5Bf4HnXC7_iI1xwDA.text: Happy Hour review:  I came here for Happy Hour. To drink, I got the bad bad t-roy brown. I don't typically order cocktails but I really liked this one. I ordered two. The first one was great. The second was good but it didn't seem like it was muddled/mixed well enough. I also ordered the potato fries, pork chips and short rib sandwich. The portions were much bigger than I expected. Everything was good. The potato fries were great. I liked the chipotle ketchup. The short rib in the short rib sandwich was good. I think the bread was a bit too thick so it wasn't balanced. I ended up picking out some of the meat and the onions. The pork chips were good but I thought the sauce was just a tad too sweet. I think Seersucker is a solid choice for Happy Hour.

EPNttiOAtVZli2fQDo4IYg.text: Walked in around 6pm on a Friday night.. No reservation. 45 min wait or eat at bar. Bar it is. Bartender not overly friendly. Not  friendly actually. Calamari for app. Too much sauce. Bad texture. No crunch. Tomato soup with grilled cheese was good. I had the Cobb salad. Over dressed. My wife's salad didn't come. Mediocre bartender didn't get involved. Called her over. She said she'd check on it. I asked to have it boxed as we waited about 10 minutes for it and I was over the uncaring service and bad food.

BCZa-YD0T1azM5Yven4Naw.text: The wife and I dined at Searsucker on a Sunday night.  We had no problem getting a table for two at 7:30.  We started off with a round of drinks.  Searsucker's cocktails and house-made infusions were solid.  I had the Kinda Old Fashioned ($18) made with Jack Single Barrel whiskey, Montenegro Amaro, Ancho Reyes liqueur, sweet vermouth, old fashioned syrup, and bitters.  It was boozy and bitter with the right amount of sweetness.  The wife's Jalaberry Strawpeno ($13) was a jalapeno and strawberry infused tequila with lime and agave.  It was a nice, fresh take on a margarita.  For our food, we shared orders of the Blistered Shishito Peppers ($11), Calamari Steak ($16), and Fish & Chips ($42).  All of the dishes were tasted good to outstanding.  The Fish & Chips, a beautifully presented fried whole branzino with waffle cut, sweet potato chips, was excellent, but I felt a bit overpriced.  The Blistered Shishito Peppers were the closest thing to a miss for me.  They were blistered, but possessed a wilted texture that seemed like they were more steamed than roasted over a fire or in a hot skillet.  However, the Calamari Steak, thick cuts of calamari deep fried to a perfect fork tenderness and topped with a chili honey glaze, was the standout dish and the best fried calamari dish I've ever had.  Searsucker was a pleasant surprise.  Frankly, given the lineup of celebrity chef-driven restaurants in Las Vegas, let alone in Caesars Palace, Searsucker seemed to me to be somewhat of an afterthought, a backup plan restaurant choice.  Searsucker deserves better than that as they're easily Caesars' best bet for tasty comfort food.

8pP1l-EkzBVFCS88sEBAJg.text: If you want a smooth but settling drink I would recommend the skinny Jenny, very light on the stomach to cleanse the taste buds. We started off with the pickles and jalapenos, not too salty but a slight kick at the end balanced out the saltiness of a pickle. The calamari was amazing, the first bite had spicy tastwhich complimented the gamy taste of calamari.The chorizo corn has a citrusy first bite and the aftertaste puts in a slight kick that makes you feel like you are eating more than just corn. The short rib with the combo of the mashed potatoes and gravy melts in your mouth, the tenderness of the short ribs is off the chain.  I would highly recommend this restaurant if you want to satisfy your pallet.

geIYhCHHd0ZKNz-pf9OoPA.text: I read the reviews and thought the food would be great. Don't get me wrong, the service is phenomenal. The food however, for this price point, should be DELICIOUS, and it's not. It's just ok.

pJ_b3sIw4u0hx_uPVkdnNQ.text: Located in ceasars. We had made ressies and were promptly seated. Ambiance is beautiful - lots of wood and ropes channeling a very natural and warm space. I got a drink that was lychee and sake based and it was just ok. Normally those are my favorite type of drinks. We got the tuna poke as a starter and that was 5 stars!!!! The tuna was deliciously seasoned and loaded on a very delicate crisp seaweed chip. I could've eaten 10 more of those. For dinner we settled on the 2 lb lobster meal for two along with potatoes and Brussel sprouts. The lobster came out quickly and was perfectly grilled with a side of butter of course. My only complain is this meal will likely leave most people hungry. Most of the meat is in the tail which wasn't much and there's some in the claw. Thank god it came with sides. Both Brussel sprouts and mashed potatoes were good. For dessert we tried the bread pudding which came loaded with lit s'mores. Cool concept but the timing is pretty important here and the s'mores were very burned by the time the dish arrived at our table. It looked pretty carcinogenic so we didn't really touch it and the bread pudding was just ok. The dessert menu was pretty limited and the other 3 options were all cold. Would've liked to see a chocolate cake or something. Overall great experience. Apps and entrees seem solid. Cocktails and dessert are more of a hit or miss.

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JqcL_7iSejNvZcEgkHKpJw.text: Very happy with this spot. Came to Vegas during March Madness. So a spot to eat REALLY good food, have good drinks, and good service, and have good seats to watch the games....?! Works for me.   We came here for breakfast/brunch every day during our stay. At times felt like the service was a little slow. But the food was well worth the wait. The service was also incredibly friendly, personable, and knowledgeable of their menu. We did not have one bad meal their.  The pricing is not cheap. Not super expensive either. But hey, everything is over priced in Vegas. At least the food is so good, the value for the money spent redeems itself.   The booths fill up quickly, so I recommend getting a reservation if you have a group of more than 2-3 people. Otherwise, there is a pretty good shot you can walk right in and get a spot at a bar top table or at the bar.   Definitely a go to while staying at Cesar's /)

RFqFFAE38Jn-LutSP0ChmA.text: This place is located right next door to Omnia. We came here for dinner with plans to go to the nightclub afterwards. The food was surprisingly delicious! We ordered a bunch of different items to share amongst our group, and a whole lot of cocktails to get the party started early. I tried my friend's "Fizzy Lifter" cocktail and it was light, fruity and yummy! I would recommend that for any girls who like fruity drinks. My favorite item out of everything we ordered was the spicy hamachi and avocado! I don't usually do spicy food, but this dish was very tolerable. The guys also got the 36 oz ribeye tomahawk. Let me tell you--that thing is massive!!! They couldn't even finish it. Overall it was a wonderful dining experience.

wsuT-FZH7qwvFXN-eFyosQ.text: I love all the Searsucker locations. The San Diego locale is my favorite, but this incarnation at Ceasar's Palace is very good as well. The service is good, the drinks inspired, the menu totally solid, and the desserts make me not want to share.   The Tuna Poke & Shaved Taro Root was a great start. The Kale & Romaine Caesar salad is a good next step towards one of Malarkey's wonderful steak dishes. I thoroughly enjoyed the filet with smoked fingerling potatoes and a Honeybadger (and a Matador.) To finish, we tried the Chocolate Trifecta, and I think it's my new favorite.  I love this place and will definitely be back!

BSSpoTi95cdMwE9TmwymZw.text: The service here is some of the worst we've experienced. My wife pre-ordered the whole-beast feast as a surprise birthday dinner for us, her mom, and our daughter and her husband who we flew out to stay with us over the Christmas holiday. The pig was fantastic as were the sides! When we were almost finished, the busboy stopped by and asked to pack up the leftovers, to which I replied "I'm still picking at it, give me a few more minutes". Fast forward 10 minutes, and the waitress stops by the table, grabs the leftover pig (about 2/3) and hustles it away, not once asking about packing up the leftovers. So I assumed (incorrectly as it turned out) that she would have someone in the back do that for us. Well, after dessert she hands me the bill which included the drinks which were not part of the pre-paid pig, and left. 10 minutes later, I had to ask the busboy to send her back to the table so I could inquire about the leftovers. Her response was priceless, i.e. "Oh I think there was a miss-communication, and I tossed it". REALLY???? You tossed a $300 pig??? Anyway, I asked for the manager, explained the issue, and she tried her best to remedy the situation by comping our drinks and desserts. Still falls far from fixing what was supposed to be a special occasion. Food great, but in our case the waitress was nothing shy of incompetent!!!

_OqiT_czA1noGiVnuqxebA.text: I expected better, Searsucker!!  We came for dinner on a Sunday and ordered 3 appetizers, and 3 entrees over four people. The service was good, and our server seemed to know a lot about the menu and recommended some dishes that we ended up ordering.  Here's my report: crab cake jumbo lump + fennel + aioli - delicious  short rib "the harlot" + horseradish + fried onion - probably the highlight of the meal artichoke hearts + cheddar + mozzarella - this was a dip with poor execution - this is why. They gave us a very large portion of this cheesy dip with three pieces of bread. When we asked for more bread (more than half the dip left with no toast) we were told that they would have to charge us for it. pork butt - standard, nothing special butcher steak - did not try this, however the presentation was nice.  Sorry, but when you're spending $200+ on a meal I'd expect to receive a sufficient amount of bread to go with my dip.   Return Factor: None.

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork butt

mgrUt0B3YzDniHxr1lQYtw.text: A friend invited me to Searsucker for a late dinner on a Friday night. Our reservations weren't until 10PM, and the place was bustling when we arrived. We were seated within 5 minutes and led to a small table by a window. Our server and busser introduced themselves promptly and looked quite dapper, if I might add. The menu was filled with interesting choices, but the vegetarian selection was miniscule.   BALLERINA AND THE CZAR ($14): My friend started off with this specialty cocktail, which she said was tasty. I was content with my fancy glass of water. :) 4/5  HABANERO & CORIANDER PICKLE: This was FREE with our Yelp check-in. I hate pickles, so I didn't touch this small appetizer. My friend said they weren't that spicy, but cautioned that she has a heightened tolerance for spicy foods due to her Vietnamese upbringing. 3/5  CHEDDAR PUFFERS: Our server brought these out to us, and I assumed they were complimentary. They reminded me of the bread served at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant at the Paris Casino (except the ones at Eiffel are better!). I thought they were kind of bland. 3/5  QUINOA ($23): This was the only dinner entree option available to me as a veg head. I have difficulty describing this dish. My friend called it 'earthy' after she tasted it. I called it 'grainy'. It was a-okay. 3/5  HANGER BUTCHER STEAK ($32): She ordered the steak and loved it. Awesome presentation, too. 5/5  ERMAHGERD SUNDAE ($10): We shared this and settled on it mainly because the name sounded so hilarious. Not a fan, though. The brownies tasted stale and store bought. The 'gelato' tasted like regular ice cream. 2/5  VIBE: It was extremely loud inside the restaurant and difficult to carry on a conversation. The music was on full blast and the place was packed. I was yelling, not talking. As for the window view, at first we were happy to have the view, but that soured when guys waiting in line to get into Omnia next door began tapping on the glass window and gesturing at us through the window. :/ 2/5   SERVICE: Perfect! Our plates were cleared away quickly and we were checked on frequently. 4.5/5  Worth a Return Visit? I'm interested in trying out the Happy Hour menu but don't see myself coming back for dinner. I'm hoping it will be less rambunctious earlier on in the day.  YELP 100 CHALLENGE 2015: #176

mHfIHvmca1KcrZbODugGmA.text: went here for dinner one night and it was AMAZING! the service was great but the food was even better!!  we got the bone marrow, duck fat fries and some beer braised short ribs. it was literally like i died and went to heaven once i ate the bone marrow! it was so rich and sweet! the short ribs were so tender and melted in your mouth.. & you can never go wrong with duck fat fries ;)  would definitely recommend to anyone who is adventurous with food! i will be coming back when i'm back in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. from left to right: cauliflower, beer braised short ribs with mashed potatoes, bone marrow with brussel sprouts &amp; duck fat fries.

dhu0LPaTNWlJ4jfJnm9-qg.text: Wow, where to begin...  I was lucky enough to go to Searsucker with a large party of people. I say "lucky" because this allowed me to try a lot of different menu items.   First things first, though the seating and the vibe are perfect for large parties, the restaurant is extremely loud. Also, we were seated at a long, rectangular table, so in order to speak to someone across the way, you either had to shout or temporarily move seats. This made for a difficult dining experience conversation-wise.  However, I have relatively no complaints about the food. Though I would like to mention that I was tricked into eating a Rocky Mountain Oyster (bleh, yuck). For all of you sweet, innocent souls out there (like myself) that have no idea what Rocky Mountain Oysters are, please read the following statement; they are testicles. That's right. If the idea of eating such a thing makes you squeamish, then do not order the Cowboy Caviar. I honestly cannot attest to the taste, as my opinion is now completely jaded by the fact that I had never, ever wanted to eat bull testicles in my life. Ever.   Moving on; I personally ordered the Duck Fat Fries with Chipotle Ketchup. This was, of course, delicious because...well, because it's fries all done up fancy and such. I also enjoyed the smoky ketchup, and I'm not necessarily a fan of chipotle in the first place. Along with the fries, I ordered the Tomato Soup with Toast and Cheese (AKA, grilled cheese). Yum, yum, yum was it good. The soup is drizzled with some sort of pesto sauce on top. The grilled cheese is greasy, melty, and super-cheesy in all of the ways that matter. Finally, I also ordered the "Spicy" Shrimp Bacon Grits. And I died...from deliciousness. Wow. For all of you that are wary of spicy foods, I would say the spiciness level is "medium". It's slightly hotter than mild, but not too hot. In the picture I've supplied, it looks very different from how you'd expect grits to look but rest assured, they're there - under all that shrimp and sauce and delicious flavor.   As a party, we also ordered the Hamachi Tostadas, the Artichoke Hearts with Cheddar and Mozzarella, the Brussels Sprouts and the Scallops (entree). Of all of those, I particularly enjoyed the artichoke dip the best. It comes with cheesy toast, as you can see in the picture.   All in all, eating at Searsucker was quite the experience. I only wish I had heard about it when I was still living in San Diego, as they also have a location there. Hopefully Reno will get one eventually as well! It's definitely a must-try.  Happy feasting!

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Artichoke Dip and Toast.
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Hamachi Tostadas.
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Tomato Soup with Grilled Cheese

YZ5M0rISPBCvPKeJVBljIQ.text: Just okay. Service was pretty annoying. Either they wouldn't leave us alone so we could finish certain items, or we had to ask for every little thing. They bugged us constantly as we ate, then literally disappeared for 15 minutes after we finished. I cannot stand bad service when I'm paying at a high price point.   Best part - Short ribs with horse radish mash. So so good. Worst part - over cooked New York that the waiter held in 'better light' over my friend's head to show us that it was 'what we ordered.' So unprofessional and quite rude. My husband is much more forgiving and just ate it since the waiter argued with us about the degree of cooking. We were sharing so I actually didn't eat any steak. Thankfully my friends shared the short rib with me.   Pear goat cheese salad was good. Kale Ceasar was good. Mac and cheese was good. Butter potatoes were good. All was just good. Vegas, Ceasars Palace, Saturday nights....I want great for the amount of money we are paying.   I won't be back. Not with 100 other options in a 1 mile radius.

g6I40ZXlAQmLAeRmch0eIg.text: The staff was the best we had all week in Vegas! Great for watching March Madness games & the food was delicious!

PSi3nz-eR_jGDlSxJCQVdA.text: Went here for dinner last night and while the meal was ok, I was underwhelmed over all. Service was super mediocre. Our server did the bare minimum and had no enthusiasm. We split: Cheddar Puffers: tasty, these were complimentary and packed a little heat that surprised me  Duck Fat Fries: ok, nothing to rave about  Caesar Salad: I wanted some greens so I knew this wouldn't be too exciting but I needed a salad. I asked for dressing on the side and the waiter said it is very lightly tossed in so I said ok, as long as it's light. It was drenched in dressing. Ugh  Short Rib: Best thing we ordered- delicious and very large portion  Squid: Our waiter recommended this and I thought it was awful. Hated the sweet and sour sauce and whatever they put on the side (tasted like cream cheese) made it worse. Just gross.  Manhattan Cocktail: My husband loved the Manhattans here- he can be pretty picky so I thought I'd make note of that :)

kJGF0tTb-kKhIRrTjFgk5w.text: Spend $50 or more and it gets you into the omini no line.  Tapas: Crab cakes: too salty, fishy & the crust was soggy. Strawberry pecan salad: over priced Habinero  Pepper & pickles: too briny with a kick of spice. Bone marrow: nothing special, fatty oily marrow with onion jam over two tiny pieces of toast.  But getting into the club without waiting was nice.

EEmaG8J5VWFz6e2E0RO4Jg.text: So overpriced, but what was I expecting?! My girlfriends and I came here because an Omnia promoter told us that we can skip the Calvin Harris line if we ate here. There's an Omnia package on the menu if you eat $75/per person where you can expedite the lines. We opted OUT of that option and just ended up snacking here.  First of all, the shareable appetizers are not shareable. How am I suppose to split ceviche with someone when it comes on one tostada? R u dumb. Skip the beef tartar, skip the $20 crab cake, and just get a bunch of the mussels. Super tasty mussels with andouille sausage. That's the only thing I would come back here for.

fpxSRQm5v1mFK6FRLcSg1Q.text: Was going for shared plates menu. 6 person group with sometimes overlapping tastes. Menu offered nice selection of choices. Had 6 or 7. Ordered large plate of short rib. Prob favorite of group. Not sure why it wasn't busier since felt the food choices, quality and atmosphere and ultimately the location were 4 to 5 ratings in each category. Service was very attentive. If only had short time would recommend as food started arriving within couple of minutes.

x9Ias97gTuyZUBKS2RGgWg.text: A few nights ago my fiance and I wanted to have a quiet dinner so we decided on searsucker. Once the waitress approached she seem very genuine and pleasantly nice. She seemed to know the menu like the back of her hand. She mentioned a grilled salmon as the special that night and I went for it. She explained the entree with such details I couldn't say no. Once the salmon got to the table it was noticeably raw. If we wanted sushi we could have gone to a sushi restaurant. I asked the waitress if maybe I could get a salmon that was cooked through as this raw fish wasn't to my liking. She said "oh yea I forgot to tell you it comes pink" what?! Lol anyways once the second plate came to the table is was the exact same one that they took but only this time they they threw it back on the pan to warm it up and brought it back. By the way this is a "health code violation!" I was supposed to get a brand new salmon! Did you run out of salmon ? You had to bring me the same cut up salmon and drizzle a little sauce on the side! I was so embarrassed for them! Never again! Thanks for charging me full price $165!  Very classy.

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This Salmon is supposed to be a full filet. Waitress said&#34; we tried to put it back together for you&#34; what?

OZdmW5WaBeVFr4euuJV8uQ.text: Searsucker was a good restaurant.  Of the offerings at Caesar's, it is my favorite.  I had an amazing steak dish and my girlfriend's tuna was equally amazing.  I liked the decor of the restaurant as well.

n5VX-igDPxyBK-k58iIeUw.text: Love the interior of this restaurant. Gorgeous. I've been to the Las Vegas location twice now and really enjoy it. Also been to the San Diego one.  It's a shame I have never had room for dessert here  last night, I got the ahi tuna. Delicious. Wrapped in prosciutto and had a delicious sauce. The tuna was melt in your mouth good.

wjAC-hSvTBSh3VMNeMT3fQ.text: Upscale casual dining in Cesar's Palace done right. The food is creative and tasteful. A successful play on most american dishes.   Chef Malarkey who gained instant pop status from ABC's "The Taste" and various Food Network stints wins hands down with this upscale concept restaurant.  Fans are truly won over - at least this one and his wife, mom & daughter too!  Our Day After Christmas ambiance was cheerful and lively but not too loud. Dine in the back of the restaurant for intimacy, front for people watching and a big bar with TV's. You can also watch the kitchen operate closely from some tables in the middle of the room.  Our servers Tammy & Mark were attentive, knowledgeable and gracious.  Prices are standard (for high end Vegas eateries) between $15-$30 a plate.  Must Have Appetizers: Tomatoes & Burrata with sourdough toast Fried Eggs & Ham Warm salad   Must Have Mains: Shrimp with Spaghetti Squash Short Ribs & Mashed Potatoes   Must Have Deserts: ALL  Tip: Make your rez (like we did) and eat before 7PM to fully enjoy without the "packed & loud" scenario trendy restaurants unfortunately adopt.

uOcVu2aYBIThnuPbMVziwg.text: I popped in here because the hubs was playing Texas Hold 'Em.  I sat at the bar, ordered a glass of wine, did my Yelp check in, and poof, up pops an offer for a complimentary habanero and coriander pickle.  Never to turn something spicy down, I asked for it.  Well, shut it...that damn pickle rocked my world.  Spicy brine, nice heat, and um, hello, it's a pickle.  What is not to love about pickles?  Nice wines BTG.  Cool menu, creative flavors.

d0WFB0nkd-jsFlf8pU8T1A.text: Fantastic food! We decided to do a bunch of small plates. Disclaimer: these are not small plates! Definitely over ordered by 3 plates! They are a really decent size. My favorites were the short rib, the spicy shrimp and grits, and the beef tartare (with quail egg yum). I also had a cocktail called the czar and the ballerina. A blueberry/vodka/cucumber water/soda concoction. So good, not sweet, perfection.

OEsb88EYhjUthUp1StwXLw.text: Magnificent. The Jalaberry Strawpeno is the most amazing drink I've had in Vegas. Mac n Cheese is to die for as well. Calamari is done like no other. Service was rocking and wonderful ambiance.

x1Fo_De_0b7S6Lu5yEodHg.text: I was so happy to see searsucker in Vegas. It's my favorite restaurant in San Diego so I dragged the hubby to this location. The bone marrow, mussels, and duck fat fries were excellent. See my photos. I love the crab cakes in the SD location but theirs are really salty. I had a hard time eating it.

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone marrow in the back
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salty crab cake
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mussels!!! Another personal favorite.

wTtKOpSC5xez9yDQipSlHg.text: Jen, was amazing! She took care of all our needs l, remembered our names, and ensured our experience was next level

APr178PCfA2BpjahZKMxzw.text: A new place at Caesars palace right beside the new nightclub Omnia. Its a casual but above average restaurant, with both tables and bar seatings available. If you are by the bar, you can watch sports and ppl passing through the casino for fun.  Quality is also above average and affects pricing which will leave you around $30 for a main. Service is quick and in line with the concept overall, and handles your requests with a smile.  The decor inside gives a cool atmosphere and the open kitchen sets the right ambience for the room. Even though it can be a sports bar, you may not wanna go here if you want to combine a quick bite(read cheap bite) with sports.   I would instead consider this as a new fresh restaurant, where even though you agreed having dinner out, can get away with sneaking in some sports and still leave the place with a ring on your finger.

fxANiNjrqhRxe0lIyreSOg.text: So was very excited to try this place but it fell flat. The cocktails served were just ok, the game has been uped so much in Vegas on this front that these served were just boring and lacked any craftsmanship on prepration, service or presentation.   The food was good, not amazing, not phenomenal, it was good.   The bartender server was not engaging, didn't introduce self and staff on our way out failed to thank or say bye. I asked what their infused liquors were and instead of telling me their offerings she (the bartender) gave me the definition of infusion... sigh.

AZZMrvq4sMVc5lUPH-A2Og.text: The ambiance & food is perfection. We had a view of the kitchen & a clear view of the tv to watch the game. What more can I say than this is THE SPOT. My table had the short rib, mussels, shrimp ceviche, bavette flank, bone marrow, & lion "filet". Not a single frown at this table! Everything was delicious!! Our server was very knowledgeable & so was his assistant. Oh & I can't forget, a round of applause for their dessert menu. We each got one item..BOY! Was this the cherry on top to our experience. Make your reservations because I can see business booming for this hot spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone marrow &amp; Hanger

1hFIDm3DzArSgvhJhLIH4Q.text: I love the searsucker in San Diego so my friends and I just had to check out the Las Vegas one. It's pretty different but the experience/ambiance was just as good. I like how the lighting was dim. We sat at the bar for happy hour and each got a specialty cocktail that was so so...but once we started talking to the bartenders they steered us in the right direction. I would recommend changing the cocktail list on happy hour because the couple sitting next to us weren't very impressed either. We had so much fun with the two bartenders. Phill(?) and the blonde girl were so funny! it started our night off right. The girl told us about the wings, peppers and that tomato bruschetta type dish was a must have and she was right. So yummy! She explained how the wings and peppers were prepared because personally, I've never heard of them before and I'm glad I tried something new.

2jUPOgfV5v1Xy4fYCdDCPQ.text: Review is for happy hour at the bar.  I can't believe this is my first time back here since the YEE two years ago! We were seeing a show at the Colosseum and came a little early for some appetizers and drinks. It was surprisingly not busy for a Sunday night so we grabbed a seat at one of the hightops in the bar area. Our server Emily was right over to go over the HH menu and take our drink order.   HH at Searsucker has some great deals. All food is $9 and drinks are $4-8 depending on if you order beer, wine or cocktails. I had the house chardonnay for $6 and it wasn't bad. We ordered the duck fat fries, lollipop wings, sliders and ahi tacos.   The food starting arriving very quickly. The ahi tacos (3) came out first and they were fantastic. The ahi was super fresh and served in a wonton shell with limes and guac on the side. Next out was the lollipop wings. 9 wings covered in buffalo sauce served with blue cheese, carrots and celery. Another excellent dish. The fries and sliders arrived last. The fries were hot, fresh and crispy. Dusted with prosciutto and parmesan they were a perfect match for the sliders.   Although the sliders were our least favorite of the four apps, they were still good. Slightly over cooked and quite small but the flavors were good. Debating on getting another order of the ahi tacos the dessert menu was brought out. As soon as I saw the rocky road bread pudding I knew I couldn't pass it up!   The bread pudding was delivered with the marshmallows still on fire, melting on top of the chocolate bread pudding. With a side of fresh whipped cream and chocolate gelato this was an outstanding dessert that we quickly polished off. The food and service here is as good as when it opened two years ago and Im glad we came back.

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rocky road bread pudding
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert menu
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hour sliders

yZqLSm6rMLROnsgAidfdZw.text: great service!  Food: tried.... Chicken ... dry Mac and cheese WOW  LOBSTER YUM all steak was great Fish, scallops etc raw or cooked was good, cooked fish over done raw was a little fishy...all underseasoned.. all cooked greens and greens served with hot food were dead

6QGZWnZUKkF1y_2S3OcCgA.text: Ambiance is really nice with lovely decor and a good menu selection, but the server was very unenthusiastic, the portions were tiny, and the food was sub-par. We ordered the calamari, fig toast, grilled octopus, burger, and hangar steak. The steak was extremely chewy and disappointingly under-seasoned. The burger was nothing to write home about. Only thing that stood out was the fig toast - the grilled bread was toasted well, the cheese was fresh & flavorful, and the figs perfectly sweet. Wish this placed lived up to the great reviews but don't think we'll be coming back again.

YSB0KOvRA-TYEGQ0OlpUQA.text: Great addition to Caesars... Do not walk in w/out a reservation during meal times.  Beef tartare and biscuits were amazing, along with the short rib and desserts.  Only negatives were the service is hard to come by if eating at the bar and can be a little slow (but attentive). Once brought to our server's attention, Charles came over to help and he was an amazing server. The only other negative were the drinks were not strong.. which is sad because they tasted great!

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak tartare

MGzyVC1nkrMGgLklDN8x1Q.text: We came here on a Saturday night after we learned about the Omnia Nightclub deal. Basically, each person in your party must spend $50 and you will receive a "chip" that will allow you complimentary expedite meaning, you do not have to wait in line. Now you definitely need to pay to get inside the club, so this chip only lets you come in front of the line. Try and get on a guestlist by looking up on IG etc, then you may get lucky and receive complimentary entry as well. (We wanted to go see Zedd, so we used this chip and got on a guest list that gave us free admission until 1am; arrived around 11:45 and the club was already packed!!!!)  Anyhow, for the food, we had the tuna tacos and octopus for appetizer. Honestly, I expected more but it was very mediocre, not especially tasty or flavorful. For our entree, we ordered the lobster which was AMAZING. The lobster came with mashed potatoes and brussel sprouts that paired well with the lobster.  Would I recommend this restaurant? Probably not, but if you are trying to get into Omnia yes, I think it is a great deal.

xGyoIZ2DcHkiAA97MGZlzQ.text: Foods pretty good. Service is coo. Mac n cheese was pretty decadent, ceviche was yummy, the tako or ceviche was good enough and the ceaser salad was amaze

X5HtIvem92yF5O1buyLz7w.text: Where do I start? This place has a bar atmosphere but fine dining prices. The drinks are expensive and TINY!!! Ordered the 2 pound lobster for two- you would get more lobster meat in an 8 ounce lobster tail from Costco. And it was tough!  Service was friendly but just ok. Came here for a special occasion that was noted in the reservation but ignored. Had a really crappy table between the kitchen and the most annoying loud mouth woman ever. The place was half empty but they seated us by these people and she never shut up!!!  Miserable experience.

wcKlw5B-S-Hd7d7JWdvKng.text: I've been wanting to go here for quite a while. I loved Brian M on Top Chef so I knew that his food would be inventive and fresh. Reservations are a must for dinner.  I started with my fave, a dirty martini. Very well made. Perfectly dirty, like I like it. :P  We were a group of 7 women so we all had cocktails and for food starters, we opted for the raw choices of poke and ceviche. Devine. Served very rustically on wood boards in mason jars. I kind of like the presentation....it was cute and unexpected. But the theme is throughout the decor as well, so it fits.  We moved on to share the calamari (and ordered another as it was THAT good) and the shishito peppers (just like everywhere else).  I ended with scallops that were wonderful and a few others had the salmon or steak. Everyone was pleased and satisfied.   This is a great option in Vegas.  It's a bit loud, but it IS in the casino. And of course, as most places in nice Vegas hotels, it's a bit pricey. But if you are out for a decent meal in a cute setting, definitely try Searsucker.

Liwp2Cgk8KLBdhYu7dXTJg.text: In vegas for NYE and stopped in for happy hour here and was blown away by the food. I wish I would have gone back every single day I was in town for the bone marrow, the macaroni and cheese, and the short rib. every.single.day. I love.. LOVE macaroni and cheese. Not the thick baked stuff with crusty breadcrumbs on top.. I'm talking about luscious silky cheese that is thick enough to coat your tongue and every aspect of the pasta. They used pinwheel pasta and it was so unique yet so perfect and original at the same time. The cheese sauce was perfect.. salted wonderfully and with a depth of the best cheese taste. I could drink it! The short rib fell apart with just a touch and was also seasoned very well and the bone marrow was like meaty butter slathered on the perfectly toasted bread that it was served with. Don't miss out on these items if you are in vegas! I will definitely be checking out their other locations as well!

O1BSFdZNjS19URc_d5SjaA.text: I picked this restaurant for dinner with friends last night because I had heard that it was a good place for gluten-free dining. I have celiac disease. I felt confident that I would be okay because there is a blog post on the restaurant's website talking about being able to accommodate gluten-free and to let the server know and they would help with the menu and inform the kitchen to take special care to avoid cross-contamination. After we were seated I told our server I had celiac and would need help with the menu. He was not very interested in helping me and even said "you can read the menu and pretty much figure what you can and cannot eat."  To start, we ordered the tomato and barrata. I confirmed with our server that it came with bread and asked for that to be served separately so that my non-celiac friends could eat it. When it came out the bread was on the plate not separately as I had asked. I had a couple of bites of barrata that was on the side of the plate without bread but that was all I could have because the rest touched the bread. There is no way the server informed the kitchen of my dietary restrictions. I should have stopped everything at that point but we had already ordered all of our food and two of my friends had ordered the hamburger which they only make 20 of per day. We had also ordered the yellowtail crudo but it never came out and just decided to forget it since our server was so inattentive. It was clear he did not want to be there.  I had the salmon which was over-cooked and the entire dish was way too salty. I could only eat half. My friend's scallops were also too salty. My other friends that ordered the burger said it was fine but nothing special. For the prices, none of this is acceptable. It was very disappointing and now I am sick today.

9sbTPut40-_naZF-1WXg4Q.text: Not super happy. First they sat us at the bar and was so loud my colleague asked them to move us. Then I ordered a medium rare steak and it was super rare so I had to ask them to cook it a bit more. My colleague noticed the table next to us ordered 3 steaks and 2 got sent back. Then, when a person refilled my water, he didn't even realize that he splashed a significant amount of water (much more than a few drops, it was like a little puddle) onto my plate/steak. My colleague suggested I ask for a new plate because my steak was getting soggy, but I was with coworkers so I didn't wanna be "that guy" so I just sucked it up.   I don't think I would come here again.

1OfWuVaBUha9y5Lto_6LJQ.text: I'm lovin this place!! Currently sitting bar top, I walked my butt all the way over here just for the Cali creamin beer. Which is my favorite beer. Making it just in time for happy hour I ordered the chicharrones (pork rinds) I must say, They were absolutely tasty!!

bx5GaSktwOUSh9KkG5F2aA.text: Came here for my break and let me say this place is a must stop when dining in Vegas. Had a reservation at 5 pm right when they opened as a co worker had a total rewards voucher for $15.00. If you have one read the fine print as this particular place isn't part of the program. Regardless we stayed and decided to treat ourselves. We both ordered the burger which only 20 are made. Once they are done they are done so come early! Upon talking to our server Caesar he really hyped this burger up telling us it's superb and that even the ketchup is made from scratch. Needless to say when it came it was everything we expected. The fires were just the right amount of salty. Soft but not soggy. The burger was amazing! A must try for all those who don't want to be disappointed. The only thing I will say is they serve Pepsi. I know for many like me it's a deal breaker but they do serve Sierra Mist and water.   I also want to add aside from the amazing decor and use of abstract lamps their restroom is so clean it was such a pleasure to walk in to a restroom with the same decor and liveliness.   Will be coming back with my co worker again and bring family too!

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZblF-tmhRl-N5zvR2kdErg.text: Very unorganized for the amount of money paid for our group. This was not the VIP experience we had in our heads going into this event. One server for at least fourty people was not good planning. For VIP we had a stool for a table. It was all an afterthought. The manager did attempt to correct the situation. He put us at a table where we did have a great server. Food was ok. Some hits and some misses. It's hard to do all you can eat service without a buffet. The drink menu was embarrassing at best. For that price tag 8 drinks on the menu and some beers is disgraceful. It was all good in theory,just poorly executed. Most likely will not be back.

K9we-804o1irUJWq22KtCg.text: Five stars for the food! The shishito peppers are my absolute favorite! We ordered  the Brussels sprouts as appetizers,  and we fell in love with both sides We have a location in my hometown so I'm super excited to try it out!

iq5zdcsALbwkMS3sZz7AEg.text: Located in Caesar's Palace, this amazing find rocked my socks off.   Ambiance: from chill at the bar (that has a ton of seating) to elegant dinner for two.  This place covers the spread and their Happy Hour specials are pretty cool too.   Service: excellent. I sat at the bar (party of one sadly) but the bar staff was a blast to chat with and quite knowledgeable about the menu.   Food: you MUST try the octopus ceviche! If you like octopus. The tuna poke also rocks my socks off but I'm partial to seafood ;) if you like habanero...you might want to try the habanero pickles! A bit of a bite but delicious.    No matter what you're hungry for this place has it. Steak, lobster, oysters, muddled, scallops, chicken, wings, fish tacos...the span of this menu is impressive and quite tasty.   If you're in Vegas and have some cash to spend...roll this way and check out Seasuckers!

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful bar set up
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hour!

7dZelHfyR6eeq4bo7ZD0XQ.text: The menu didn't have a lot of options and the waitress was not very helpful. Definitely not worth staying for drinks and dinner.

wMKY6e-LB9oRXD1B8Ya1Pw.text: After finding several bars downtown were closed for New Year's day, we went back to the strip for happy hour.  Searsucker is a southern influenced gastropub, with a really great happy hour featuring $9 Old-fashioneds and $2 oysters (not just the standard bluepoints everyone is giving you nowadays.) We also had sliders and bone marrow ($2 per bone at happy hour.)  The star of the visit was the fried pigs ear. They are cut into small strips, marinated for hours and then lightly fried, for a more delicate texture than you're expecting. They are deliciously salty with an appropriate hit of tartness.   The oysters come prepared with a mignonette of micro mint and pomegranate. Each oyster rests on a thick salt bed, which we viewed as a little fussy. I also took off the mint leaves as they interfered with the oyster flavor. The pomegranate, on the other hand, is a great pairing.  The old-fashioneds were prepared classically and well-balanced. This is definitely the best choice for happy hour in Caesar's Palace and perhaps the entire Strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oyster presentation.
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is the star of Searsucker: fried pigs ear.
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Believe them when they tell you to come early.

WGVhb1qB4gKgBzGckrn6YQ.text: We first tried this place as part of a Absinthe/Searsucker dinner package and it was so good, we came back the next night. Everything we tried was excellent and the Happy Hour menu is really awesome. You need to try the burger (only 20 made per day!!) and the Yellowtail Crudo is outstanding. The service by everyone, but especially our server Tyler made our nights!

_yMWLWlOGhcyy9A1pREoVA.text: After spending many hours researching the best place to eat Thanksgiving dinner in Vegas, we wound up here completely by chance and had hands down the best turkey meal of our lives (sorry grandma, but it's True).   Once we got to town we noticed that EVERYONE was doing a holiday dinner. Prix fixed menus were constantly in our faces, and we felt overwhelmed by all the different choices. Should we keep it casual, find a swanky place and dress up, hit a buffet, hide and order room service? The last one was starting to sound very appealing.   We were sitting across the way at the Alto bar watching the Cowboys game, when I spotted their sign advertising $50 a person for an all you can eat dinner. Wanting to be done with the search I asked around our table if that would do, and we all agreed to pull the trigger and make the reservation so we could relax and get back to the game.   We came back that evening expecting to find a buffet setup with long lines, but instead were treated to a practically empty restaurant and sat in an intimate candle lit booth. Our waitress brought out waters and not even 10 minutes later we all had the piping hot thanksgiving special plates sitting in front of us.   We were given the choice between white, dark, or both cuts of turkey. Each plate also came with mashed potatoes, green beans with crispy onion strings, fresh cranberry sauce, and sausage stuffing. Because we were feeling gluttonous, we also started with the $5 plate of biscuits with whipped butter and honey. HEAVEN!  The turkey was incredibly tender (I refuse to use the M word but it was), the mashed potatoes creamy and rich with the addition of the sour cream sauce on top, the green beans fresh, and crispy onions on top deliciously salty...just man. It was delicious.   None of us really cared for the cranberry sauce, but that's usually an afterthought anyhow. I'm just as happy with the canned stuff if I'm honest and theirs was a little too citrusy for me. And while I enjoyed the sausage stuffing, I found myself missing the meatless version so that it wasn't in competition with the turkey.  Truly dynamite meal though. We all got seconds (some even thirds, don't judge) and left blissfully dreaming about getting back to the room and changing into stretchy pants.  It was hard to determine what their normal cuisine is as we saw deer antlers, fish bones, and ropes decorating the room but honestly? I don't care. I would come back anytime and would be happy with any plate they set in front of me. It was absolutely delectable and worth every freaking penny.

nL3nrD-bLUukuzsyMLF7sw.text: This is a happy hour review! Prices listed below are happy hour prices as of 4/29/15.  The Skinny: excited to try their happy hour menu items and they are all pretty good albeit not without flaws(3.75) service is prompt and efficient at the bar(4) value: portion sizes are very generous for a happy hour menu and the food is solid for the most part. Service was good at the bar. (3.75 bump up to 4 starred review)   FYI -  signage is poor in Caesar's Palace so it is hard to find.  Searsucker is tucked away close to the sportsbook and next to the Omnia dance club.   We were totally jived to try out Searsucker's happy hour menu. We got duck fat fries ($4), the farm bird lollipops, the Caesar salad, the Strawberry/goat cheese/walnut salad ($6 each),  the tuna tartare,  the squid ($8 each), the crab cake and the short rib ($10 each). We were slightly disappointed that the burger on the online happy hour menu was gone but with their sizable menu,  this was easily overlooked. We were surprised but the serving size was very generous for each of these dishes especially the aforementioned $10 items and the two salads. We probably won't order that much again knowing how big the servings are.   Here is the run down:  Duck fat fries with tomato jam ($4): satisfying with a nice smokey flavor from the tomato jam. The hubs would have preferred a slightly crisper texture but I found them to be pretty good in that regard. Would order again.   Farmbird lollipops + hot sauce + Bleu ($6): these were more like chicken meatballs on a skewer. The flavor wasn't really hot per se. It tasted more like sweet and sour rather than hot sauce like -  kind of like Swedish meatballs. The Bleu cheese flavor was rather muted. Overall, this dish was a bit too sweet for my taste.  Pass on this.   Strawberry + champagne + goat cheese + walnuts ($6): get this! Delicious and lightly dressed,  the flavors married beautifully together. Protip: the goat cheese is adhered to on the bottom of the plate so make sure you give a good scrape before you dig in. Portion size is generous and could easily make 2 side salads.   "Caesar" romaine + kale + egg + parm ($6): okay Caesar. Honestly, the dressing did not have that  garlicky, fishy (from anchovies) punch and missed that hit of acidity in the end. The dressing was a bit too salty as well. Serving size again was very generous and could easily stand in as a light meal on its own. Would pass and get an extra strawberry/goat cheese salad instead.   Tuna + radish + taro + spice ($8): pretty good but it is still tuna tartare. The spice is very mild. The tuna was pretty tasty and good quality and worked well with the taro chips. Would order this again depending on the mood.  Squid "sweet heat" ($8): the good -  exquisitely tender squid that melts in your mouth, delicious sauces; the bad - dressed too heavily with the Thai chili sweet sauce so we lost the crispness of the fried batter. Overall would be better if both sauces served on the side to maintain the crisp exterior layer. Good dish but needs some refinement -  maybe order again with the sweet chili sauce on the side to see if that changes the dish.   Short rib "the harlot" + horseradish + fried onions ($10): very good portion size and easily could be a main entree sized meat portion. Fork tender short rib with a hit of horseradish near the end.  Served over mashed potatoes,  this is a very comforting dish. Personally I thought the gravy could use a little more acidity but that I think is more personal taste. The hubs wolfed this dish down. Would recommend.   Crab cake jumbo lump + fennel + airlines ($10): if you like crab,  you will like this. Lots of crab meat in chunks with minimal filler. A tinge too salty,  it worked well when mixed with the aioli and a good squeeze of lemon. Would order again.   Overall,  our dishes were very good in general and portion sizes for a happy hour menu are very generous. There is enough variety to satisfy most people,  sample some good eats for a reasonable price (for the Strip).  Service was excellent at the bar -  our water glasses were promptly filled and check taken care of quickly. Food arrived swiftly to the table as well. A solid 4 star experience.

_c8h57RT51GZunnDMdXzAQ.text: Visited Searsucker for dinner our last night in Vegas. Service was incredible and the food was savory! The atmosphere inside is super chic and relaxing. Great for small groups. We shared the NY Sirloin with a side of spinach. The steak was cooked perfectly and paired perfectly with the spinach.

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. NY Strip...they offered to slice because we were sharing

ySq3-JJDLJasy_PE-tnQ4Q.text: I have always loved every dining experience I've had at Searsucker whether it was the gaslamp, northern San Diego or Vegas location but this one in particular was my absolute favorite.   The food tasted more delicious somehow but could be courtesy of all the drinks I had which by the way, are incredible. I love spicy drinks and the jalaberry strawpeno was fantastic. We also got a bottle of wine and the Cabernet was probably one of the best I've ever had.   Appetizers:   Pork belly + egg: Get it. Don't even think about it. Just do it.   Mussels + chorizo: If you love mussels, you must get this. The small pieces of chorizo and sauce go so well together and the mussels are super soft.   Bone marrow: One of Searsuckers' rival (in my opinion) is Whiskenladle and I know their bone marrow dishes get compared all the time but honestly, they're totally different. Searsucker's bone marrow has some sweetness to it and the brussel sprouts that come with it tastes so good so don't skip it! It's not just decoration. Haha.   Entrees:  Tomahawk: If you are considering any of the red meat options, get this one. Let me say it again, GET THIS ONE. It's the most expensive thing on the menu but I promise it'll be the best ribeye you'll ever have. After the first bite, you won't even remember that it costs 85 dollars. And it's ENORMOUS. I always complain about 12 oz steaks being too small but our table of 3 meat loving girls couldn't finish it.   Filet + lobster sauce: This dish is great on its own but after having the tomahawk, it was really nothing special and that's saying something because it's delicious.   Brussel sprouts + walnuts: I don't even like brussel sprouts and thought this was SOOO good. So much flavor and doesn't taste like its a vegetable at all.   Deserts:   Smores bar: I'm not a huge fan of the smores combo but this one was different. Everything went together very well and the ice cream is amazing.   Milk + cookies: So simple yet SO good. They put sea salt on the cookies which enhanced the flavors and the cookies are so soft.   Now for the best part about our night, our server Chris was the best!!! How he managed to deal with 3 very exhausted but energetic and delirious dental sales girls is beyond me and I'm sure he is some part super human. He took such good care of us and really made our night super memorable. I would've given him a hug if it were appropriate to do that with your servers. Haha. If you could request to be sat in his section, I would definitely ask.

EeL2WuLZ6u7jN-uvGJlymw.text: Came in on Friday night without reservation and were seated right away. Nice staff and service. Had steak, octopus, bone marrow, Brussels sprouts, and bread pudding with ice cream for dessert. All was delicious. Also duck fat fries. Pricey but normal by Vegas standards.

N00VyromPUBURYxH_S9I5Q.text: So, funny thing....I have recommended Searsucker San Diego to many friends, who have loved it. But I have yet to go myself! So, when a location opened in Vegas, I knew I had to check it out.  First things first - park in the Forum shops valet or self parking, both are convenient to the restaurant.   The restaurant was easy to find. If you continue past the sports book and poker room, you'll see Omnia and Searsucker is just next door to that.   Note that they are only open for dinner (currently - not sure if that will change). They do offer a decent happy hour menu Monday - Friday.  The decor is very rustic and warm. When you enter, there is a large bar area with booths and seating. I was surprised at the size of the restaurant. While not small, it was smaller than I expected (in a good way). I love the open kitchen concept and that there is actually seating at the counter.  Here's what we had for food:  Duck fat fries with chipotle ketchup ($10) - REALLY good. Do yourself a favor and order these.  Shisito + ponzu ($7) - They say about 1 in every 10 is really hot, so be careful! I got a hot one and survived, but I love spicy stuff. There was tremendous flavor on the peppers and I'm glad I tried them.  Egg + Bacon "pork belly" ($19) - This was tasty as well, although the bacon was a bit too thick cut (IMO).  Cowboy Caviar ($11) - I've had Rocky Mountain Oysters before (at Coors Field) and swore to never try them again. Although, they were not properly prepared there and these were PHENOMENAL! Really, really good. You would have a hard time believing that this wasn't a fancy chicken nugget.  Shrimp "spicy" + Bacon grits ($17) - Delicious! I am not a huge fan of grits, but these were well made. The spicy shrimp was really delicious and basically the star of the dish though.  Beet salad ($16) - I've had an obsession with beets lately. This was really good and I especially enjoyed the fried goat cheese.  I would say that it's best to get a bunch of plates and share. The main entrees are on the high end, pricing wise. We were all happy with the smaller plates.  We also had a couple of signature cocktails, which were good. The beer list was decent, but nothing spectacular, which is a bit disappointing for a restaurant based in San Diego.  They will be offering a late night menu, on the nights that Omnia is open. I would expect this place to be a total shit show on those nights! The staff were all super friendly and knowledgeable, and Chef Malarkey was quite nice as well. I look forward to going back soon for a visit and trying some of the things we didn't get to try this time!

DoguBriiryjO3QT3sBv1_Q.text: Food was pretty good, but service is literally awful. I showed up a bit earlier than my party, so I had a drink at the restaurant bar from the happy hour menu while I waited.   When my party arrived, we sat down and asked for a happy hour menu, but the waiter told us that they only do that at the bar. I was incredulous. They were going to make us pay FULL PRICE for a drink that was $6 less FIVE FEET AWAY AT THE RESTAURANT BAR. A friend asked if we could walk to the bar, grab a drink, and come back, and the waiter said we could. So we did that twice. So stupid.  During our second WALK to the restaurant bar from our table to get drinks for our party, my friend ordered from a male bartender: 2 "Snakes in the Grass" and 1 PB&J old fashioned. While the bartender was making them, a female bartender came over and I ordered 2 "Snakes in the Grass" and 1 glass of white wine. 6 drinks total. I noticed that the male bartender stopped making the three drinks my friend ordered from him. The female bartender brings over just 2 "Snakes in the Grass," and I tell her "we asked for 2 more of these." She responds "oh so you ~did want 4." This was extremely annoying because we clearly put in 2 separate orders, but apart from that she was obviously unsure of whether we wanted 2 or 4 "Snakes in the Grass," but SHE MADE 2 INSTEAD OF ASKING, DESPITE THE FACT THAT WE'RE STANDING 1 FOOT AWAY. Mind you, this wouldn't be a problem if they offered happy hour menu AT OUR TABLE 6 FEET AWAY.  THE CORNBREAD HAS BACON IN IT, but that ingredient isn't listed on the menu. We ordered cornbread as an appetizer, but when it came out we realized that there was bacon in it. The vegetarian in our party is the one who ordered them, and we also had a Muslim friend in our party who doesn't eat bacon. The waiter did NOT tell our party there was bacon in it because he forgot, and he mentioned that this issue had come up before. We asked to exchange for the biscuits.  My salmon was good. The drinks were good. It does not excuse this terrible service.

s7WboEWrG07N6yDQlZ07iw.text: We chose this place because my husband wanted a steak, but we were unimpressed with other steakhouses' reviews and lacked any formal attire. We thought we would give searsucker a try and were pleasantly surprised.  Menu is reasonable, and we started our with potato fries (cooked in duck fat, side of chipotle ketchup). They were fantastic. The ketchup was too hot for my liking, and overpowered the subtle duck flavor, but my husband really liked it.  We ordered the braised ribs for me and the prime New York for my husband. The ribs came on a bed of mashed potatoes with 3 onion rings on top. The potatoes were supposed to be horseradish, but good for me they were not. The first bites were magnificent and I would absolutely get them again. Tender, rich, and flavorful!  My husband ordered his steak medium and, unfortunately upon his first slice discovered they had turned it into beef jerky. The waitress apologized and brought it back. She then returned to inform us that they had no more New Yorks. We expected the worse, especially since my husband really had his heart set on a steak. To our pleasant surprise, the waitress said the head chef was very sorry and that we could order anything as a replacement, suggesting their most expensive steak, a ribeye. Given the opportunity, my husband opted for the Tomahawk ribeye. A 36oz behemoth with an equally sized price.   I don't have all the words to describe the Tomahawk. It was amazing, melt-in-your-mouth, savory steak. That is what steaks should taste like. It's hard to fathom the $145 tag, but if you have the desire or a special occasion, do it. Do it. It's huge. It's fantastic. It's memorable.  The staff was good, the food was excellent, the atmosphere was great and they have an extensive beer and wine list, plus fun specialty cocktails. We will definitely return!

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The tomahawk...

fTMJtRGojYwApwkexnWQMg.text: One of the many, many places just around the corner within the giant maze that is Caesars.  Went here for happy hour.  Had about six small plates.  The spicy shrimp ceviche was excellent.  The artichoke heart cheese dip was not good (the artichoke hearts were tough).  The mushrooms were a little dry.  The duck fat dipped fries were nice and the ketchup had a little kick in it which was nice.  The shrimp remoulade was pretty tangy.  Overall, a nice place to get a bite right after work.  And our server was named Caesar; although I suspect they are all named Caesar.

q61I7UjIAqHXUPKa3tUdpQ.text: Absolutely wonderful food and cocktails!  The ambience is contemporary with a touch of industrial.....really cool.   Lobster was good family style but not a lot of it.  My favorite dish was the bone marrow....all the tastes of salty and the sweetness of the marmalade with the cilantro made for a flavor explosion in your mouth.   Try the jalapeno margarita....we ordered 3 each!  Enjoy and your welcome!

6DyNKWy4odYP9luNQB6Sxg.text: Thoroughly enjoyed our experience at Seasucker.  We made reservations for 8:15pm but needed to push that last minute.  Searsucker was quick to make the change without issue.  We were sat immediately when we arrived.  Our server warmed up after a couple of visits to our goofy table.  Strangely, some drama found Searsucker that night.  As cocktails were being delivered a young lady and her boyfriend started shouting at each other and ran into the back area of the restaurant.  This high level of tense arguing continued until security showed up to usher them out.  Searsucker handled it perfectly.  The good was awesome, best mac-n-cheese I've ever had (that's a BIG statement).  I would go back right now if that were an option.

hCMlnmQbg5-zRjp8PHxu7Q.text: I was waiting for my parents while they were gambling in the casino. I sat at the bar and tried to get the attention and service from a tall woman/young lady bartender. She had a Raiders t-shirt on so I asked her if she was from the Bay Area or if she was a fan. She replied with a no, then mentioned to me that she was from LA, then walked away. I had to wait for another employee to ask me if I would like to place an order for food and drink. I was treated and welcomed nicely by a gentleman bartender and sat by very friendly patrons. If management is reading this, I would offer her your love until  she learns to love herself. I will pray for her. God Bless.

bRT-OV3JlwRW-pXT8rvWuA.text: One of my favorite experiences. A friend invited me and I got there late and everything was almost completely devoured. What was left and that I was able to eat was incredible.  Woooow. Will visit again.

e50Fx_r_VdvqtoDDqZzLXw.text: Hostess was rude and very unhelpful. Server was non personable and slow. Food was just ok. Had the pork butt and it was not the best. The bussers were the nicest and most friendly.

9SPMJeuuT0Aaw5NFntasFA.text: What a great food!!!! OMG! We ordered so many things of the menu and absolutely everything was top notch. And what a cute waiter...^^ Also, if a person spends $50 you get a no line chip to get to OMNIA. Good deal for this amazing food and drinks!

2ApewP_b1T2ox1-QeuPmMg.text: Looks good great atmosphere & great service. However our food was enough to where we were not hungry which is normally perfect for me. I don't like waste and oversized portions. I had the steak cauliflower it was decent flavor and I kept my calorie count in check but seriously there was nothing but mashed up gooey looking tomatoes served with it. No sides whatsoever to compliment the dish. The spice chicken my husband had was flavorful but he ate every morsel and also had nothing but tomatoes on the side which he does not like and didn't know they were part of the dish. So basically we are saying we felt like suckers for choosing Searsucker :( wine list and prices not fair definitely overpriced and I'm not referring to overpriced as expected.

kB2NpK9eYN2_MmeQLCgHCQ.text: We tried this for dinner tonight and i can honestly say we left with a wide smile and very impressed!  Everything is fresh, in other words the design is nice, the menu is appealing, the staff and and last but not least the food was really good, I highly recommend giving this place a try, it has earned my return business for sure.  We had ahi Tuna and squid (a cool way to serve essentially Calamari) with sweet and sour sauce and remoulade both super fresh and delicious. For entre hanger steak with fingerling potatoes, also perfectly executed.  One other thing to note is the fact that the entire menu is a good value and not overpriced.  Long story short we will be back.
