QbbwFBBnh9_xL98E1pa0QA.text: Underwhelming, to say the least.  My hubby got 3 oyster shooters and all them had shells in them, not just a few shells (this is expected) but a mouth full of shells.  My wine had something floating in it and the happy hour sliders were so disappointing. The saving grace was the bartender, she was super sweet and genuinely concerned about our visit. All in all, save your money and move on if you're looking for delicious food.

qvOQIcI1IZ7JWpxg99xFig.text: Service here was terrible. Bartenders were incredibly rude and unresponsive. Asked for happy hour items and got a bill for normal priced items that the bartender claimed I ordered. No thanks.

OV-RSsQi6o5w5eFrnQzbbA.text: Searsucker has given me a new reason to visit the strip. As a native, I tend to avoid the area. This restaurant makes you feel right at home, and takes you away from Vegas just for a moment. From the hospitality, to infused liquors, Searsucker has won me over in every single way. My first trip here was a Yelp event, where of course we were spoiled. However, when I returned for a ladies night with Jessie B., we were still spoiled! The chef sent out a complimentary dish when we first arrived which really set the tone. The service was stellar beginning to end. And the food, let's talk about the FOOD!  The salads are so fresh, I literally could eat every single one of them. The crab cake is the best crab cake I ever have tasted. That particular night Jessie and I shared the special, a fettuccine made in house topped with fresh pesto, shrimp, and mussels. WOW. My mouth waters as I type. I could see the chef from where I was sitting and he seemed so passionate when plating our dishes. You could tell they really care about what comes out of their kitchen.  After our meal we went to the bar to try one of these amazing cocktails. I went with the Bad Bad TRoy Brown, and I only needed one! It was strong, but perfectly made. The bartender warned me that it was not a weak drink.  The manager even came by the bar and spoke to us, mentioning happy hour. Speaking of happy hour, I need to plan a trip back here, and soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brie with peach preserves
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chef salad, so good!
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab cake

4TdeBcXBB2qMn4ochLSYig.text: Fabulous!  I recommend ordering tapas style to try many dishes.  We all got to try so much more this way. Loved the braised short rib, ceviche, mac n cheese. All incredible.  Didn't save room for hot chocolate chip cookies and milk, but ordered them anyway. No regrets! Service was excellent, but rarely saw anyone smile. That was the only thing missing.  I highly recommend this restaurant and can't wait to go back again.

Tvb4O7mSL05FCCEICTxPeA.text: came here for a private cocktail event. great atmosphere. It is right next to Omnia so it was the perfect place to go before hitting the club. the cocktail was amazing and the hors d'oeuvres were great. tried its crab-cake, sliders, lollipop wings, and tomato & burrata. I find the lollipop wings to be on the salty side but everything else was great! slider is extremely delicious. i would definitely come back again.

S9KGWIDgU3-6RkAOi7CuDA.text: You are sooooooooooooooo yummy! All the apps were amazing, but the entree was a thumbs down. This could have almost been 5 stars. Portions are pretty big and service was good. Also even though I made reservations, they sat us at these very high tables by the bar. I am having a family dinner and it got super loud. I think it would have been better by the kitchen on regular tables.   I picked this place because it's inside the Cesar's Palace right by the sports bar and we were going to watch Celine Dion (amazing show btw-a must see!)  Now for the food:  spicy hamachi & avocado, fresno chili / cilantro / oil-comes in a jar. Was't too spicy, but the hamachi was fresh and goes well with the wonton chips  beef tartare & sourdough,capers / mustard / egg yolk-also comes in a jar with wonton chips. Perfect amount of seasoning.   blistered shishito peppers ponzu / sea salt-something I just love to eat so I have to always order this if I see it on the menu. Thumbs up  bone marrow* fresno chili bourbon glaze-i'm not a fan of bone marrow because it is too fatty for me, but this was amazing! best dish of the night. The crispy brussel sprouts that it comes with gives it that nice texture. Spread the bone marrow on the bread, top it off with the sprouts and some cilantro and you have the best thing you've ever eaten!   mussels* chorizo / chili / cilantro / corona-they give alot. make sure you dip the mussels in the broth to give it that extra flavor  duck fat fries-crispy and delicious.    beer braised short ribs,horseradish potatoes / crispy onions-this was their signature dish and it was so disappointing. Lacked flavor, was dry, and we told the waitress. She did offer to make a new one, but we were so full and didn't want another one.   Stick with the appetizers only!

wAwDrVnq5Obw_oF7MAWdYQ.text: First time at Searsucker and it did not disappoint. Get the classic old fashioned, it is a great drink especially if prepared by Heather, a great bartender.  Get the burger and chipotle ketchup. Only 20 burgers are sold/made daily and it's worth every bite. Great place, great vibe, and great people there.

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LxRgTDtgLZUgpX4lavpftQ.text: Conveniently located near Caesars Palace Casino, we stopped here for a small dinner and it was perfect. I had the duck fat fries and Brussels and my husband, at the recommendation of the server, Ordered the scallops. Scallops were tender and the creamy sauce was delicate. The Brussels sprouts were roasted in a wonderful sauce, I could've done with the walnuts. And the fries were an enormous order of fries, perfect with Parmesan and bbq sauce! Their Mai Tai (don't judge, I was on vacation) was a unique recipe including lime juice and almond syrup! Loved it. Only took off one star for the server that was very overwhelmed and the place seemed severely understaffed for the night. He did great with the recommendations though.

nVmjdh6-m1A8ccSpODikNQ.text: How great is this place?  We had a fun and memorable experience here the other night thanks to the servers and chefs!  No easy task with nine people (one of them my dad who ranks EVERY restaurant "marginal at best." Lol)  Our personal favorites were the quinoa, short rib and chocolate chip cookies. But honestly, everything was delicious.  It's always fun when the staff enjoys being there, nothing is a problem and the meal just flows.  Love the vibe and we will be back for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States

F-ujDtswn0rF6KiIyB0UGA.text: I can't say enough about our dining experience at Searsucker! The staff was absolutely amazing- friendly, funny, knowledgable, and extremely attentive. The food was out of this world good. I opted to get a few starters as my meal because I just couldn't decide on what to get. The cocktails are equally as delicious as the food.   When we were planning our trip, this was one of my top choices, and it didn't disappoint. We started with the shishito peppers, which I would highly recommend. I got the bacon and eggs and the brussel sprouts. My husband got a steak and asparagus. He's a picky eater and not easy to please, and nearly a week later, he is still talking about how great the food was. We shared the cookies and milk for dessert, and it was such a fun, cozy way to end a fantastic meal.  The open kitchen only adds to the experience. You can see, hear, and smell your food being prepared, and it's such a treat.   I can't wait to come back!

cFGqkq3qVllZdH1CEBx6lQ.text: Amazing happy hour and burger. But, get here early because they only make 20 burgers a day!

w8uZj6GySYIpI8S6aHuvUQ.text: Dinner and drinks with our son and daughter in law and friends.  Fun place.  Located in Caesars.

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AKmS35LN5CifU1xqxtEZ_w.text: Searsucker? That is quite a different name though don't be fooled by it. This restaurant that labels itself "The New American Classic" has quite the bit of flavor packed into it. The appetizers, entree, and desert was a delicious and full-filling meal. Let's now eat our way into "The New American Classic" Searsucker. This fabulous restaurant is located in Caesars Palace in the casino section.  The first appetizer I sunk my teeth into were the lollipop wings ($18.00) these were some of the best wings I have ever had. The lollipop style they were served as were brand new to me however.  Genius! I exclaimed they were perfect; the meat all on one end was a masterful idea for dipping. They were smothered in buffalo sauce; they were spicy but not enough to scare me away. They were served along with a blue cheese fondue that was creamy and went great with the lollipops of a carnivores dream.  Next I had something very new to me and straight from the sea. These were raw oysters ($3/each) they were served in a bucket of ice and served along with a pomegranate topping. They smelled very fresh and fishy almost as if they just netted and prepared them right then and there. From a bite they have no flavor but with the pomegranate topping gave it a sweet flavor and made them easier to go down the pallet.  Then I went on to my favorite course the entree I had beer braised short ribs ($35.00). They were served along fried and crispy onions ring all on top of mash potatoes smothered in gravy. The ribs were tender and I could cut they with just the edge of my fork. The mashed potatoes were very light and fluffy and went with the meatiness of the ribs. Onion rings I love to death however the ones I have were a bit too greasy for my taste and I wish they were a bit crispier on the fry.  Last but truly not least was the desert crafted in my dreams three ice cream sandwiches ($18.00). Two were served vanilla and one...CHOCOLATE!!!! (those who get that sponge-bob reference you are amazing) there was a side of whip cream, Nutella, and mocha cream. The cookies on the sandwiches had that great homemade taste and the ice cream tasted freshly made. The chocolate sandwich had these wonderful chocolate almost coco puffs placed around it. The Nutella had a great chocolate punch and the whip cream was great. The mocha cream however was a bit strong but great on the sandwiches.  Ah! America the home of the brave and free with some of the best food you could taste. Searsucker is only a bite of what you can have here and is a great first stop. Warm and filling the food is just like its decor a truly great foodie stop.  Let's see where my taste buds take me next!

SKbzFWgmdZYO4N5cP3Whqw.text: Great service, food was amazing! Coming from San Diego we were delighted to see a familiar spot located in the heart of Vegas. It did not disappoint.

oXbr4BdB7dQIzxTt34ewhQ.text: I decided to try out their happy hour on Christmas eve and was pretty pleased.  The drinks were really good and the bar tender made sure to let me know the first one I wanted was not sweet and kind of strong.  Her service was really good and she checked in just the right amount of times. The fries were fantastic and everything a fry should be.  Crispy on the outside, nicely seasoned, and the sauce a compliment.  The fish tacos, however were not all that great and a little on the dry side.  They could have really done with a little sauce on them.  Still, I will give it another try.

-HRVtPwSFQ4CGblbxBnEMA.text: Amazing dinner with a group of friends!  The drink selection was spectacular as well as the food choices. We had 5-6 appetizers they were all good but my favorite was the the bone marrow.  The bone marrow was soft and silky accompanied by an array of different garnish to only accentuate the taste!  I had the short ribs, truly amazing maybe one of the best I've ever had with tangy mashed potatoes.   I can see this for both a group or date night!

NiSVjpq_WtAV_IO6Q454Rg.text: I'm a complete sucker for Searsucker!! Unbeknownst to me I've eaten at the Searsucker location in San Diego, but that experience failed in comparison to the one I had here in Vegas. Let me begin by saying the staff and their customer service was on point!! Shout out to Adrian and Phil who made our dinning experience at bar top absolutely awesome!! Every staff member we spoke with, whether they took an order, dropped off food, or simply checked on us was super friendly and pleasant. Kudos to the Hiring Manager.   Now for the scoop on the food...ahhh the delicious food. I tried three entirely different "Smalls" aka appetizers:   The calamari was a thicker cut, almost steak like, sans tentacles. I really appreciated how meaty and satisfying it was. If you're a calamari fan this is a must try.   My favorite dish of the night was the Mussels and Chorizo. Talk about mouth watering flavor. Thick cut cubes of chorizo marry perfectly with the fresh mussels to great the BEST tasting broth I have EVER eaten. I swear you could drink the broth as a soup.   The third app I devoured was the Mushrooms and Burrata on Texas Toast. As someone one who LOVES mushrooms and cheese this was my dream come True. Although it was a tasty dish, I was so obsessed with the mussels that it fell kinda flat it terms of flavor.   I decided to wet my whistle with their signature Ballerina and the Czar cocktail. It was light and refreshing. I think because it is mixed with cucumber water and because I chose to sip it slowly the ice melted which made the drink taste super watered downed, but my new friend Adrian added a splash of Sprite (per my request) which brought it back to life.   Overall it was a GREAT dinner/evening out. I will certainly be returning to sample more delicious dishes and to check out there pretty stellar Happy Hour menu!! You got me Searsucker and I'm not at all mad at you!!

Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushrooms + burrata + toast
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ballerina and the Czar...vodka, cucumber water, blueberry honey, lime, and soda

UKpcXa_iMyOVGNZDZP7Kug.text: Second time visiting Searsucker and this place has gone downhill, bigtime. We arrived with no reservation to grab a quick bite and were told the wait was over an hour for a table. Seeing there were plenty of vacant tables we hopped on opentable and made a reservation for 15 minutes later. The hostess wasn't thrilled about this, but I'm not sure why she didn't just accommodate us when we arrived.   Since we had 15 minutes to kill we figured we'd sit at the bar to pass the time. After being ignored for at least 5 minutes a bartender approached us. He took our order and we then were approached by three different bartenders asking if we had been helped yet. Again, weird. Needless to say, we ditched the table and just decided to eat at the bar.   Appetizers arrived in less than 5 minutes. Awesome, but it definitely makes you feel like nothing is prepared to order. Either way, our salad and tuna poke tasted great.   Then we waited for the entrees.   And waited.   And waited.   We asked three times and each time the response was "oh it's coming right up"  After 35 minutes we had to leave for an event so we asked to close our check and were charged for our entrees that we never recieved. Weird.   We let the bartender know we never received the entrees so we didn't want to pay for them. He said "oh, sorry" went and adjusted our bill and dropped it off without saying anything. After he ran our card he dropped it off and said "Thanks guys!"  Honestly, not something I would expect from a restaurant like Searsucker. The entire experience was irritating enough that there's no real reason to return. When I go somewhere to eat, I generally hope to at least be served my food.

6e80rTWsOgI2rTh47cveEQ.text: This is one of the best restaurants I've ever been to, hands down. The hanger steak is to DIE for. Amazing atmosphere as well. Well done.

H-5hEM6kwoVLl1_fGiKPzQ.text: You need to try this place and if you have go back!!  The staff was great. Eric was our waiter and was spot on. Had the opportunity to meet nick, asst GM, was a pleasure. Really s class operation. The food was great. Crab cake is straight crab meat.  The calamari steak with apple I wanted all to myself. We had other dishes and I enjoyed a Peter rabbit drink.  Best part of the night, milk and cookies. Can't wait to bring more clients and friends back. My go to for Caesars!!

4jiFDz9mFZa1gobhRZ26Wg.text: Pretty good place on the strip. Drinks are awesome and happy hour specials are perfect. Give it a try if you're nearby.

6NTs-abtKGAJlO4iCMLcZQ.text: We are a group of 12, and agreed that it was the best meal any of us had enjoyed in a long time. The steaks were tender and flavorful and scallops perfectly tender. Do yourself a favor and order the mashed potatoes, cauliflower and mushrooms as sides. The duck fat fries have a zing to them. Amazing!!!!!

wfmBJk-Y9tBhSL4BnjXUUg.text: We stumbled upon this restaurant in Vegas while walking towards Omnia Nightclub at Caesar's. The club was not open yet and we had about 1 hour to spare so why not a little grub before clubbing? I had actually bookmarked this place before our trip so by faith, we ended up here.  The dining area was nice but we just sat the bar and got a bunch of appetizers to share and a specialty cocktail for each. For grub, we had Crispy Pig's Ears w/ cilantro, lime, sea salt, the Duck Fat Fries w/ parmesan, prosciutto, herbs, and the Bone Marrow w/ fresno chili bourbon glaze. Both presentation and taste were on point. Ears were crunchy and tangy. Fries were perfectly crisp but the Bone Marrow was the clear winner. It was so tasty and slimy in very good way. Wish we ordered another one. For drinks, I tried the Snake in The Grass made w/ cucumber gin, bruised mint, lime, and soda. It was well prepped, refreshing and strong. My buddy got the Japanese Manhattan made w/ Toki Japanese whiskey, sweet vermouth, orgeat, sake, and bitters. He let me have a sip and it was also good and potent. Sharable apps start at $5 to $18 and specialty cocktails average about $14.  Sear Sucker was a great find in Vegas. Reasonably priced tasty food, well prepped strong cocktails and nice bartenders. Definitely a good spot to have dinner or pregame before a night of clubbing or gambling.

XU4IB7PJEzAtSKmqAAt_HA.text: Seersucker is a case of "just fine" food in a great location. They're in a prime Caesar's location and offer (for Ceasars) pretty reasonable prices.   We made a reservation and I'd advise you to do that, since Searsucker seems rather popular. It's a good sized space with modern furniture and a menu that encourages sharing. We started with corn muffins ($5) and hot damn!!! these are some tasty bites - a bit spicy, full of bacon and served with sweet butter. Yum!   For dinner, I had a Cobb salad ($16?) which was ok - I asked for dressing in the side and never revived any at all. See: service, below.  My dining companions opted for more meaty choices and seemed happy. Our side of mac''cheese ($16) was overly salty but used wagon wheel pasta which made me happy.  Service...yeah, not the best. Our server was honestly kind of bitchy for no reason. I didn't get a side of salad dressing and didn't want to ask because she was attitude-y Judy & I didn't want spit infused ranch. I'm guessing with a different server this place would be 4 for me.

UdSnsJVEeHMyA3cuJhq6vg.text: This place is amazing!! I love it sooo much every time I come here I'm never disappointed with anything. The only thing is I wish sometimes the waiters wrote down their orders even if it's only two people my man and I order a lot and the last couple times they forgot one dish. But other than that the service still is great!!! And the food omg where do I start! The biscuits are a must!!! They take a while but super worth it. I always get the ceviche it's spicy just how I love it. The oysters are good super small but good! We also got the sliders they are ok I wasn't a huge fan but my man loved them! Lastly the tomato soup is a framing must o love it sooo much

9dUv9gQRx13VPaCgSvxDJA.text: What a bummer. Took some friends back after a fantastic first-time experience at Searsucker and ended up with some major disappointments.   What was still good: Most of the food, ambiance, drinks.  What I learned this time that I didn't know last time: Happy Hour pricing is a gimmick and only available at the bar.  What slipped this time: - The duck fat fries - for lack of a more eloquent way to put it - sucked. It was my FAVORITE dish and I was so eager to order it again. I was the uber hype woman for this dish. Imagine my disappointment and frankly embarrassment when my friends tried it along with me and found it to taste exactly like normal fries. No more savory/umami flavors. I asked the waitress what's up. She said they switched over to fresh not frozen fries recently. I'm not a food chemist so I can't say if that affected the taste of what but it was night and day. I would not order this again. - The buffalo wings are midget (ahem, I mean 'size challenged'). Super duper tiny. - Service. Our waitress was present, but sometimes we had to wait awhile for her to come around, otherwise we didn't see her at all. May not be her fault in a busy part of the restaurant. She was also brusque and a little sarcastic, which I didn't anticipate given the warm service we received the first time by someone else. - Website says you can get complimentary entry to Omnia. We asked about it on the way out. Turns out you need to buy a certain amount of food for each complimentary entrance, which is reasonable. What bemused me was that it took them about 10 minutes to sign off this perk for us. Required a manager's approval so we had to wait.  Don't know what happened this time, but the allure definitely faded. If this was my first experience at Searsucker, I would not have returned.

jqJC7WZeRMe5SEbdpBT_MQ.text: Searsucker was good but I had higher expectations for it, being inside a casino on the strip. The service was good but not excellent. What upset me the most were the drinks. I got a mixed drink and the proportions didn't seem right and tasted horrible. The other guests at my table ordered different mixed drinks and had the same result to the point where none of us finished our drinks. The food was actually tasty and well-made. I enjoyed the scallops and their version of the Mac and cheese. Would come back again to give it another chance on the drinks.

KaIF03q1NQnvgtZxN0eR7A.text: Cool atmosphere but very mediocre food. 1/2 the filet mignons we ordered were overcooked, but it's overall just inconsistent:/   Service was good, but I think this place is better for small groups, not 6 or more.

nNpsr-KZutynBJB38WXROQ.text: Great food, nice environment with in the craziness in Las Vegas.  There was an issue with one of our entries and the manager took care of it without questioning.   Not a lot of room to accommodate large groups but they made it work.

dqkwaQRfX2RO5ZoOG32_AQ.text: Had dinner tonight at Searsucker as part of a small group. Both the service and the food were outstanding! I started off with the field green and pear salad that was one of the best salads I've ever had. For my entree I had grilled scallops that were superb. I was a bit disappointed to only get three however they were really good. We decided to order one of each of the. desserts for the table to share and they were all very good. If I had to choose one I would say the Rocky s Road bread pudding followed by the cheesecake were my favorites.  Highly recommend!

CGUxzl4O3n6TnsRNFB-jtg.text: World of Concrete week. Walked in, No wait!    Waiter was very informative, stiff drinks and always full.  Yellowfin is top notch.    Steak cooked to perfection.   Calamari is different but good. better than 80% of coastal seafood restaurants on the east coast.

dYOWGgZTtTAX3CCiA4Nk8g.text: One of the best dining experiences in Sin City.  Caveat: we ordered only appetizers and three servings of the same entree.  Spoiler Alert: Everything was perfect.  For starters, we ordered the short rib, calamari, shishito peppers, fried pig ears, buffalo wings, and fig toast.  For the entree, we ordered THREE of the same burger.  (Why three?  Because they only make twenty per day!  So we tried to corner the market... joking.).  So back to the food...  The notable plates were definitely the pigs ear (unless you are vegan or vegetarian). The ears were crispy, seasoned nicely to pair with an IPA or lager.  On the other end of the spectrum was the vegan fig toast which had a sprinkle of salt and pepper to liven up the flavor and lightly lathered with honey to qualify it as a potential dessert.  The burger was confusingly good... smoked, touched with BBQ sauce, melted cheese with some grilled peppers. Why confusingly good?  It was a bit of every perfect burger I've had but I just couldn't put my palate on which one...  it probably had bacon in it.   The wings were "cute" because they were so so small; however the texture was excellent and the buffalo wing sauce was tangy but not overwhelming. As for drinks, Searsucker won't disappoint.  They boast an award winning Old Fashion, along with a good list of beverages.   After all, it's Vegas.  With all the restaurants, Searsucker won't disappoint. I would give it a five star but like all Vegas restaurants, it's a tad over priced. Nevertheless, if you are in Vegas, near Caesar's and crave some new American cuisine, check out Searsucker.  It's cool, different, and wiling to push the envelope.

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oh the deep fried pig ears... sounds &#34;different&#34; but so good
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short ribs
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ready to tackle the menu

_UZRz-F4jC8NuSbKmAD3ew.text: Grilled Cheese and Tomato Soup - SPOT ON.  This was a creamy tomato soup and the grilled cheese was gooey white cheddar on a fantastic sourdough.  The two were in perfect proportion - not too much of one or the other.  I'm a simple girl and this was probably my favorite dish.  5/5  Calamari - chili honey glaze and apples.  Very tender and tasty.  The flavors were good and it was one of the best calamari dishes I have ever tasted - the meat was not even the slightest bit rubbery.  The waiter recommended this and it did not disappoint. 5/5  Charred Octopus - ginger, sesame and sour orange.  I would not recommend this dish - when they say charred they mean very charred.  We couldn't even eat the terminal end of the tentacle because it was like eating a crunchy stick. 2/5.  Roasted Cauliflower - pickled chilis, pine nuts, citrus.  Cauliflower is pretty much the only vegetable that I like and this one was TERRIBLE. Flavorless and almost slimy.  Do not recommend. 1/5.   Bone Marrow - fresno chili bourbon glaze.  Compared to the other items on the menu the price point for this was excellent at only $15 (at most restaurants the bone marrow is significanlty more expensive than the rest of the menu). It was good but as always a small portion.  5/5.  Came here on a Friday night with my coworkers while at a conference.  We were seated at the booth nearest the entrance so it was open to the casino area.  I actually don't recommend that exact location even though the booth itself was comfy and the perfect size to accomodate lots of food dishes while still permitting conversation.  However, we didn't really enjoy the ambiance of the restaurant because we didn't get the lighting and music because we were so exposed to the walkway.  However, overall I very much enjoyed the dishes and drinks at this location, besides the few misses as listed above.

3WKWLNluO7JBImptlyt24g.text: BE AWARE OF FOOD POISONING with NO REFUND. The four of us went to Las Vegas for a family trip. For dinner we went to Searsucker and ordered seabass with salads.  Within 30 minutes of consumption, all four of us got severely sick with major diarrhea. We had tickets to a very pricy show right after dinner and we each had to run to the closest bathroom twice during the show. After the show, diarrhea still continued till the next morning. I called the restaurant right away so they will be aware of the bad dish and not to serve it to others.   Talked to the manager, Ashley Oglesby, she apologized and said she will call me the next day to see how we are all doing. Well, she never did. I got the feeling that she didn't believe me, since she kept saying it could've been from what we ate for breakfast. Not so, since we were totally fine all day long.  When I followed up in a couple of days I was told to fill out a detailed and lengthy questionnaire form and maybe eligible for partial refund. It took me 25 minutes to fill out all the questions and in return they sent me back the wrong paper work to fill out again for partial refund that I never received. For me, it is the principle, the way we were treated, misled and accused. They deserve a big fat "O" star for ruining our family vacation.

p3GADwDchwW74cCb0Yrkdg.text: My weekend dinner experiences with Searsucker have always been on point.  Although pricey and the service can get slow, Searsucker has always delivered on food.  Service 3.5/5 Their service is like Pizza. Even when it's bad, it's pretty good.  I've had some amazing experiences and other times where we had to find our server throughout the evening.  Everyone has always been consistently friendly with great vibes from previous visits.    Food 5/5  Everything I've tried at Searsucker has been a great experience.  Presentation and the quality of the dishes have always been top notch.  Here are some of my faves: Beef Tatare & Sour Dough: A Searsucker staple for me, the egg yolk brings this home   Tune Poke & Shaved Taro Root: Always fresh poke Lollipop wings: you heard that right, wings.  Their sauce is at another level, I'll order every time. Bone marrow: Just pure bliss and good times.  Highly recommended Beer Braised Short Ribs:  Ribs have always been tendered and very tasty. 36oz ribeye tomahawk: Fun to share, fun to eat and fun to share on social media  Value: 4/5  The Searsucker bill adds up quickly.  The "Jars & Sliced" dishes and sides are in the high teen price range and you're going to want to sample many.  Signature dishes and the grill stars around $30 and goes as high as $155 for the bomb 36oz ribeye tomahawk. The Signature dishes portions are very large.   Get ready to throw down some cash for a great and unique food experience  Ambiance: 4/5  It's a place to see and be seen when you dine here.  It's a very casual neo 1800s seersucker vibe with brick walls and lights hanging from ropes.  Every weekend dinner experience had people socializing at the table for long periods of time.  The dishes were designed to be shared so everyone is enjoying their food experience together.  This is a catalyst to socialize at the table, throw in some drinks (for us a lot) some music and you're having a great time quickly and the hours pass.    Expect to spend some money but bring your favorite foodie friends and/or drinking friends as you're going to be sitting down for awhile.  It's a great place to catch up over some great food in a loud but fun and social restaurant.  Expect to see some attractive people eating and pre-gaming before they hit up the Omnia nightclub next door.  I believe they still offer expedited entry (literally no wait) into Omnia if you spend a certain amount but verify with the restaurant.  It's the best and easiest way to get into Omnia if you don't have a host.   Enjoy...

a7s_u8IsdHsVbgp-BIYcVw.text: Came here based on a mix of Yelp pictures and their menu offerings. Our Party of 9 had an 8pm reservation and was seated promptly. I was actually surprised the place was only half full and felt a little concerned I made a poor choice in restaurant especially since it was on the expensive side. However, it turned out I had nothing to worry about.  I split the Chicken Cobb salad and Mac n Cheese with a friend and both were super delicious. Especially the Mac n Cheese. And the portions were surprisingly large we couldn't finish either. Also tried their Habanero & coriander pickles which were free with Yelp check in and as strange as they sounds they were actually really good.   it wasn't happy hour but they had 2 drink specials going for the night. A cosmo and a "bay breeze" which was basically vodka and tropical juices. It was tasty and on the strong side for only $8/ I came in expecting to spend over $100 but between the drink specials and portions large enough to split I managed to come in under $60, so just know this place doesn't HAVE to break your wallet. It's also right next to Omnia so well placed for pre-turnup meal and drinks. I will definitely be returning in the future.

v3rsk8UQ5afgRlwcup0pQQ.text: Food here was really good, but super pricy. I really liked the tuna tare tar the best. It was so flavorful and tasted perfect with the crispy potato chips. We got free pickles with a check in with yelp. It was good, but super salty, so you have to eat it was other things in your meal the balance out the saltiness. The portions were small, so we had to order a lot of food and it was so pricy.  I felt like our server was awkward and forcing us to order things off the menu that we didn't really want. I probably would try other places when I am in Vegas again.

phGapcL_O-jKsqUpB76EHQ.text: Great burger and Mac and cheese. Good drinks and service was spot on .  Great company and great time.  Absinthe was the Best show in Vegas!!

C5d8DwO8Q_B6TChFjVVf9w.text: Hubby and I visited during happy hour a few weeks ago and had a fun time! All of the food on the happy hour menu is nine dollars. Personally, I think this is a little on the expensive side, so I went in with higher expectations. All in all, things were just fine.   Duck Fat Fries - 2/5 Perfectly fine fries. But I couldn't taste the duck fat at all.   Blackened Tuna Tacos - 4/5 I'm not usually a fish fan, but I actually loved them! Hubby, who ordered it thought they were only ok.  Mac N Cheese - 3/5 This isn't on the Happy Hour menu and was $18. The portion is definitely large enough to share and considering what else we'd ordered we couldn't finish it all. However, it wasn't $18 exciting. I could've used even more Cheese and I don't think I saw a trace of bacon the menu claims.   Another HH menu item that someone near us ordered were the sliders and those looked pretty good. Maybe we should've tried those.    The good thing is the service was attentive and friendly and the decor is super cool. Depending on what you want, this might be the place for you.

whRyM3gUZJscjxdxqu4pMQ.text: First time- Great wine and food. I didn't take pictures of the apps but I highly suggest the. Calamari steak and duck fat fries. I had the 6oz filet medium rare and it was come to perfection. The creamy kale added to the flavor, which a happy mouth. My friends 2lb lobster was fabulous. It was juicy and easy to open up and eat.

ZybGWjolAy9p-u4iUj9Erw.text: We really enjoyed dining here. We shared a few small plates. The crispy pig ears were thinly sliced and crunchy like little pieces of pork rinds except a little leaner. This is a very nice bite that just makes you want a good drink. Speaking of which, I had an excellent cocktail called a Paper Plane made with bourbon. It was boozy, not too sweet, and just a little citrusy. I wish I had had another! The short rib and horseradish mashed potatoes was excellent. The best dish was two large bones with lots of marrow, crusty warm bread, and a little parsley and brussel sprouts salad. I could've have ordered more of this alone and several drinks and left there very, very happy. The only thing we did not like was the fries cooked in duck fat. A few on top of the pile were crispy and tasty, but the rest was soggy with excessive grease and lacked salt. The ambience is festive at the bar during happy hour. We sat at a table, but I think I will sit at the bar if I go during happy hour next time. If you prefer a quieter dining experience, sit at a table. The service was excellent.

DsjJjwSra0Ln26lVNa17Ig.text: My friends and I stumbled in here through our adventured on the strip, and across the board we were all very pleased. The beef tartar was absolutely delicious and the free habanero pickles that we received from checking in with yelp were great too. For our dinners my friends ordered the beer braised short ribs which came with fantastic mashed potatoes,  the braised pork butt, a few salads and I personally ordered the Seersucker burger. The burger was one of the best of recent memory for sure, a little salty but over all delicious. If you are looking for a place to grab a bite, check them out.
