Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The seersucker burger was delicious, and so were their fries and chipotle ketchup
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hDbK82443VKHF7y0e6aeJA.text: Went on a Saturday night.  Service was good, not great but good.  We did the chefs recommended Apps for a table of 7, all of which were great!  Those were eaten quickly.  Entrees were pretty blah, seemed to be missing seasonings.  I would say check with place out for apps and a drink, I'd skip dinner.  They had Calvin Harris playing at the night club next to the restaurant so it was extremely loud and noisy right outside the restaurant.

OpqExpAK7VfcRn9dA_B1iw.text: We always go here on a Vegas trip.  The drinks are we'll crafted.  Service is great.  Sit at the bar overlooking the kitchen if you like to people work while you are having fun.  I flipped them a hundy last time in (I was on a roll and shared the wealth.)   For something festive and different, have the bone marrow followed by a bourbon shot down the funnel.

OWp8GBMZHLutAtNk0Hs6tg.text: This is a must if you are going to Vegas. The delivery was flawless both in the service and the food. We started with Beef Tartare & Sourdough, Hummus & Toasted Pita, Biscuits and Calamari Steak. For three that was a ton of food. The Tartare was a huge portion and wonderful taste, the Hummus was perhaps the least exciting offering but still good. The biscuits were to die for and you have to use the infused honey, you'll want a bowl! The calamari was served in steak finger fashion rather than old boring rings and again the sauce was excellent. We then ordered a filet, short ribs and fish and chips. The fish and chips get served as part of an art deco arrangement of the whole real fish, very impressive. The short ribs were so soft you could have cut them with your napkin and the filet was cooked perfectly. I warn you every dish came out piping hot, get your drink ready. You will have an unbelievable visit!

L2aPDGf5FJ8NFFjzMoZs9g.text: After attending the Elite event at Seersucker, where everything was absolutely delicious, I knew that a return visit would be in the near future. So when Dyanna L. invited me to dine with her on a weekday evening I excitedly accepted.   Seersucker was rather empty when we arrived just a few minutes after our reservation, I chalk this up to happy hour having just ended. The service we received was excellent during this visit, attentive but never overbearing.   Dyanna and I shared all of the dishes we ordered, including the complementary cheddar puffers sent out by the chef. Here is a quick run-down of what we noshed on:  Brie appetizer - This dish featured made-in-house peach jam rather than the cranberry mentioned on the menu. So decadent, we joked that this could have been our dessert rather than our starter.   Cobb salad - We asked our server to help us pick between a couple of salads, and this was her recommendation. The bleu cheese, the roasted tomatoes, the bacon, the dressing...  everything melded together wonderfully.   Crab cake - The only item we ordered that we had during our previous visit. This crab cake has ruined all other crab cakes for me.   The Special for the evening - house made pasta with pesto, shrimp, mussels and a spicy tomato sauce. If this is ever an option on the menu or as a special, get it. The tomato sauce wasn't very spicy, you could taste the freshness of the pesto, and the pasta was cooked to perfection.   For dessert we had the lemon cheesecake, which was a lovely combination of tart and sweet.    After we ate we decided to stop for a drink in the bar area, where we were served by a bartender that was not only adorable but knowledgeable about the spirits. I ended up  having the Ballerina and the Czar, which the waitress warned would taste heavily of the cucumber water which was in it. I found it to be very refreshing.   Seersucker was a wonderful choice for our ladies night out, there was literally nothing that could have been improved upon during our visit. This will be my go-to spot the next time I have friends or family visiting that want good food in a somewhat casual setting on the Strip. I am also looking forward to taking advantage of the great happy hour prices in the very near future.

KNJa8fvcQ2khNIzmb-fZYg.text: Came here after seeing a show. Closes at 11pm on Wednesday. There's a free yelp check in for pickles and habanero. Yes, it's exactly as it sounds. WAY TOO SPICY for all us. Perfect if you love spice. To drink I got the when doves cry, which I guess is a homage to Prince. Drink was ok and so was service. Overall, place is just ok.

pA7Zu9REbk0ByjpqsFJDgg.text: We tried Searsucker fourth of July weekend and really honestly wanted to like it. We did our research and we were excited to try several of the menu items. We were "greeted" by the two completely unenthusiastic hostesses and taken to our table. Our server Tammie was knowledgeable when it came to menu and drink suggestions. My husband wasn't thrilled with his unbalanced rather sweet "signature" old fashioned. But being in Vegas we were both still looking forward to enjoying our dinner.    We were seated in the open kitchen area, which we love! and were shocked to watch the chef touch every raw garnish of every plate of food and then wipe his hands on his apron-less pants, face and phone. Not appetizing in the least. We then watched the manager (at least that's who think was the manager) touch every bit of face, eyes, nose, lips and then proceeded to touch the raw garnish on a dish before sending it along with a food runner. Obviously once we saw a few of these incidents we began to notice even more of them. Kind of like a train wreck- you just can't look away!   My husband and I both work in the industry and are sensitive to some of these issues.  We are never THAT table (unhappy without merit or reason) but we found ourselves being irritated with the compounding service issues. Everyone was on their phones almost the entire time! And I don't say/write this lightly.  The chef, the "manager" and a woman who we assumed was an assistant manager were on their phones for significant periods of time, constantly texting. I get it, we all have lives and communicate constantly but step off of the floor and send your quick text but to stand out openly in the dining room for 5 plus minutes on your phone makes no sense and is unacceptable.  The "assistant manager", a younger woman, did not put her phone down once, seriously not once the entire evening. We were laughing about it by the end of the night, that's something that we have never seen before.  Neither the food nor the signature cocktails were a saving grace unfortunately.  We tried a few appetizers wanting to get a good idea of the concept and the Chef.  We started with a couple of the "jar" dishes, the first was the crab, very one note.  The crab was hammered by Sriracha mayo and gargantuan pieces of Avocado.  Next the tomato and burrata jar, was perhaps the "best" appetizer we had, but the burrata itself was begging and pleading for salt, which is not offered on the tables, lol!   We also ordered the bone marrow and pork belly both of which were incredibly sweet.  We didn't even touch the third bone because the sweetness was overwhelming which honestly is saying something because we are both huge marrow fans.  The only thing we remember about the pork belly was how sweet it was.    Lastly we ordered a grass fed NY steak with two sides.  We ordered the strip medium rare, it came out BLUE, completely cold in the middle.  As we took 5 minutes contemplating sending the steak back we realized we were also missing one of our sides.    We NEVER send things back to the kitchen but were at this point rather frustrated and wanted to at least finish our meal and get out of there. The steak was returned to us warmed through a healthy rare but at least edible.  When the corn finally arrived it was by far the best thing we ate that night.  It had a nice balance of smoky, spicy and creamy. The cauliflower was good at first but quickly became rather one vinegary note.   As a last note, while the manager and Chef were steps away from us the entire 2 plus hours we were having dinner, neither of them bothered to acknowledge, greet, check-in, chat, smile, or honestly look at us.  Why even have an open kitchen if you aren't invested in engaging the dining room????   This was the LEAST expensive dinner we ate on our trip and the MOST disappointing by far. IMO service was awful, food was mediocre.  All in all we left feeling frustrated that we wasted an evening of our trip at Searsucker, what a bummer!

rz95wOmKK_sefWXQQzezFA.text: Went there the other night without knowing much about it. It was a lot better than I expected. The food and service was very good and even the decor was pleasantly nice. The calamari was delicious for an appetizer but if you want my advice, if you go, make sure you get the braised pork. You'll thank me later. It was done to complete perfection.

a0Y3EBU9pYJBjklfmTgHPQ.text: Nice stop for a pre-show bite! I thought it was located in the forum shops but it's in the casino. Service was friendly though a little slow - but it was pretty packed, probably due to the concert. They have a great happy hour - my husband got dogfish head on tap and I ordered the blueberry smash cocktail. We were running low on time so we ordered the lollipop chicken wings and tomatoe burrata. Both were tasty and a deal for the price! Next time we're gonna try the fries - we would definitely return to try their full menu.

iYU5H5psgH8KZIu5tx-PqA.text: Good service, food was great. Presentation was wonderful, small portions for the cost but overall good. Hit up the happy hour for the best value!

NCkwfT-f9W9OUeXmxX9ECQ.text: Please please please bring back the Lollipop wings!!!!  We literally live locally and come to Searsuxker for Heather (best bartender in Vegas!) and the Lollipop Wings!!!!  We love this place but the wings must come back!!!!!!!!

ppuxNRKu1eSPVlOEB_wnoA.text: Dined here on a Saturday night for a party of six and had a great time. Drinks were tasty and refreshing. My favorite was the strawberry jalapeno margarita. Our server was very knowledgeable and suggested some scrumptious dishes. For starters, our table had two orders of the following: bone marrow, calamari steak and duck fat fries. For the main course we had the 36 oz Tomahawk ribeye with sauteed mushroom side, New York Steak with corn jalapeno, two orders of fish and chips, braised pork, grilled cheese and tomato soup for the kids. Everything was delicious but the Tomahawk was a tad too salty and cooked Medium rather than the Medium-rare we preferred.  The star of the meal was the bone marrow. We all agreed that the next time we come back we will just order ten of those bone marrow! We were too full to try any desserts. Our server gave us chips for free expedited access to Omnia. It was a busy night for Omnia being it was its two-year anniversary and Kaskade as the main dj but we did not have any problem getting in. I'm already planning on coming back when we go to Vegas again next month.

0tbKbkJ2oFPgOu2WNmQ4qA.text: I was on my annual trip to Las Vegas with the guys for the Super Bowl and made reservations to have dinner here on February 6, 2016.  Having become a foodie thanks to my wife, plus being a fan of Chef Brian Malarkey since his initial Top Chef contestant season I was excited to check out Searsucker.  Even with running a bit late, my friends and I were seated right away and greeted by our server Emily as well.  We ordered drinks and continued to review the menu to see what we wanted to eat.  I had the Big Eye Tuna with a side of Duck Fat Fries that was simply out of this world.  The tuna was cooked perfectly and seasoned just right with a nice shaved vegetable slaw to go with the dish.  The only thing that would have made the dish even more enjoyable for me was some wasabi to go along with it.  The duck fat fries were pretty tasty too as they had I believe pancetta bits and parmesan cheese sprinkled over them as well!  It was a different preparation than I have previously and enjoyable just the same.    One of my friends ordered the lollipop buffalo wings that were tasty as well and I was told that the blue cheese aioli was pretty awesome for the wings.  The other main courses that were ordered was the scallops and the filet steak.  Both of those entrees were just as delicious according to my friends.  The only way the experience would have been better is if Chef would have been at the restaurant and I would have been able to meet him in person!  I did Tweet to Chef on Twitter and he did like my tweet!!!  I hope to one day get to either of the locations in San Diego with my wife so that she is able to enjoy the incredible food!!!

95-T7xHho05jqih1ChEkTg.text: Food and service was very good. We ordered several shareables and had plenty of food for four people: Mac & Cheese was excellent and the chicken sliders were some of the best I've had. The biscuits - seriously amazing and not to be missed. I didn't love the duck fat fries, they didn't have as much flavor as I expected.

6VTxgbl230hDXx-u7ADYuw.text: ********************* 1341 *********************      Searsucker Las Vegas is located right next to OMNIA nightclub at Caesars Palace hotel. It's by the Celebrity Chef Brian Malarkey. Designed by critically-acclaimed interior designer, Thomas Schoos, Searsucker's comfortable living spaces, retro Americana vibe, New American Classic dishes and specialty cocktails set the mood for an epic night ahead. We'll plan your entire dining experience; what happens afterwards is completely up to you.      Happy hour in Las Vegas never tasted so good! Why would you stay in your room when you could have a Peter Rabbit cocktail, instead? Searsucker is bringing you the Las Vegas happy hour you always wanted. Alongside our specialty cocktails and house infusions, indulge in a few of our signature dishes at discounted prices.    Chef Brian Malarkey's playful dinner menu sets Searsucker apart from other Las Vegas strip restaurants with its imaginative twists on New American Classics. Share plate including Duck Fat Fries and Beef Tartare, or be a little selfish and try the Ribeye "Tomahawk" all to yourself.      Satisfy every taste bud with our Las Vegas late night menu. The end of your night will taste a lot better with our classic Green Eggs + Ham dish. Stop by after your Vegas adventures and take a peek at our Las Vegas late night menu in our main dining room, as well as in the bar and lounge area. Tuesday & Thursdays - Sunday from 11pm to late. A perfect spot to grab a late night bite before hitting OMNIA.

kXYyNDGDYY6H9BRMqfC1AA.text: This place was actually great we had some Habenero pickles to start off then we had blue cheese chicken skewers   Drinks were a little expensive but good

cP7r4i0XwObaRCRdOz70JA.text: I really really wanted to love this place. The marketing is so cool and I've been waiting for the opportunity to come sample the cuisine. A friend invited us to join him to see Mariah Carey at Caesars, so this was that opportunity! I was so excited.  The Pros - The marketing is cool. - The place looks cool. - We were serviced by 3 different guys and they were all very helpful and attentive! - We all agreed that the calamari was the best item we had.  The Cons - Poor Selection. I wasn't crazy about the menu items so much so that I ended up getting a salad. Getting a salad at a place as nice as Searsuckers is like going to Basking Robins & getting vanilla ice cream. - Duck Fat Fries. GROSS. If I were a fast food character, I would be The Fry Guy. The aftertaste of the 'duck fat' was gross. Seriously gross. I barely touched the dish, and even told the waiter that, well, they were gross, but he said that he loves them & he left them on the bill. Shannon & Scot were in agreement about the grossness. - Expensive. I don't mind having a crazy expensive dinner, but I just wasn't expecting it here. The Cesears website has it listed as $$ and Yelp has it as $$$.  My Cobb salad with shrimp was $34. My martini was $14, but the Apple Martini listed on the menu was $35. Hmmm. All in, we spent $235 for 3 people. I had a salad & fries, Scot only had an appetizer, Shannon had a caesar salad and we all shared the calamari.  For the record, Shannon & Scot rated Searsucker higher than I did. There are several locations nationwide, so I must be in the minority of disfavor. Maybe you will like Searsucker more than I did.

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Martinis and cheddar puffs before dinner.

VENUEwmjX_Pca3S_odQ2Dw.text: I like this spot, it has a good happy hour considering where you are, but it does last until 7 pm which is great for a happy hour. The other Caesar Palace lounges tend to end at 6 pm if they even have one to begin with. I wish they had more vegetarian options on their menu is my only complaint but who wants to go there for food anyway...

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Take advantage of happy hour!
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beers on tap

Vlr2j57631qBEzelwvK6pA.text: What do I say about this gem - great food, great service, fun atmosphere.  I've said it all before, but Searsucker checks all the boxes AND captures that extra special something.  The people here are terrific and make you feel special.  The room is energetic and fun, and the music is always on point.  Then you start eating; beef tartare, eggs & bacon, short rib, crab cake, mahi and cherries, pork butt!  Or splurge and get the tomahawk!  And you should drink a Honey Badger or a Matador because why not?!  Don't skip the chocolate chip cookies - I'm not kidding.  They are life changing.

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coho Salmon
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duck Entree

ZTkhDl52JUsCcll0B42f5A.text: Whoohoooo!! I hesitate to give this place 5 stars because it was so easy for me to get a reservation here, I don't want others to know about this gem of a restaurant.  But I shall share with you all my enthusiasm for this place. The food is unpretentious, well, at least by new American cuisine standards. Having recently dined at fellow Top Chef contestant Richard Blais' restaurant (Juniper & Ivy in San Diego) where I found the food to be very fun and creative, but lacking heart and taste/satisfaction, Chef Brian Malarkey's restaurant really knocked it out of the park for me. The food is simple, and instead of getting fancy, they focused on just preparing the food perfectly.   Of note, their duck breast confit was perfectly prepared. Not a single complaint. Even the bed of white beans it sits on top of was delicious, and I haaaaaate beans! Their scallop dish is priced a bit on the high side, but they give you three very decent-sized scallops, and again, it was made perfectly.  You must try their sweet and spicy squid. Even if you're not a fan of squid, this dish totally won me over. I don't know how they prepare it but the squid is not chewy at all. It's got a great texture that reminds me of scallops. Anyway you must try it.   The only disappointing dish was the short rib. Ugh. If I see short rib on one more menu I'm gonna scream, but the waiter recommended it. It was dry, bland, and boring. It even sat on top of a pile of boring mashed potatoes. Avoid this one.   I will definitely be back again!

vFq9MZDeI7k_jcm-rxendQ.text: We really enjoyed this dinner, probably best we enjoyed all weekend. Server was great. All dishes were pretty darn good. I appreciate simple menu items that are amazing, like the tomato bisque and grilled cheese were the best ive had, really delicious. The scallop dish could be improved upon but quality was good.

JPJqt8nKtfT4hFBnc_RhVg.text: Conveniently located in Caesars, we stopped in for happy hour. I had the chicken sliders which had a touch of spice, which I enjoyed. My husband had several pieces of bone marrow, which at two dollars a piece was a great deal. Old fashions and house wine was somewhere around 6 dollars. The bill took a little bit longer to arrive so the waitress bought me a to go cup of wine.

qjzuIhkjp3vCKoMrTT2QLA.text: This place was so good. We came in on a Sunday and they had football playing on the TVs. Their menu was small and appeared to have only football snack foods. We ordered anyway. We ordered the buffalo wings and fried chicken and eggs. The food was sooooooo good. All of it. I think my fiance got the biscuits, also delicious.   The only reason it didn't get 5 stars is because they were training the bar back to make drinks. Well, they said they were training him but every time he got a ticket for drinks he would let it sit there and wait until a waiter or a bartender would come by for them to make it. (I know this because I sat in view of the bar).   Waited too long for our drinks. When you're in Vegas that's the last thing you want. Disappointed in the training and in the barback.

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3zdt7QkeVazBxB1DYKtZdg.text: We had a reservation for 8 and got seated quickly on a Saturday night.  My girlfriend and I split the beer braised short ribs (came highly recommended by the waitress) and the entree scallops.  The ribs were tender but the sauce was too salty for my taste.  The scallops were delicious and were plated on a bed of corn.  The food was decent and I would come back again to try other things on the menu.  edit: If you plan on going to the Omnia nightclub after dinner, ask the hostess at the restaurant and they can give you an express token that lets you cut through the Omnia line quicker.

xn_h1JdiIDEBpw8nyYdyRA.text: Best thing to order here is the bone marrow, well flavored with brussel sprouts and butter that along with the marrow, melts in your mouth.  The lollipop wings were good, chocolate sammies were delicious, duck fat fries were overly seasoned with not even a hint of duck fat taste, but the worst item I had was the braised pork butt.  The pork butt had no flavor besides the pickled tower laid on top.  It was confusing, the pickled vegetables dominated the flavor of the meat, not even letting the True taste exude through the anticipated braised flavor.  Even the smell of the pork had no inviting aroma, very bland.  Staff (such as our server, Cesar who was nice enough to have the pork butt and fries removed from our bill due to our dissatisfaction) and service were excellent, but the braised pork butt...was a bunch of "malarkey."

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate sammies
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duck fat fries
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Butt

h-Mrfa1eRRFayfTRm7_Gww.text: Went last week during happy hour. Had the bone marrow and it was wonderful. I think we ordee about 3-4 of them. Tried the oysters and sliders and didn't really care for it.  Definitely coming back for the bone marrow!

93UUe-q5GZfopWB9Sl1FHQ.text: Seersucker is a great place to find an interesting and yet accessible meal on the strip and in Caesars palace. This place has some awesome staff and a great bar team that takes care of the patrons across the restaurant. They have some cool and tasty signature and craft cocktails that are certainly worth a try (or two, or three!) The food is well prepared and very well presented - they put their time into the dishes and make sure that it's done to your liking. The pricing is a bit high, but for an on-the-strip option is a great choice and well worth return visits. Happy hour is great and you can get some nice deals too - so keep an eye out! All in all this is a win win for me!

vi5yZRhC1uxcqbuuSXqtEA.text: 5 stars for our server who patiently explained all of the specials and his recommendations from the menu (he definitely knows his stuff) and plus divided up the bill however many ways we wanted.  He definitely worked for his tip!   As far as the food itself, I would give it a 4 star rating.  Got the sword fish, which came with a side of sauce - chose the chimichurri (per our waiter's recommendation- great job) and a side of Brussels and walnuts, which were tangy and yummy.    My husband ordered the pork butt (which I hear is actually pork shoulders), plus the side of duck fat fries.  The fries were good, but we didn't feel like they were anything super special.  The butt was big and had a lot of meat in them, and they were thick and juicy.  Hehe.   It all came out about 140$ including tax and tip , and 2 speciality cocktail drinks we gave our friends who were celebrating their birthdays there yesterday.   Would come back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duck fat fries!
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Swordfish!

cqzn_rcVdW3xH2bG9Wk2SQ.text: Went in the other night for some dinner and drinks before heading to the night club across the way. Sat at the bar, the bartender Phil took care of us. Everything was great, excellent customer service. Will definitely be going back.

oZQ8NTNYSO8ebTzGZFspVg.text: We couldn't get a seat at Nobu. I remembered how great this place was when I first tried it.  So lucky we got a seat here right away!  Our server was absolutely amazing! Cute petite blonde.  She gave excellent suggestions and got us out in time for our show.    They've taken a few things off the menu since they first opened. Careful not to get your heart set on these amazing Yelp photos. Not to worry, everything is yummy!  They didn't give us any bread so we ordered the biscuits.  Can't go wrong.  Served with butter and honey.   Didn't feel like I was in the mood for her suggested calamari steak.  I am so glad she suggested it!  It was cooked to the perfect texture, firm and tender.  Even the sweet chili sauce that I wasn't thrilled about, paired really well!   We ordered the ribs instead of steak. Good thing our server told us steak would take too long to cook for our time frame.   Super tender atop mashed potatoes.  A few nice onion rings.    Bone marrow.  Comes with a good amount of Brussel sprouts (which I love at this restaurant). Plenty of marrow.  Maybe too much for two girls to eat.     I thoroughly enjoyed every bite of dinner!

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribs
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone marrow
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Biscuits

uQpnhasQWUxqq0RQShCTNA.text: Good food. Super, super, super slow service. Drinks and food were expensive (very overpriced) but that was expected because it's Vegas. Not sure if I'd come back or not but it was a good time.   P.s if you are with a bridal party and bring your own cake there is a thirty dollar charge.

cV1Yk19eHtYHiOlMdjhA7A.text: Searsuck surely didn't suck for me.   Appetizer - Hummus and Grilled Flatbread: Three freshly baked, glistening flat breads that came with a small jar filled with house-made hummus. A perfect, light appetizer.   Entree - Jumbo Mexican Shrimp with Pear Ginger Chutney and a side of Roasted Mushroom & Herbs: When you order "From the Grill," you select either a meat or seafood, then choose a sauce and side dish. The jumbo shrimp is legit, folks. Searsucker doesn't skimp on size and quantity.The shrimp pairs well with the chutney; although, I wish more was provided. As for the mushrooms, they were decent.   Dessert - Chocolate Trifecta: From the smoothness of the pudding, to the crunchy chocolate "paper," I enjoyed most of the flavors and textures of this dessert. However, the cake was bland, but it might have been created intentionally to balance all the flavors. The other desserts on the menu might've done a better job in satisfying my sweet tooth.   FYI: The restaurant charges approximately 2 bucks per beverage refill -- I didn't think my Diet Pepsi was worth the extra cost; maybe another beverage would've. *shrugs*  Service: No complaints; great service.   Overall: Many of the menu offerings may not sound new and exciting, but Searsucker adds its own twist. To me, the food was fine, but I wouldn't order the same items.

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled Jumbo Mexican Shrimp with Peach Ginger Chutney.

X7qeiRuBM7jnzMM7V6FBFw.text: After unwelcoming reception at Old Homestead, we opted to sit at the bar at Searsucker.  Living in San Diego for the last 20 years, am well acquainted with Brian Malarkey's hospitality style and it mates up VERY nicely with the Las Vegas "thang".  The entire joint was jumpin' at 6:45 pm(Happy Hour daily 5:00-7:00 pm) on 1/21/17, Heather was our mixologist/server and we were instantly happy and relaxed.  I picked the "Blueberry Ginger Smash"-Old Forester / ginger / honey / blueberry / mint($8.00)...it was tremendous, packed a punch and had great flavor.  My friend had the Ballast Point beer, can't remember which flavor or how much it cost.  For eats, we had the Sliders($9.00 for two/order two, you'll want it!)-chipotle / cheddar / bacon....like a chipotle aoli topping, the beef was a nice size, two/three bites, juicy and flavorful....very, very nice, will be watching in the future to see if that stays on the menu.  We also got the tuna tacos ($9.00 for three) which were equally dilish!-blackend ahi / avocado/ jalapeno relish.  Deep fried shell, very thin and perfectly seasoned....highly recommended.  A word about Heather.....funny, smart and on her game, she will be sure to go far by reading the signs a customer is giving and paying attention to the small details.  Awesome person and Searsucker is lucky to have her!  Any Yelper in the vicinity of Caesar's should check this joint out and have a great time.  My experience was virtually without any fault, get to it!  Ambiance/Cleanliness-no bs here, it was good to go from the moment we sat down!...5 stars  Service- very nice, no major problems......4 stars  Food-see above for a food review, it was very good, but not in that rarified five star experience....a well deserved....4 stars!

z2AkSVLbEqzWc1aW5IM3NQ.text: Overpriced garbage. Ordered a salad and it looked disgusting. Place had an open kitchen and all I saw was the chef just leaning over the counter having conversations with the other cooks. Would advise not eating inside the casinos. The culinary union is a joke and so is management. Remember Vegas doesn't count on repeat customers so they could care less if you come back.. Suckers!!

u0xJBeEiJZXPAq0_ohQC3g.text: This place was an awesome surprise. My husband and I stopped in for drinks, but the menu looked so great and the bar staff was awesome so we decided to stay for dinner. We split the happy hour sliders (ordered 2), the goat cheese salad (forgot the name), and the pasta. All were fantastic. We liked it so much that we went back later for dessert. We'll definitely be back.  Tip, eat at the bar during happy hour (4-7 PM)!

DqBnxgKxvudEcGecnwaSYg.text: For our last night in Las Vegas, we decided to go to Searsucker. Located in Caesar's Palace, Searsucker is the restaurant by chef Brian Melarkey, who has had stints on Top Chef and the Taste. I didn't realize this until after the fact, I was just excited by the menu.  The vibe is modern chic meats rustic. Reservations are recommended, even during weekdays, which we did. We started with drinks- they have a decent wine list but also have an interesting cocktail list. I decided on the skinny jenny which is basically a moscow mule with lavender and other surprising ingredients. I loved it. It was a light, refreshing, and well made cocktail. For my meal I decided on oysters and mac and cheese (not in the same dish). The oysters were delicious and came with a refreshing pomegranate sauce. The mac and cheese was also quite delicious and very filling. Rich in flavor (and in cheese), it was definitely a tasty dish.   Service was very good throughout our meal. We were never without an empty water glass and our server made good recommendations. Yelp check in gets you a free appetizer of their house made pickles. It is a pricer meal but definitely worth it for the experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Skinny Jenny
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters and Mac and cheese

x1BPdg4OxNHiXbtq68MehA.text: For the amount of money you are paying here, you would expect this place to give you some complimentary bread or appetizer, but I didn't get anything...and I also made a reservation and noted that I was here for a celebration. Again, I expected they would do something for that, but it's either they forgot or I guess they just don't? Then what's the point of even asking if it's for an occasion or having a special note section? I shared a 32 oz cowboy ribeye with my boyfriend and initially we thought we wouldn't even be able to finish it (we would eat about 12 oz steaks by ourselves usually) but we actually didn't even feel that full after eating everything either and we also ordered two drinks and an appetizer. The 32 oz steak was probably weighed heavier for the bone or something because it was definitely not that much meat for it to be 32 oz in my opinion. For about $86 for the ribeye, I think I would go spend my money somewhere else. Nothing special about it. Meh.

2MN87wfBb3U-asb4WMKrSg.text: Everything about this place says Cool. The vibe and decor is rustic yet modern. The long wooden tables make it feel homey yet trendy.  All of the food is fantastic- shishito peppers, biscuits, chicken, steak, shrimp..   Everyone was very happy with what they had!

DcoxzjgYdhEhNwZ1g3v1Wg.text: Wow, this place is awful.   The atmosphere screams tacky sports bar. The whole place feels as if you're sitting in a food court with giant flat screens everywhere, including the cheap furniture and uncomfortable chairs. Poorly lit and loud.   And this is the sort of place where the servers try to jack up the bill as high as they can. You know, where they ask if you would like water and then charge you $9 for a bottle of Fiji without asking you. Or letting you order a $10 side of fries with an entree that already comes with french fries. As if the $65 steak entrees weren't over-priced enough.   The service timing is horrible, too. Despite the prices, this is NOT fine dining by any stretch of the imagination. These folks have no idea what they are doing when it comes to service.   And to top it all off, the food is bland and overly salty. Horrible. The $18 rib starter that we had was so dreadful that we scaled back our entire dinner plans and decided less would definitely be the theme of the evening.   The wine list is equally pretentious and over-priced. $125 for wine that retails for $15 at the grocery store. Other mediocre bottles that are priced in the $600(!?!?!) range. Please.  If you have very little experience with fine dining, you might mistake expensive for quality. Don't be fooled. Michelin is not going to be calling these folks anytime soon.

KB9D4WeDtoDsYU-qbAN6Pw.text: We went here for dinner. This place is over priced, serves a very small amount of food. And the food tastes horrible. Avoid at all costs. We got the chicken wings, we got like 4 tiny wings. The burrata was tasteless and tasted stale.

E8dTidq9qgrUTc37sP3nvA.text: LOVE.  Duck fat fries.  Mushroom burrata toast.  Grapefruit radler (Steigl).  Anything else after that you're too happy to be thinking clearly, but I assure you it is all delicious and really fun.  One of my favorite places on the Strip, really a perfectly executed endeavor by all involved.

iibS1mqq3mohUTQyCHHy6Q.text: Cheddar Puffers.  Duck Fat Fries. Mushrooms + Burrata + Toast. Crab Cake Jumbo Lump. Pork Butt. Cookies & Milk.  Fun Decor + Delicious Food = Happy Camper. :)

9-6bcPr2Tz3E1vedmkst_w.text: I received a birthday offer from my work. The small plates were all amazing, the shishito peppers and shrimp scampi were amazing. I suggest this restaurant at my job as a great date night option!

ekH13XoaTUb9T6tMGYRUgQ.text: Service is kind of slow but extremely attentive.  Food was spectacular. We had a table of nine and everything I tried was awesome. I recommend getting the ceviche with some toast (to dip into the sauce).The pickles are also very good if you like spicy things.  I think next time I would try the mushroom buratta toast or the beet salad.  My only complaint was that the lettuce in the Caesar salad was too large. Smaller cuts would have been easier to eat.

cSAZw_j_sVGEy4qEtBkNBQ.text: Only had a hour before Elton show and needed food. Got great appetizers, especially the scampi, in a timely manner. Even had time for dessert, lemon cheesecake so yummy. Our waiter Steven was attentive and nice so I will be back. The reason for only 4 stars is the hummus was bland, but there is so many other things I want to try. Managers were even friendly and stopped by for a chat.

b22leTWGqg0DsIz2fzpX9w.text: Was here with a group of 8 people in which we decided to do family style dining and order several different things and just share. I'm sad to say the best thing I had that night was their Duck Fat Fries and the Cheddar Puffers. The item I was most looking forward to was the Tomahawk Ribeye but it was over-salted, which seemed to be a theme for them that night. I also tried the Duck which was nothing special and the Mahi which was tough and flavorless.   Honestly the only reason they got two stars was that their cocktails were very well done and the half priced bottles of wine for locals.   Overall I'm not in any hurry to return or recommend this place to anyone.

-CCWO8atpNzswZSoSIKc8w.text: The food here is delicious. My friend and I ordered the scallops and decided to share. They originally come with three per plate but our waiter was very sweet and said he would request for four. The scallops were very buttery and flavorful. They were on a bed of couscous with this green lime sauce that I ended up dipping everything in. We also had the brussels spouts that had a great crunch and nutty flavor. We had a side of the corn and it was so sweet and flavorful it went well with everything. It was a great dinner and atmosphere for myself and best friend to enjoy our time at our weekend girl trip in Vegas. Plus, because we dine there we got a token that allowed us to skip the line at Omnia which made our night even more! Truly a great restaurant, food, service and all.

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My favorite! The scallops :)
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brussels sprouts
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side of the corn

4_FW58elJmYhX8tcd_oqww.text: Pricey Vegas hotel food, however each dish has its own unique character. The waiters and waitresses are all very friendly. Each person came by with a smile. We were served cream-puff looking biscuits after we sat down. They taste exactly like Goldenfish or CheezeIt's even. Not bad, probably wouldnt have ordered those by themselves.   We ordered: Squid w/stripes of apple -  yum!  Pork butt - has a great tasting sauce Short rib -  pass on this, ive had better Shrimp ceviche - eh, i'd also pass on this Duck fat fries -  not bad either, reminds me of truffle fries.   I'd say this place is tapas-style. Everything comes in small portions but decorated so eloquently. I expected more food for the price.

U21cNSo_Nmqr2pYs7DzBDw.text: The service was phenomenal, at least our server was. I can not give 5 stars or even 4 stars because of the executive chef. Stephen Lasale (I believe that was the name on his jacket) was literally the most rude person I have ever encountered in a restaurant. Stephen, who was in charge of all of the food leaving the kitchen, was consistently just speaking in a derogatory demeanor to each of his fellow co workers. Our table was seated directly next to the kitchen so you could hear everything he would say and see all of his expressions as well as how his co workers responded to him. We did ask the server what his issue was and from what we gathered, this is very common with him. The manager came over to the table and did tell us that he agreed with us and that he would appreciate a complaint in writing. I think that no matter what position you are working, customer service is the most important thing ...whether it is internal or external. Stephen, I think it's time to find a different profession.

fEyXxl1xjjSmsTzdkY7Ekg.text: Had Thanksgiving Dinner here yesterday. Our waitress Desiree was amazing. The food was fabulous.  But the reason I did not give them 5 stars is because the food was barely warm and the second on dressing was burnt. They did not offer to adjust anything. I did ask for hot gravy to warm up the dressing and meThey also charged extra for biscuits.  Overall it was a good experience.  Our first time here. Also finding the restaurant in Caesars was a Maze. There are no directions for the restaurant. Good luck if you go.

3Gtg8HBsKYlBsa4n45hUUA.text: Duck fat fries were okay. The pork butt was very good. My husband steak and the Mac and cheese were over salted. Waiter was decent but pushing the up sell on everything.

EoIJFtaR4qW3_AW1k8nATg.text: Ugh, where do I start.   Went here as it seemed to be one of the more decently priced and more interesting places on the strip. Unfortunately it kinda sucked. Not the food but just about everything else.   There was a short wait for a table so we were offered a high top or the seats facing the casino floor if we wanted to be seated immediately. I like people watching so facing out was a great place to sit. We ordered the hamachi and jalapeno plate to start along with a couple of beers. The beers took a little bit longer than they should, but the amount of time the hamachi took was appalling. The insulting part was that this dish definitely fits the description of a small plate, it was basically 3 crisps with a slice of the hamachi and vegetables/sauce. The dish itself was great, the cucumbers and jalapeno  worked so well with the fish, tasted incredible. But for what amounts to 3 chips with a slice of fish on them to take over 20 minutes to prepare was pretty bad.   We had also ordered the Ono and a beet salad with goat cheese. The only odd request we had was for the goat cheese to come on the side which isn't a substitution or anything out of line. When the runner came out with them the goat cheese was breaded (not indicated on the menu) and mixed in with the salad. We politely sent it back and requested the goat cheese on the side and not breaded, and some silverware. Our waitress then came back with the salad sans goat cheese. She said she would get some for us and also offered to get some silverware. After waiting several more minutes I just turned around and asked the bartender for silverware. My Ono was no longer warm enough but it was very good.   Unfortunately lack of staff communication and attentiveness ruined this place for me. This is too bad as the food was awesome.

61OL08WBv83U9V9lJQdXTg.text: Super friendly staff (super attentive) food was on point. I've never felt more welcomed at a restaurant before. I would highly recommend the strawberry jalapeno margaritas so D'lish!!! Definitely coming back with all my friends and family again .

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jalapeño strawberry margarita!!! So gooood!

EpXlbs_c_iTUaIc8kDdTew.text: Long story short: how many times have you sat at home watching the Food Network or some cooking show on TV and thought 'wow that looks interesting' and wished you could try it yourself?    Some of the menu options and flavor combinations are definitely different and might intimidate those who like to play it safe but hey, youre in Vegas! Get out of your comfort zone, be adventurous, try something new! We tried a little bit of everything and it was all good.  No room for dessert.

Pw3lszXFJFWBifauAi979g.text: One of the best meals I have had in Las Vegas.  Specialty drinks were tasty and not bad price for the Strip.  Crab Cakes are the absolute best I have ever had and a must try!   We also had the steak tartare & pork butt both very good. The Chefs use of sauces and flavor combinations are wonderful!  Our waiter Chris was great as well as the rest of the wait staff that assisted. a very nice atmosphere.

ED3fVoiSO7Yidu8zszbJXw.text: Excellent place to meet up with friends.  I really loved their scallops and chicken entree. The steak was ok.  They make excellent cocktails and I highly recommend going for their happy hour.  Price point is about average..just like anywhere else on the strip.

DtRoEEBpHXVwdpHnzVVMsQ.text: Mixed drinks are expensive but go for the Happy Hour and get the Bone Marrow (only twenty bucks) and DELICIOUS. Servers are very kind and the food was very good.

-gyYUdaBYnsBjaezLnAJPg.text: This is the best new restaurant in Vegas!  It's also a rarity being an eating establishment on the Strip that has a Happy Hour!  We went to Happy Hour after reading the great reviews.  We were not disappointed at all.    The food we ate was tremendous.  The crab cake was as good as we have ever had, be in Boston or Baltimore.  The shrimp and grits, while advertised as spicy, is not spicy enough to keep my wife's delicate palate from loving it!  The strawberry champagne salad is unique and superb!  As other people have stated, the portions are better than most Happy Hour foods.  We finished the meal off with the pumpkin dessert, very good.    What so many restauranteurs don't realize is that a good Happy Hour draws people in to sample your food, service, and cocktails.  If you pass that step, then you have customers who are coming back regardless of being Happy Hour or not. That is us.  We will come back for the pork butt, the filet, the salmon entree, the mahi, the scallops, etc.  The prices on those dishes aren't outrageous.  They aren't the best, but if you have dined on the Strip, you know you are paying top dollar.  At least here you get fantastic, friendly service and exceptional food.    FWIW, I've owned a restaurant, been a general manager, a bar manager, a bartender, and a waitperson, oh, and along with a dish washer.  I am judging this eatery on one visit, but boy, it was an unbelievably exceptional visit.    We will be back!  Oh, forgot to mention a pet peeve of mine they overcame.  Sitting at the bar, Searsucker had more than one person wait on you, EVEN ask you if you want another drink or some more water!  What mattered to them was if you had good service, not whether a certain bartender waited on you.  Good job, Searsucker!

F19A7WCDnq4vQayR3Tfz2Q.text: I'm usually pretty skeptical of celebrity chef restaurants but was happily proven wrong last night! Our meal was fantastic from start to finish. We were also on a time crunch bc we had a show to catch and our waiter got us in and out very quickly ! We had the tomato and burrata, the bacon Mac n cheese, the sliders, and the lobster tails with Brussels sprouts. Every single dish was fantastic, we will be back for sure ! Also ordered a FRESH lemonade and it was unreal.

eo8xlvMRsUS2AX2xTEFJGA.text: Tammy pointed out our order and right off the bat was amazing. Jeasus made us super cozy and the food was to die for. I had the strawberry  salad, shrimp and grits and  crab cake. All me. All good.

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jeasus the busser made our dinner. He seriously is the reason we were able to enjoy our dinner and Tammy the waitress. #1 team.

zx3Fd1BNQ8No1Nnce8ILnA.text: Excellent food here at Searsucker. They call it New American Cuisine. The tomahawk steak is excellent here at Searsucker. It is hand carved for you and the taste is excellent.  At Searsucker they use fresh ingredients and you can actually taste the food. They have some great happy hour specials that include sliders.   You will find a fun environment and really friendly staff. Searsucker is only open from 5 pm to midnight.  It is worth the wait.

VjalPHAbF_CrFJKODRBhGw.text: I came here with a big party for my birthday. Everything that we ordered was delicious. The menu options are very decadent and rich. The must haves for me are the biscuits, the bone marrow and the chicken wings. At the end of the meal we were pleasantly surprised by a chocolate chips cookie A la mode surrounded by shots for everyone. Now that's my type of bday dessert!

M69GyfwyRSWfvh2Sh5F8kw.text: Great spot inside Caesar's palace. I ended up having the burger special (limited quantity every day). It was pricey but very good.  Also be sure to check in with Yelp as you will get free habenaro appetizer!  Seating is tables or bar. I choose a table. Great TVs scaterred around the restaurant to catch the sports action. Decent service too. Very informal atmosphere.

gvrdnkBgtzeRZCYXtkytSQ.text: Drinks were fine-nothing special. The pork rinds were weirdly amazing. Bartender wasn't a very friendly and I think I could have liked this place if her attitude was a little different.

0zHMGVig3ZVXAdI_dF5LzA.text: Stumbled upon it in Caesar's Palace and was pleasantly surprised. Hostess initially wouldn't let us in w/ outside drinks but when she saw my struggle to "chug" a full vodka tonic she eased up & told me to say it was H20. Appreciate that!  Our waiter was kinda a jerk (Steven) and seemed not to have patience with the 2 of us. He didn't explain the menu when we had questions, completely forgot a drink order and then left us once our food arrived. Asked for a steak knife for our cauliflower steak (delicious) but never got one and had to use a butter knife to cut.  The busser tended to us with refills and was nice- Steve appeared with the bill and that was all.   Food was delicious and highly recommend the pig ears. Not crunchy but not soggy and the cilantro w like was IDEAL for a shared pre dinner nosh.   Cauliflower steak was perfect; not too heavy and the sauces were paired perfectly.   Duck fat fries were good but alittle on the salty side.

J2tKsSCB8HqH7aqHlKLwKw.text: I went here for happy hour before our Mariah Carey show. I was pretty impressed!  $5 Stella, $6 house wine, $9 old fashioneds and cocktails. For food, $2 oysters, $4 chicken sliders and $2 bone marrow.  We ordered everything on happy hour. I wasn't too crazy about the oysters, and what they dressed it with. I think it was a cranberry with micro greens. It was too subtle in flavor and maybe I'm biased because I like my oysters dressed with a one two punch.  The sliders is actually really filling and one person can easily do with 2 orders if you're hungry or just one if you want to eat light. Chicken is tender and has a good amount of flavor in the sandwich.  The bone marrow is definitely what you come here for. The portion is good and it comes with bread. What really takes the cake in the bone marrow is that bourbon glaze. It balances the richness of bone marrow with that nice sweet flavor.  YUM!  We also got the calamari. It's actually really good! It has a sweet and spicy flavor that I love. It's not a crispy batter like typical calamaris and it is a strip steak and not the usual circle ones. So the bite is thick.   I'd love to go back again to try that ribeye, but because it's so big, I definitely have to bring a team.

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone Marrow
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qo_RsBVj1vSkOjX1hT7DsQ.text: Best place for happy hour hors d'oeuvre oysters and bone marrow with a nice old fashion.  The bread and the roasted brussel sprouts make the dish.  Perfect starter before a long night

Viuyt3jheTX7jbYjaSGr3Q.text: I came here during 4th of July week last month to celebrate my friend's birthday. She was craving steak and after some long searching we found this spot right next to the club we were going to to see Zedd. I made reservations and we were seated right away. The service was phenomenal and the inside was very nice.   We were told before ordering that if we each order $50 worth of food (bill total of $250 or more) we would get tokens to get VIP entry/access to Omnia, where we were going anyways. So we each ordered enough food and apps to get this. The friend were really good and my steak was delicious! Something about their ranch is like the best ranch we've all ever had. We kept ordering it and then were told that they charge extra for the ranch. Thankfully our server was kind enough to only charge for a couple. I wasn't too crazy about my drink, but I loved my food and would definitely be back to eat here again.   Thankfully we were on a list for the Omnia and decided to do that and give our entry tokens away to another group. We saw that group later in the club and they said the tokens didn't work and they still had to wait. I'm really bothered that they pushed us to order a min per person to get these tokens and in the end they didn't even end up working.

SB8w4C1p022UG078CMg3Lg.text: The food and drinks here are decent, but the service issues we experienced the last two visits have been so poor that I'm not sure we'll be going back. Our table was basically ignored until we plead with staff for service and attention, and when we did receive attention we were treated very rudely.   I emailed customer service about our issues following our last two visits, and unfortunately they ignored those, as well. I think this place relies on its prime location within Caesar's Palace, and doesn't particularly care about the quality of service it provides. It's too bad: the food really is quality, and there are some unique beverages on the menu. Unfortunately, the poor quality of service sours the whole experience. I don't believe it's a coincidence that this restaurant doesn't respond to its negative reviews or service concerns.

3MLkHwTHjaMpeMpgh88UAQ.text: Husband bought the package for dinner at Seersucker on a pre fix menu and then the show Absinthe. I was hesitant for dinner because of the pre fix menu but everything was great.  Came with 3 courses and a cocktail for only $30. I had the tomato and burrata. Delicious. Came with thick cut toast and tastes reminscent of a caprese. Husband got the pig ears. They were good. Then I had the scallops. I loved it. Came on a bed of charred corn and tomatoes. Scallops were cooked perfectly. Then the warm chocolate chunk cookie and coconut gelato. The drink was like a Moscow mule. Tasty and we got to keep the souvenir cup.  Service was attentive and the manager got us a bag to carry the cups.  I would definitely go back. Definitely a foodie spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The scallops with charred corn and grape tomatoes. Perfectly composed dish.

9vuzkSpJXJcFSen4n0igmg.text: The place has a good vibe. They were hosting a private party so they were limiting bar space. Bartender was fine but can't say he went above and beyond. Food wise, yellowtail crudo was delicious and fresh. Scallops with grits were a tad on the salty side but the flavors were complex and I want to commend them on the grits since this was my second time ever having grits and it went over much better than the first (which was in the south even). Overall a nice place to have dinner.

yLsJ8vFknFoPlRTTaXAssA.text: Are there any restaurants in Vegas that suck?! My wife and I had the wild boar pasta and the pork butt after starting out with the short rib. Everything was amazing, especially the wold boar pasta and short rib. The short rib is topped with crispy onion strings, which serve as the perfect compliment with the hearty gravy and mashed potatoes. For beverages I went with a mezcal cocktail and the "strawpeno" margarita. Very excellent as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wild boar pasta
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork butt
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawpeno margarita

xkBZMWJmnqq2Tk_pDcOOZg.text: We were on the Strip at Caesars for a show and wanted to grab a light dinner afterwards. Seersucker had decent yelp reviews and was very close to the theater so we thought we would give it a try. Almost immediately after we sat down, Tyler, Our server came by to greet us, get our drink orders, and explain the menu. Immediately made us feel very welcome. Because we were not terribly hungry we decided we would go for three small plates and their corn bread muffins. For the small plates we got the calamari, the octopus, and the short ribs. Tyler told us that the calamari is one of their house specialties. He did not lie. They were quite good. The octopus is grilled. It was tasty. But nothing really special. The short ribs with mashed potatoes were short ribs with mashed potatoes, also nothing really special. The cornbread muffins with the specialty butter actually the highlight of the evening. Quite tasty for only five dollars, If you consider a restaurant charging for 7 really small muffins to be OK. So if the calamari was quite good, and the cornbread muffins were also good, and the service was excellent, why only three stars. You have to take into account value. Each of the small plates dishes were $18. I thought this was a little on the high side even for the strip. In addition, they nail you put $12 in parking.So when you figure 3 small shared plates, no adult beverages, and parking plus tax and tip was $90. Not a great value. Definitely would not go back here and would not recommend

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States

r1S2Hk2wAgJ4CevG6PAa1w.text: Enjoyed the rib eye steak here.  Cooked perfectly to order and was well seasoned and delicious.  This place had availability during a busy evening in Vegas, and we were here before Absinthe, so I was on a tighter schedule than usual.   Service was wonderful.  My rib eye was accompanied by the duck fat fries, which were excellent.  A filling meal (I considered a salad also, but the food I ordered was plenty, and who needs vegetables? :D).  Simple but clean decor inside the restaurant, and it's easy to find if you're already in or near Caesar's Palace.  The restaurant entrees that other diners were having looked great, especially the seafood options.    Prices are high here.  About $150 per person with drinks and extras. But a solid choice.

2MUhr23-uH9aop9ajNs8gg.text: Stopped in for a drink and a snack here on a Sunday evening.  I was thinking of going to the steak house, but the menu prices scared me away.  So I sat at the bar and had a drink and biscuits.  The drink - a "Smoked Old Fashioned" was really great.  Just fruity enough, a bit of campfire taste.  I also had a Long Island, which was adequate.  I ordered the appetizer biscuits, and I wasn't disappointed, but I was burned.  Literally - they arrived on a cast iron skillet and I burned my arm reaching over the skillet for my drink.  Didn't notice then, but the next day I had a blister on my arm, and it's still healing two weeks later.  But I contacted them (which wasn't easy, text messages or facebook page eventually found me the "security department" who relayed my message), and I was satisfied with their response; hopefully they will cover the handles in the future.  Because the biscuits were really, really tasty.  The only other strikes were the staff grumbling to each other about how hard it is to find a good job in Vegas, and the lingering stench of 50-some years of cigarettes and sorrow in the carpets outside in the casino I had to walk through to get there.

NMgBxtO4aMT4qTcnJecGyg.text: A little pricey in my opinion for the food here. The servt and everything was fine, just the food was ok. The scallops I get were good, but not great  Also I hated the roasted cauliflower. Both my friend and I who ordered it barely ate ours. The seasoning was awful on it.

7VPp6QOR9HAMbRJNCZnJwg.text: Searsucker has a great Happy Hour special from 5-7 pm, with beers costing around $5. This restaurant is conveniently located inside the Caesars Palace.   The decor is beautiful and the food was pretty decent too. My hanger steak was cooked to medium rare perfection!   The service was really nice and they were quick. They refilled the drinks consistently and was very friendly!

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1S6PjkrsUbm1-rCA_6ABTA.text: Do not hesitate!! Excellent service and excellent food! The service . The burger is excellent and the green salad with goat cheese is amazing!  Burata a must!!

z_wtWSgB4OBvQKWGc-5l4w.text: Nice place for a happy hour! The chicken sliders are bomb and the bartender is super cool. Will be back

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nom nom nom!

fsyWHYS6nUJfUwQG7S2reQ.text: We had a fabulous time last night celebrating my Mother's 70th birthday. There were 11 of us and they were all ready for us. The service was impeccable, there was never a delay in getting our glasses filled or any unnecessary delays at all. The food was amazing, with the exception of the charred octopus. That was hard to get down and really hard to believe that was what they were trying to present. No one at the table enjoyed it. Even so, everything else was wonderful and we had an amazing time. We will be back!

ny_OwTA-ZI85OmMHdymLwA.text: Ahhhmazing food great service accommodated a large group of friends for his bachelor party great place to have dinner while in LV and waiting to get into Ominia

ewhiafy84FieA1DtcNkdXg.text: Food tasted good, but the menu wasnt specific as to what was included in each item. For example, my companion had a burger that had a little bit of a green spread on it. Turns out it was an avocado spread and she is allergic to avocados. The server was not very attentive as we had to track her down for the bill.

8NhFSOfVP-RPLWgZAqFlVQ.text: I had the most amazing experience at Searsucker last night. I brought my friend Big Mike to one of my favorite spots in Vegas for dinner and drinks and had the greatest experience. I am a frequent visitor of Searsucker and have yet to find anything to complain about. However, in lieu of the incredible service I was lucky to receive last night, I finally felt it necessary to express my gratitude via Yelp.   I usually sit down at a table for dinner when dining here, but Big Mike insisted on sitting at the bar. His decision ended up being the greatest choice we could have made because of the incredibly attentive and friendly service we received from Jen, the coolest bartender I have had the pleasure of interacting with. And trust me, I've had my fair share of benders.   Jen was so genuinely kind and eager to please and make recommendations from the menu. She suggested some dishes I would never have ordered alone, and to my surprise, everything tasted better than ever before.   Big Mike loved Jen so much that he asked me to take his picture with her. She agreed, of course, without a glimmer of doubt in her eye - in the same fashion that she served us all night, in the way she made us feel comfortable - as if we were in the company of an old friend.  Jen made me love Searsucker even more and Big Mike won't stop bugging me about going back. I've never enjoyed eating dinner while sitting at the bar before last night. But if Jen is bartending, you can bet your life that's where I'll be.  So, thanks for being so rad Jen. Thanks for the delicious mixologist style cocktails and thanks for never making us feel like you were working. You look like you're having fun and that's so rare in the industry.   Cheers!   PS Peter Rabbits all night!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. YEAAAAAH JEN CRAFTED COCKTAILS
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BIG MIKE AND JEN

oxPD5pHXkNj0HBXfzwoJfQ.text: Lots of good small plates here - the goat cheese toast and calamari were great.  Wait staff was helpful and allowed us to order bit by bit so we could try several things without over ordering as small plates can sometimes be tough to judge. Tried the p, b & j old fashion, pretty good!  Mule was the hit drink of the night.  We will be back!

nilvDyzmJWz1TcPqNhvkOg.text: Had the drunken skirt steak and duck fat fries. Both were delicious... the steak was cooked perfectly for medium rare and fries were just amazing. Went with a large group of friends and no one had any complaints about the deliciousness of the food. If you go be sure to ask for an omnia chip that admits one to the Express line for club omnia right next door.

eKzHPNsPE-u_PxN_14idAw.text: Great drinks... can't beat happy hour. Had the sliders.... fantastic. Service was good. Nice location. Would def come back.

QjiDguPgz1ljPd7Mohfg7w.text: Not a great ambience for the price. Limited menu and couldn't make any changes in the preparation of items

04pjZqv5vA1HSI6aKpL_Ow.text: I've had the pleasure of dining at Searsucker in San Diego and decided we could enjoy a nice romantic dinner at the Las Vegas location.   We sat down and was greeted nearly 10 minutes after. First started with the specialty cocktail "snake in the grass" which was a over priced mint lemonade. I took a few sips and pushed it off to the side hoping our server would realize that I was unhappy with the specialty cocktail. My wife had the Malbec.   Started with the bone marrow which was actually the best part of our meal. For dinner we both ordered the NY Steak. Medium Rare for Me and Medium for my wife. I got the corn side dish and she had the asparagus.   The best part of our main course was the asparagus. $59 per steak? The $7.77 steak at Hard Rock  is far more superior than this over priced crap we were served. It was rubber and had no flavor. It was the hardest steak we've cut into. Our server asked how our meals were. I responded with, "it's alright."  And that was the last time our server spoke to us until we asked for the check. We were clearly unsatisfied.  My specialty cocktail pushed to the side which was clearly full. Both our steaks barely eaten and pushed to the side. We asked for the check and he asked if we wanted to box it up. We said no. Not one question as to why we were unhappy with the meal.   Searsucker has failed with customer service and quality of dinner. Never again will we eat here. A kitchen nightmare. Thanks for ruining our lovely night.

BwAItxie41WP4ZBWI44E8g.text: This was my first visit to Searsucker in Vegas.  They have a good happy hour during the weekend.  The dish are small, but what else would you expect.  They had about 5 or so cocktail options.  We tried almost each one.  Pretty good!

STZlpgWO91hrUdrotU9Bcw.text: Great customer service and the short rib plate was delicious. However, the duck fat fries weren't the crunchy consistency I was expecting, in fact they were pretty soggy. The pork slider was okay, but that's it just okay...

DmUSYtppds7VC3LPaR8tKA.text: This is just a review of the bar staff. OMG... awesome. No sooner dis i sit down I was Greeted with a smile. They were all over greeting every person and quickly bring them what they wanted with a big smile.  I wish it had chosen to have diner here rather than Mesa grill.

8ZTsUk9rtO8nPZK8c96xVg.text: I recently went to Vegas and Searsucker gave us the BEST meal! I still can't stop thinking about it.. drool. My friend and I split a few items: we started with the Field Greens & Pear Salad and added chicken, and it was almost like rotisserie chicken - super fresh and juicy. We also had the Shrimp Scampi (it comes with spaghetti squash) and Brussels & Walnuts. We felt like our items were super satisfying and generally healthy without being bland. Also not too overpriced compared to most places on the Strip! I'll be back! (*said in Arnold voice*)

DqikvUajB7KJDYcXU6GknA.text: The food is solid, and HH has some pretty good deals... but the service is terrrrrible- hit up HH 4:30-6PM for food and drinks at half price or less, but show up half an hour before you want anyone acknowledge you. No exaggeration. Oh, and then double check your receipt to be sure you were actually charged HH price instead of regular.   DUCK FAT FRIES + TOMATO JAM: All of my LA friends raved about duck fat fries like four years ago and I never tried them. These are some damn near perfect fries, but I was expecting some sort of distinct "duck fat" flavor and didn't really pick up on one. The tomato jam seems to just be a house-made ketchup with a bit of spice to it. STRAWBERRY + CHAMPAGNE + WALNUT + GOAT: It's a salad, fresh for summer. Instead of goat cheese crumbles or large circles, the cheese is served as a "fondue" on the plate. I found the sauce a little light on flavor and missed the texture it usually brings to a salad. "COBB" SALAD: Good portion, $6 for HH. Very fresh, lots of ingredients, cut to the proper size, and something I would get again even though it's far from a unique dish. TUNA + RADISH + TARO CHIPS + SPICE: The taro chips are huge and provide great texture. The poke itself was spicier than I expected but was exceptionally fresh. Not sure I'd get this again though.  EGGS + BACON "PORK BELLY": Cue the hallelujah choir! Perfectly poached egg, generous and thick cut of pork belly, drizzled with a delightful hollandaise with a slight sweetness to it, all atop a thin slice of toast. I'll wake up early every day if this is for breakfast! CRAB CAKE JUMBO LUMP + FENNEL + LEMON VERBENA AIOLI: Slightly salty but otherwise great! Made with very little filler, allowing the simple ingredients to shine. Server said this also had a Tabasco tobiko that I really enjoyed. Pretty pricey though at $17 regularly, a steal at $10 during HH. SHORT RIB "HARLOT" + HORSERADISH + FRIED ONION: It looked dry and didn't have much sauce, but was very tender and shredded easily. The fried onions and butter potatoes were simple but perfectly executed.  SWEET HEAT SQUID: Calamari in a sweet and sour sauce, with julienned apples. Fresh, good variety of textures, generous portion for HH. BF really enjoyed this. SHRIMP GRITS: Not a great version. Several shrimp, bland sauce, overcooked grits. This was a bit saucier than I liked and needed seasoning. Would not get this again, it's on the HH menu and I think it's priced appropriately there. MUSSELS: The broth was missing something, but was nicely fragrant with a large portion. The accompanying garlic bread was perfectly soft on the inside and crusty on the outside. Would get this again.  The food is pretty decent. Bar staff are friendly, but I have twice been assigned to a server who waited nearly a half hour to show up at my table, and nearly as long to bring the check. Given my two dismal service experiences during HH, it's not a place I'm willing to return for a full meal.

y8Wvcy18oTT1JGtqVdCz8Q.text: So I was in Vegas with the weekend planned...UNTIL SS!!! We went to SS with a group of friends, and my first gripe is the fact that they don't allow outside drinks. Yep, toss that Fat Tuesday out! Its Vegas and for a pretty pricey-not so amazing- restaurant the "no outside drink" rule is obnoxious. Second and even worse, my beau got the FISH and CHIPS and GOT FOOD POISONING as a result! I think his meal was not only around $30-40 but then it made him very very sick. And he got sick to the point where we had to cut the rest of our Vegas plans short because he had to be treated for his food poisoning. And NO, HE DOESNT DRINK SO IT WAS NOT ANY REACTION TO ALCOHOL! Third, I was at a table with about 14 people and several people sent back their food because it was salty! No go with salty and over priced meals! Anyway, BYPASS this Cesars not so royal restaurant! METHINKS NOT EVER AGAIN!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xJzR_OMR5lESJ21mBhrK_A.text: We came here for happy hour, the drinks were priced ok for Vegas $5-9.  The food was good, I guess we expected more from a top chef restaurant.  The biggest issue that we had was we had asked for the avocado on the side of our ahi tuna tacos because I am allergic to avocado but my wife isn't.  The bartender that took our order explained it was already on the side.  After my first bite into the taco I realized it was on the bottom of the taco as well.  Very disappointing. We also order the lollipop wings which were $9 on happy hour.  They had good flavor, but I don't think they were anything special.

37P9pqdjIArwyjee3uXBlg.text: Love the tomahawk!  My favorite steak of all Las Vegas restaurants.  The steak tar tar is a great starter and I always get the cauliflower as a side.  The short rib is also to die for but I would take the Tomahawk over anything else.  We sat at the bar this time and our awesome waitress Heather was very attentive and made sure we were happy.
