Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The best Tomahawk you could ever have
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our awesome bartender Heather!

WJb371XOgbR7LJZPlLcMAQ.text: We selected this restaurant for our party of 6 based on the reviews and food selection. We wanted something a little different, and the selections and review pictures looked quite interesting. It was an early dinner by Vegas standard, around 7pm. Hostess was wonderfully friendly and promptly seated us.   The dinner started with an introduction from our server, Cesar.  He was really great from beginning to end.  We really enjoyed his friendliness and appreciated his attentive service. We wanted to have some fun during dinner, and Cesar played right along!  The entire service was great, perfectly timed and we were well attended the entire time.   We chose a few share plates; Tomato and Burata (super delish), short ribs (succulent and tasty), and the duck fat fries (nicely seasoned and presented).  For our main courses most had the hanger steak.  It was perfectly cooked and tasted great. One word of caution: You better love garlic, like I do!  One person in our party had the burger, which she said was "amazing", and another had the Salmon (perfectly cooked).  As if that wasn't enough, we finished off with the awesomely decadent ice cream sandwich. Man, the flavors there were unbelievable.   All in all, we each enjoyed the food and Cesar's excellent service.  We'd all recommend the place for a slightly different take on American classics.

Z_0hvsNLaS_kl5j1iwQhoQ.text: So good I ate here twice.....  I needed a change from all the extremely pretentious spots on Vegas.  I wasn't even staying at caesars but came back after my first experience.   Happy hour old fashions from 5-7 we're legit. You get a nice selection of $9 old fashions and they were all good.....no skimping on the whiskey here.  Also for happy hour, they serve $2 dollar sliders, oysters and bone marrow.  Those selections alone could make a nice dinner.  But.....I also had a full meal....and it was delicious!  Small plates for dining was a great option for us.  Fried pig ears were awesome.  Octopus was awesome.  Short ribs was perfect.  Their poke starters were amazing...served on a fried seaweed chip.  The wings were a pleasant surprised as they were served in a unique way.  There were a few small plates that were ok but the variety we had made up for it.  The bar always had seating even during one of Vegas's busiest conventions. I'm giving this place 4 stars because I actually think I got my money's worth....and that says a lot when you're hanging out in Vegas.

yBBHy7gymP7pCNuf4UGfiQ.text: Great decor, open kitchen, service and reflection of their original San Diego flagship.   Their branzino fish & chips dish was fantastic, as were the frenched chicken lollipops, vegan Thai curry and octopus.   Excellent experience and a good addition to Caesar's.

K1FGdQj-e8tkhGCGVMQdjg.text: We went here with my family before Absinthe! It was ahh-mazing.  The vibe of the place is a little nautical mixed with a little cabin woods.  I love the off white colors mixed with the accents of wood.  It was very relaxing yet vibrant- a perfect way to describe the food & the ambience.  Just go ahead and order the Jalaberry Strawpeno - You're welcome.   - If you love Calamari- you are required to try there Calamari Steaks. It will take you down a flavor road that you never knew existed.    - Lollipop wings are always a great idea at ANY of the Hakkasan Group restaurants.   - MAC & CHEESE - HOLY LORD ALMIGHTY........Just do it.   - Beer Braised Short Ribs so light and cooked to perfection.  The flavors on the short ribs will make you come back for more.   Thanks to the Searsucker staff for always doing a great job & answering all the recommendations. We will be back!

47_I6DxsSwDiZZM53-VEcQ.text: Incredible! I loved everything about my visit tonight...the ambiance was welcoming and upscale, the service was impeccable (our server Gianna was professional, attentive, and so sweet), and the food was amazing...I highly recommend Searsucker. Thanks for a great experience!

Tw5G2wRz4jU0lQ5y7aj6Lg.text: Went there for dinner last week and boy were we not disappointed.  The Pork Belly with egg is so yummy.  The chicken lollypops are a nice twist on a chicken wing.  Very flavorful.  The albacore with prosciutto was very nice.  A different twist on Tuna.  All the cocktails are great, but my favorite was the honey badger which was made with  rye and fresh lemon + honey syrup.  MMMMMMM

O2oo8PNncLDpmGSVfjJJ2Q.text: Tried this restaurant for the first time last night. At  our table, we had the filet, the shrimp and the pork butt as well as the duck fat fries, the calamari, the tuna wanton tacos and the biscuits. Everything was great, including the sides (buttered potatoes and Brussels sprouts). We will definitely be back.

iO9sHcuCts1sM25SblsSZA.text: Omg! Me & My Husband went here for my Bday dinner we were walking around & we seen it,  looked like a bar? So we sat down very great customer service our waitress was awesome! !! Our food was more than amazing for appetizer we had spicy shrimp sauteed.  Then I had Salmon veggies side of mashed potatoes.  My Husband had the swordfish truly awesome here the chef made our food so good that everything we tasted after that point was nasty! So glad my birthday dinner was amazing! !!!

r6S76sjpJrLn9OPOq-Pu9Q.text: I LOVE their brussel sprouts with walnuts. I would go back and just order that as a meal. As my entree, I ordered the flank steak. It was good, but I would probably order and try something else. It was nothing special. They said the pork butt was a popular dish.  5 stars for customer service. Our waiter was amazingly awesome.   I will definitely come back the next time I'm in town.

7cIlS-rp6RzedM-Spc_Maw.text: I was invited here through work and it was great! I started off with the adult Arnold Palmer which is sweet tea vodka and lemonade (amazing!) then we had the short rib which was so tender and melts in your mouth! We then had the duck fat fries which were seriously the best fries I've ever had! Then we had the shrimp and grits which is in a red sauce and oh my gosh it's so amazing they come with so much shrimp it's so good! We then had at their signature pork butt entree that came with a Southwestern corn which was so good and other mashed potatoes which was also very very very good! We then topped our meal off with some dessert we had there a banana split which had brownies chocolate ganache a caramelized banana and peanut butter and vanilla and chocolate ice cream which was heaven!! We also had their cookies which came with milk for dunking which I thought was really cute. The meal was amazing we even got to meet the chef and he came to our table introduce himself he's really nice guy.  I will definitely be coming back to this place it's a great place to go to if you don't want anything too formal and nothing too casual right in the middle it's great to go to if you're ready to start your night out in Vegas!

f6rV_SX84z2ZuB3J8lWsLA.text: I love the ambiance and the cocktails. Chef Malarkey & Hakkasan Group have really done a great job  taking a see and be seen San Diego "locals restaurant" and turning it into a viable global brand.

Dh95XDvkamsSglXMubCXaQ.text: Amazing cocktails and atmosphere. The cookie for dessert is delicious! Great place to check out with friends

1kENu9RobS16M2BfsUYn8w.text: Food and service are both excellent. Came here for happy hour had the shrimp and grits crab cakes and Caesar salad. Plenty of food for 2 people. HH has good selection of food not just bar bites. Drinks for HH have plenty to choose from not limited to well drinks and crappy beer. Service was great attentive without hovering food cam out very quick. Good amount of seating options for HH will definitely be bringing friends and out of towners.

3tr1-4v1ZF2HdQlaUvvzlA.text: We went for happy hour.  Great happy hour menu and prices.  We got the strawberry, walnut and goat cheese salad - excellent.  We ordered the short ribs, shrimp and grits and crabcake.  All were great.  Great atmosphere and drinks!

5XK8Nu7vtY6OxlChpqKxRg.text: Nice selection of small plates and cocktails. The service was great, and we enjoyed our meal. I definitely will come back on my next Vegas trip!

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short ribs- delicious!
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon and eggs

ZQjbiLAyzzKjNs4qNjksEQ.text: Got the roasted chicken and it was very dry. Was disappointed for how much it cost! Also our server was very snoody!

p38kITQngzks6V-qzrWI7g.text: Terrible experience.Drove to Vegas to see my dad and let him meet the kids. I insisted on taking him to dinner at my favorite spot in San Diego; searsucker in Las Vegas. What a disappointment; service was below average waiter acted bothered and had attitude when asking questions; ordered the 145 dollar tomahawk that's was not seasoned and they had it sliced into strips and off the bone. Also it looked substantially  smaller than normal and no juice( ordered many times at del mar location) Not to mention the sides came 5 minutes after steak did and rest of dinner came in 5-10 after the steak arrived. About 30/40 minutes for a unseasoned and dry steak. Tomato soup was not hot; somewhere between cold and warm and bacon and egg dish was soggy. Major disappointment for owner who has top chef status. Oh let's not mention my old fashion was half maybe 3/4 filled. Lastly the bell hoy was in our face ever minute to collect dishes and took leftover chicken before I can take home. I spend 350 and waiter took time to add top of 20%. Major disappointment after putting a lot of talk into the dinner leading up to the dinner. Everyone left disappointed.   Update- management did reach out and was very professional and response. For this I raise you a star.

T_pycVmuHJtjZePXcdD7MA.text: It was our first time here and it was more amazing than we what we heard. Servers were upbeat and wonderful. Desiree was awesome and had great knowledge of the menu. Definitely coming back for more. Ermahgurd!!

Mg0dynbL2E-J0783ytagnw.text: Great food, excellent service, yummy drinks and a bargain happy hour - what more could you want?   The first time we went we missed happy hour, but went anyway because we were hungry. We had the short ribs (to die for!), mushrooms on toast and drinks. The waiter very sweetly brought us a dessert on the house because of missing happy hour - it was delightful, as thoughtful things always are!  Went back the next night for happy hour, and tried to eat them out of house and home. Duck fat fries were outstanding, more short ribs, cheese puffs, a couple of salads, shrimp and grits - everything was on point and delicious, plus bargain priced. Don't miss it!

6jb3LL1gFYfZKbVnr6qKeQ.text: I've been a big fan of Searsucker in San Diego so it was a treat to see it pop up in Las Vegas - started with 3 rounds of the addictive cheddar puffers, loved the ponzu shishito peppers and was really happy with the spicy tuna tartar

EEMgb53WZWucPd9MOXoG3w.text: Duck fat fries were really good. Grilled cheese and tomato soup was OK. The grilled cheese was good, bread was kinda thick though, the tomato soup was not.  I was really craving a burger and they let me order one even though it  wasn't on the dinner menu...I'm glad they did bc it was a tasty burger!  My husband got the short rib app and mussels. I got to try those as well. Both were done well and very good.  For dessert we opted for the sundae.  Service was great and we had a nice dinner with friends.

pws-Na2DBGIfQPC8XBxjSg.text: I have sensitivities and it is not easy for me to order. This was the third restaurant we tried, while staying at Caesars Palace. With a name like Searsucker-I figured beef only.   Our server was awesome!  He understood my needs and made a fabulous recommendation. The food was great!  I will eat there again. Sadly, I will not stay at Caesars again.

N93U2yY3vg8HLeKhCqMZPQ.text: Loved this place. We had an amazing waitress and I'm sad that I can't remember her name. She brought out complimentary cheddar puffers with jalapenos. I love my cheese, so this was off to a great start! She suggested that we try the 'Eggs & Bacon' which is a slice of brioche topped with the most succulent pork belly with a poached eggs glazed in hollandaise sauce. It was a life changing experience! MUST HAVE! We also had the bone marrow which was one of the best I've ever tried followed by the beef tartare. Can't wait to go back to Vegas so I can go to this restaurant again!

MPKy_GqyQlkNHBh2E3fJCA.text: My boyfriend and I dined here during happy hour and sampled just about everything. The service was absolutely excellent. Our server sent over a complimentary appetizer as well as comped our dessert as it was my birthday. The food quality, portions and prices are all great for being right on the strip. There was also a great beer menu. Also a bonus, the owner (prior Top Chef contestant) was in the restaurant the day we dined there. We would definitely go back and would recommend this restaurant to everyone.

y3SpysJ457t4GZv-QMs7-w.text: My first time at this place was amazing. Service was awesome. I was so excited to come back to Vegas to eat at Searsucker. It was such a disappointment. We went during happy hour on Wednesday. We sat and waited for a server. We ended up going to the bar for menus where the bartender said our server would be with us shortly. After waiting 15 minutes we ended up ordering at the bar. The place wasn't busy. In fact, I saw a couple employees standing at the bar. When our food came out it was delivered by someone who worked in the kitchen, we had to ask him for silverware and plates. Nobody ever checked in on us and we ended up going to the bar again to ask for our check. This place was one of my favorite stops when I visited and has become the only bad experience on my vacation. :(

ZNaBl7Kc8p3jmsB6QXmdZQ.text: Great customer service!  The calimari was not that great smothered in sweet sauce. And fries too much seasoning. The burger was good but not great. Their house wine sweet ;/ but great ambiance and staff. And convenient if in Caesars.

AoggmOWANq1pbXfHcjivyw.text: Awesome awesome food. Had the bad bad t-roy brown to start and the peter rabbit which were both amazing. Moved to a table and our server was extremely knowledgable. ( Sorry I forgot his name) The green peppercorn reduction was damn good on the Aged Strip and those butter potatoes were on point. Thanks for being our last meal in Vegas before coming home to NY!

5AR2tw187aj-6Drj5zrQGw.text: The fish and chips are the best thing...with amazing presentation. If you leave without trying the Rocky Road Bread Pudding, you are a fool. It is sheer delight.

vKmamz_AuBa1bb8nyj-QEQ.text: Fantastic food!! A little on the pricey side but well worth it. We had reservations for 6pm and had no problems. We all tried a different cocktail. I got When Doves Cry; the tequila was strong but it was tasty. Friend got the ballerina & the czar; it was spritzy, pink and tasted great. For food we ordered the duck fat fries, short ribs, and my favorite item, egg + bacon!! It was sweet and salty, delicious. And then the cheddar puffers! Wow. Desserts were also on point. We ordered the smores, banana bread, and the pj and jelly puff! So much great food! Our server was excellent. So happy we made the trip down to the strip!

NA2LsXIy9pfHTingqQGxpw.text: We just got home from a trip to Vegas for my 35th Bday! We were there for 3 nights so we tried many restaurants. I would have to say this was a favorite. The mixed cocktails are a must!!!!! We actually left the restaurant from dinner and then went back for a 2nd round later in the evening! Yum!

stNFEsVwfbRgs-EfexVioA.text: This is a solid new restaurant.  The bar tenders are really nice.  Of course I stopped here during restaurant week and the menu was great.  For $40 I started with one of the most beautiful salads I had even eaten.  It had a puddle of what could only be described as goat cheese loveliness spread on the bottom of my plate.  Then there was a generous topping of assorted lettuces, plus lots of strawberries topped with balsamic.  It was so nice.  I then had the flat iron steak which was real decent, but the star of that was the chimmichuri.  I may not have spelled that correctly, but you know what I mean.  The end of the meal was AMAZING as I had the cookies and milk.  So delicious.  There were three cookies and they were chocolately amazingness with just a quick sprinkle of sea salt on top.  I have decided that if I ever make chocolate chip cookies, I am sprinkling sea salt on top.  Now, mind you, I already do this with my peanut butter cookies, but who knew salt would be equally delicious on chocolate chip cookies??  A quick note, I find the dining area to be EXCEEDINGLY loud as there are bare floors and lots of people squished into a small spot.  The music was awesome though, even if it added to it's loudness ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Is there much better than milk and cookies?  These are the best cookies I have ever had...sprinkled with sea salt
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hWGxYcyyQ8BuNKW833KJkg.text: Oh my God!!!! The food was delectable. We just had the  shared plates . 4 of them between 2 of us and it was enough. Forget about portion size, the fast of each and everyone one of those dishes was exquisite. We had the Calamari, Bone Marrow, Tomato Burrata & olives and Eggs &Bacon. I kid you not that this was the best meal in Vegas !!!

dwJH4etKmW_TUeUKH82HUw.text: Excellent drinks and service! Make sure to say "Hi" to Adrian at the Bar, awesome bartender!

R3fYoLBfWAXo5DR4cMBDRg.text: Now added to the list of restaurants I'll return to in Vegas. I was on business; would consider it pricey otherwise. Knowledgeable professional server made the evening. Biscuits - yum. Peppers also very good. I had the Mexican shrimp with asparagus and was completely satisfied. Cozy atmosphere - a little noise, but not terrible for Vegas. Had a fun vibe with well done food.

uvP8mLnTIyWYt3P5UNW9Og.text: Was in Vegas for business and had the pleasure of dining at Searsucker last Saturday night.  We had a 7:00 reservation and although the place was packed when we arrived we were seated right away at a really cozy table at the back of the restaurant.  Our server was really helpful and made some great recommendations.  We started with the warm spinach salad, which was absolutely delicious.  The hubby had the swordfish with a side of Cauliflower and I had the shrimp with a side of corn.  Everything that came out was flavorful and perfectly cooked.  My husband said it was the best fish he's ever had. Only regret is that we totally cleaned our plates and didn't have room to try any of the desserts.  Overall the experience was really great.  Good service without being pretentious, good drinks, and excellent food.  Will definitely come back next time we're in town.

-gJDhD-IwR6zXN5giO6vrg.text: So excited that their Vegas location has opened! Searsucker San Diego has always been a favorite of mine. Plus now the Vegas restaurant is perfectly placed in Caesars next to Omnia Nightclub, and with extended hours. So we can grab some green eggs and ham (seriously! A must try) after working up an appetite on the dance floor. Best addition in a long time!

JTtgIG_hWONSx5dbD8qGcQ.text: Pretty good. Becareful, they will try very hard to upsell you big time, esp with water!

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert plattef
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet w/ crab

EC9LN_WbRJctCkMG8x0EPQ.text: Walk. Don't walk. That's the sign at the entrance. Much like a pedestrian crossing light. This place must be fun! The hostesses were welcoming and promptly offered an invite into the restaurant. Once my friend arrived we were shown inside by the lovely Stephanie who showed us the bar and the kitchen area, as well as our "people watching seats". It's nice to see the kitchen operation in action. Everything the chefs were working on looked fresh.  Desiree was our server. She came to us right away to welcome us and brought the Happy Hour menus. We had about 15 minutes before their Happy Hour was over so we promptly ordered four cocktails and 2 appetizers. The cocktails were crafty and delicious. The fuck dat fries, sorry the Duck Fat Fries with chipotle ketchup had just the right combination of flavors, they were pulpy, fresh and crispy, not too spicy (thank goodness for me!). I couldn't taste the duck but they were delish nonetheless . The short rib "the harlot" though was soooo freaking good! It was tender and juicy and the mashed potatoes and the crispy onions OMG I could eat like 3 or 4 or 5 of those orders! Yumm! We followed with the strawberry walnut goat cheese salad, Wow great combination of textures, with fruit and crunchiness and fresh greens. Then the Tuna albacore wrapped in prosciutto, sherry alioli and balsamic balls (gooey balls, yumm!) with a delicious Frisee salad, barely seared but definitely rear tuna (sashimi grade for sure!) was sooooooo good! The tuna just melts in your mouth! By then I was starting to feel full but I couldn't stop eating it. Unfortunately we had no room for dessert but the chocolate chip cookies looked finger licking good. Desiree was super friendly and informative and kept us entertained in between dishes. She made some excellent recommendations. You could tell she enjoys talking about the different menu items and how much she loved trying them all during pre-opening. If you are lucky enough to get Desiree during your visit, you will be a pampered guest! Her assistant Ahi (Aji?) (I called him Ajilipollas) was friendly and always kept our water glasses topped. I can't wait to visit Searsucker again so I can try the other items I wish I could've eaten today. I'm no terminator but "I'll be back!".

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Indian Summer / Ballerina and the Czar
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short rib &#34;the harlot&#34;
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry, champagne, Walnut and goat cheese salad

uEPOGBm8rgsQN1HPyu0NaA.text: Good Food, fun appetizers, quick service and a delightful staff. We enjoyed cocktails and some apps before seeing a concert this weekend. The shrimp and grits were very tasty and had a nice kick to them, the complimentary cheeze puffs hit the spot and the waiter offered to give us to go cups for our cocktails. We were happy patrons! I would totally stop by again to eat a full meal the next time I'm in Vegas.

7_EYqCvccaFezxmugxR9zw.text: I was brought to this restaurant by a local and promised some delicious food, I didn't realize my expectations were going to exceeded. This place was fantastic from the warm inviting atmosphere to the amazing food. Emily made some suggestions as to what my table should order and share, she was spot on and we all loved the food. Take my advice, if you don't know what delicious item to order just ask the friendly staff. If you are lucky enough to get Emily as your server she may just warm you milk and cookies desert as well. Thanks guys for the lovely evening.

dLIuy2DAAN63QG90NHTUMQ.text: Not worth the money at all! Their options of small plates are pretty limited but the dumbfounded aspect is finding out the grilled chicken addition to our salad was more expensive than the actual salad. It was $15 while the salad alone was $12. I wish the server told us prior rather than us finding out on the bill.

8_2igtBKiPW6En0Iq_EAaw.text: Good food and good service. We had a large group and needed to be out by a certain time. The chef was really great about creating a tapas style meal. The ahi tacos, steak tartar were good. I wouldn't write home about the entrees, steak, chicken, and fish. Those were alright, not great. The Stars were definitely the more appetizer style dishes. I would come back if prompted.

llPnajVXcNQ5ill5R2oy7g.text: Had the pleasure of coming here one night after Seeing NERVO play at Omnia Nightclub. I didn't even know they had late night. One of the Cocktail server assistants told me about it while we were in Omnia. It had to have been around 3:30am or so. Pretty awesome how the place stays open late when the club is going on. We hurried up and ordered the chicken & waffles as we heard they were amazing! Service staff is on point! Our server Steve was highly knowledgeable about the food and also vouched for the said Chicken & waffles. They were indeed worthy of the hype surrounding them, haha! Food was brought out quick! Matt (food runner guy) asked if we needed anything and made sure we got al we needed to devour the luscious food (I said luscious). I would highly recommend coming here again and we probably will come by during normal dinner time as well. Food was awesome as well as the service. Now you guys know where to head after going to OMNIA!!! Ha!   (Sorry no pics, I lost my phone before the night ended)

dJ9uImG-jmidDGbPxIePhg.text: I always heard about the one in San Diego so I had to come in for the grand opening, let me tell you this is what vegas needed! Great food, drinks and service!

-IqpmNYVt9W1rsEElz5YGA.text: The food was pretty good but it's unfortunate that I wouldn't recommend this restaurant based on how the hostess treated me and my family. She had long blonde hair and her name was Nikki.  When we requested a table she stated the restaurant wasn't opening until 4minutes. Two parties right after us was seated immediately. All the Caesar affiliated restaurants cater to diamond players and even let you skip the line. It's such a pity that this hostess didn't have any manners regardless of what customers we were.   In addition, the waitress asked the manager to come speak to us but that was non existent.  On side note our waitress Tammie

DIiSZmU2Zz2PsDFLdfydKA.text: Best Oysters Ever!  We couldn't get enough.  We were headed to the Oyster Bar when we found this little gym.  We went three times in our three day stay!  The bartenders were great.  Heather and Michael big shout out!  Definitely coming back

iegFE_GRGS58-1nPMRxDxw.text: We stopped here for a quick dinner while staying at Caesars and didn't really have set expectations for the food because the over the years various grab and go snack or burger joints have moved in and out of this space, but we were honestly pleasantly surprised by our experience.   The location is kind of tucked away so unless people are gambling in that area or do some research I feel like they probably aren't even aware that it is there. The interior has cool decor and lighting. The atmosphere is modern and inviting. And the vibe is come as you are and come hungry.  I did love that they had a Yelp check-in offer. I just started using Yelp a few months ago so I am always very excited when I find a new place that provides an offer with check-in and theirs did not disappoint! They brought me an entire bowl of Habanero and Coriander soaked pickles and as a pickle lover I was very pleased!   We decided to order multiple dishes and share them at the table.  Below is a breakdown of what we ordered:  -Biscuits with whipped butter and infused honey *Literally do not leave here without eating these and make sure to smother them in honey. SO good.  -Tomato and burrata in a mason jar *kind of a twist on caprese salad or bruschetta - very "instagramable" presentation and delicious.  -Field greens and pear salad with champagne vinegar goat cheese and candied walnuts *loved this salad and everything in it -- definitely recommend.  -Shrimp Scampi with spaghetti squash, garlic, and lemon *my mom and sister really enjoyed this. I am not a huge spaghetti squash fan so it wasn't my favorite.  -Slider trio with bacon, cheddar, chipotle, and crispy onions.  *my mom and sister are a little bit pickier when it comes to sauces and toppings so I was willing to eat the sliders sans chipotle and onions, but the staff were so accommodating that they brought the plate of 3 customized to our liking (1 with everything and 2 without). These were awesome so I can only imagine how delicious the full size burgers are!  Overall I would strongly recommend Searsucker as a break from the steakhouses and reservation only restaurants. The food is great, the service is awesome, and the environment is casual and relaxing. Don't forget to check in when you arrive!

S3S2L7wBJAzGcj0ZYJ7UeA.text: Our drinks and food were delicious,  our server was delightful and i would definitely recommend dinner to a friend here.

e_hbdgTKFZ4UzlATrVpPbA.text: Top notch food  Relaxed but upscale atmosphere Friendly, knowledgeable waitstaff  Jenn took me to Searsucker for my most recent Birthday dinner. We enjoyed sharing several offerings starting with the Blackened Ahi Tacos- small but packed with flavor. Next was the Calamari Steak with Chili Honey Glaze and Apples- strongly recommended by our server-- thank goodness. This is NOT typical fried Calamari O's you could get at any ordinary chain place. No no no!! Think more of the difference in canned tuna and real fresh Ahi= yes now you get it! The Calamari Steak will change your life-- or at least your expectations of seafood for bit. Lastly we shared The Braised Pork Butt Entree- a tower of flavor power! So melt in your mouth type tender. Whiskey Apples, Brussels Sprouts and Prosciutto round out the experience.  Also worth mention is the wide variety of hand crafted cocktails- especially the Jaleberry Strawpeno-- tequila with fruit and heat.

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jaleberry Strawpeno Cocktail
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari Steak shared plate  (MUST TRY )
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari Steak shared plate. (MUST TRY)

sF4RtaELVanb6u2Dgeuc7g.text: There are a lot of restaurants in Caesar's Palace and I ate at three of them. This was  the most expensive of the three. It was so expensive I ordered the hamburger. While the hamburger was good and also a good size, it was $25.   The bar served their mixed drinks in very warm glasses filled with large cubes so they put only a small amount of alcohol in them and just let them get watered down by the heat of the glass. That was disappointing. Ordered a bottle of wine and they brought out a different year stating they did not have the year represented on the menu. Not a big deal unless you were only willing to pay that high of a price and ordered a specific bottle and vintage off the menu because you knew it was a good year for that wine and also knew the bookend years were not as good...as was the case here. We did get an apology from the manager stating they'd intended to update the menu but hadn't yet done so. We sent the wine back before they'd opened it.   The staff was friendly and my dinner guests seemed to enjoy themselves. They were kind enough not order the $145 cowboy steak - for obvious reasons.

HGYKddZMNjdFM0nc0Nlvxg.text: Good location inside of Caesars Palace, next to Omina night club, New style of American cuisine, food size big .

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States

y1SegVw7G57pbQAWvve1Cw.text: This is a must eat place!!! Everything was perfection! Delicious!!!  Do it! You'll thank me later I promise

XiC-WCYLx55cYDNNpS9diw.text: We came for happy hour.  Good beverages, decent oysters.  I would definitely go back!

G1YhMdR2FoP6BfvtJR6xWQ.text: Fabulous restaurant inside Caesar's Palace.  They really feature Old Fashioned's.  They have a peanut butter and jello, a hot and spice and even a Bananas Foster.  We tried a little of everything and the service and food was superb.  Love the feel of the place. Right by the sports book, please go to this great place.

Usw81BEs2YlalKrTnG8r_Q.text: Great food, drinks, service, the works. I came to Searsucker to watch game 3 of the World Series and have dinner with co-workers. The pork ears especially stood out, as well as the cocktails. Ask about the Omnia package-- spend $50 and you get a chip that allows you to cut the line. Totally worth it.

r2AU8xuMn6SXc8IZYsy0dw.text: Wanted a small bite so split the lollipop wings and tomato soup with grilled cheese. The wings were okay but the tomato soup was stellar, lots of flavor and that grilled cheese was the best I have EVER had. Service was great and food came out fast. I love the interior decor and all the different light fixtures especially the chandelier in the black cage. Really cool place! You won't be disappointed.

PaujmkMVe5IJfq27duQ15w.text: Good atmosphere, delicious food and great service.  We came here as a party of four and all new to this restaurant. We were greeted by a warm and welcoming server who explained some of the dishes, cocktails and what she recommended.   We started with a few cocktails including the Peter Rabbit and Bad Bad T-Roy Brown. I loved the Rabbit... I added the gin to it and it made for an easy to drink refreshing cocktail that was a little sweeter so the alcohol didn't overwhelm you. Definitely a hit.  As for the food, we ordered the kale and romaine caesar, potato fries, JP's chicken wings, jalapeno-chorizo corn, brussels & walnuts and eggs and bacon.   My favorites were the potato fries, corn and brussels. The fries were so delicious fried in duck fat! They were crunchy, salty and had more flavor then a regular french fry because of the oil. The chipotle ketchup they are served with was also good fit and we asked for an extra serving of it. The brussel sprouts were roasted with a nice char on them and were tossed in lemon and walnuts. I loved the extra crunch from the walnuts and the tangy zest from the lemon. I could have eaten the whole dish by myself. I felt the same about the corn, spicy and sweet. It's a dish I wouldn't normally order but I am glad we did.   We also had the pb & J dessert and chocolate s'more dessert. I think they were both hits but the preferred the s'mores.   We had great service, the dishes all came out in a timely manner one or two at a time which I appreciated so we could take our time and our table wasn't packed to the brim with dishes. Thanks for the experience Searsucker!

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The drink menu. I recommend the Peter Rabbit.
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The duck fat fries! Do it!
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The jalapeño chorizo corn. Delicious!

tieM45HCCLCN7gcL071Iuw.text: A large group of us came here for dinner a few weeks ago. First off, our waitress (I believe her name is Lindsey - shorter and blond?) was wonderful!! She knew the whole menu, and she never missed a beat with our group.  Drinks: When Doves Cry - Two thumbs up Snake in the Grass - meh. Too sweet, it didn't taste like it had any alcohol in it. We had a taste of a syrah that was just terrible. Maybe it had been open too long, or maybe the wine was just that bad.  We had more cocktails and quite a few wines, but I don't remember enough about them to post anything.  Food: Braised Pork Butt - Tasty, more than enough food by itself! Scallops - Great, definitely worth ordering Bigeye Tuna - Very good, though it could have used a little more flavor to kick it up a notch Tacos - looked good but were itty bitty. Some of the smallest tacos I have ever seen. The warm spinach salad looked a little on the small side too. Though spinach really shrinks up with heat so maybe that is why.  Also, for those wondering...the things listed under 'Jars and Sliced' literally come in a jar. Not great if you are sharing, but fun if it is just for you.  Overall, a great option for dinner close to the strip!

o_z03yem315dbhFivSI0Mw.text: My review is strictly based on the happy hour and frankly, I just wasn't impressed. My friends and I arrived at around 5:30pm and sat in the bar area (which had plenty of empty seating, a plus). We were quickly approached by an unenthused waiter who put off blaring vibes of, "you're not going to tip much so I'm not going to waste my time." We ordered our drinks and they were definitely heavy poured but over priced even for happy hour. The food, however, was pretty good. I ordered the sliders and really enjoyed the sriracha mayo that came with it while my friends ordered the ahi tuna tacos and buffalo chicken pops (FYI, they don't have ranch)  Overall it was a bland experience and bland service (and an awkward "is everything ok here??" by the manager). Their regular menu looked interesting and I'd bet if I returned for an actual meal I would receive better service, but I probably wont return unless someone else was so inclined.

de84TLdUakUC7Chc7omOAQ.text: This place was pretty good overall. I had some good drinks, my wife had a good drink and one bad drink, and the food was pretty good. Overall for the price, it was a pretty good deal for a restaurant at Caesars Palace.

rFDBoMG5SYGFp0agi5DGxw.text: I've been meaning to write this review sooner but am just getting around to it now. I was with a large group of people in attendance at the CinemaCon  convention for NATO(The National Association of Theater Owners) in Las Vegas this past April. We attended many events where we were served outstanding meals but also elected to dine at several restaurants on The Strip. Someone had recommended Searsucker so a group of about 15 people made reservations and went there for dinner. The service started out OK,but none of the waitstaff were particularly friendly nor attentive. The food was good but there were several mix-ups in our order and we were certain at one point that they brought us more plates of appetizers than we actually ordered.We ended up leaving much food behind. The final frustration for me was that a couple of us had asked for sparking water and a large bottle of Voss sparkling water was brought to the table. We finished that one and asked for another. This time a bottle(same bottle?) was brought back to the table uncapped, but we only drank a small amount. When we asked to take the remainder of the bottle with us the waitstaff first told us that they had thrown out the cap and we could have it poured in plastic cups(?). When I suggested they open another bottle that they were going to serve already opened(as they did ours)and give us THAT cap they insisted they would be unable to do that. Finally one of the waitstaff came back and told us they had miraculously "found" a cap so we could take the bottle but seemed very annoyed with us at this point and made little effort to conceal their annoyance from us,their patrons. We spent several hundred dollars on our meals and drinks and also tipped far better than the service we received warranted . Considering the many dining options in Las Vegas on the strip I would NEVER go to Searsucker again specifically because of the rudeness and unprofessionalism of their staff.

sYPp0YQore6s7x1ocwUAPQ.text: Amazing drinks, delicious food and a great atmosphere is the perfect combination for a relaxing and enjoyable dining experience.  We tried this place because we liked the menu online and live in SoCal and with the options near home it was a good way to try some yummy food that we may also be able to try when home.  We will be trying the restaurants near home for sure too.    The service was solid but we also were there during Happy Hour so it was a slight slow at times but over all very solid.  We went during Happy Hour and got a collection to share at the table to try several different options.  Hummus - very flavorful and the bread was delicious alone but the hummus added to It.  Potato fries - anything fried in duck fat is going to be amazing and this did not disappoint.  The prosciutto dust added to the flavor.  Slider - perfectly cooked and had a nice spicy to them.  Tuna taco - fresh and flavorful

J9J1x_SzJ7CFYFltKqk2Ww.text: Don't be fooled by their website which says they are open until 12am. We were turned away by the hostess at 11:20pm who told us they were closed.

CPN8Z5Pa_ra-ICLNC-EcHw.text: Amazing food!! Could not go wrong with whatever you end up choosing. Calamari steak was excellent!! That was probably my favorite of all the dishes we tried.   Calamari Steak 10/5 Lollipop wings 5/5 Fish & chips 5/5 - presentation is gorgeous! Spaghetti Squash Scampi 5/5 Short ribs 5/5 - super tender!! Pork belly 4/5 - I'm biased though cause I'm not a big pork fan.  Ice Cream Sammies   Cookies & milk   I gotta go back for happy hour one day!

naHWQBfJ2pPJ5PZnwksLog.text: The Frenched Buffalo wings were good. A very authentic Buffalo sauce with tasty well prepared wing. My only criticism is it's a little, fancy & expensive considering it's the proximity  to one of the biggest sportsbooks in Vegas. Also they only had appetizers & salads available when I went there. I was told the main course menu was still under construction. If this type of menu was presented in an upper floor cocktail lounge it would be more fitting. I wish them luck & offer a suggestion. Due to it's location, having some kind of food or drink promotions for larger sporting events "March madness" for example could make this spot a must stop when in Ceaser's!

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Frenched Buffalo wings

lz-X_BCCYM6FdQUZDfxpAQ.text: When you walk in the front of Caesars, head right, towards the sports book, and this isn't too far away from the front on the right. It's across from Alto Bar.   I arrived at 6:15 on a Sunday and although it seemed busy, I was easily able to get a seat at the bar. I was greeted and given a menu right away. There isn't much for food on the happy hour menu, but more cocktails than I expected based on a menu I saw online. I ordered and quickly got my drink. It took them a little longer to take my food order, but not too bad. No one asked me how my drink was though.   I went with the burger. They said everything is homemade with it and they only make 20 per day. I asked if anything came with it and they said bun, ketchup, etc. I asked if I could add fries and they said it came with it. Ummm...that's what I was getting at when I asked if anything came with it.   The burger was really good. The pickles that came with it were too spicy for me. They didn't bring ketchup with the fries but the bartender got it for me.   The service was okay, but not that friendly. I wasn't asked if I wanted another drink so I stopped with just one when I would've had two. Someone next to me said that the bartender seemed grumpy. This would've been a 4 Star for me with friendlier, more attentive service.

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Snake in the Grass happy hour drink $9
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9fQjNOJ9UdAySdCuvbhuCQ.text: Oh man! This place was absolutely amazing, and I had one of the best meals of my life when we came here. We went there for my fiancee's birthday. Had reservations, but didn't take into account all of the traffic when we booked the reservation. Had to call from the Lyft on our way there, but they were totally nice about us being late. Didn't bat an eyelash.  Like I said, the food was off the charts. My steak was cooked perfectly and was one of the best steaks of my life.  Service was on point. My fiancee loved her food, and we had amazing time for her birthday. I'd definitely go back the next time I'm in Vegas.

By8_cOGHZ_pypOuwkV_0Ig.text: If you're looking to get into Omnia to see a DJ/Entertainer, Seasucker does a deal where you get expedited entry into the club. Only catch is that you'll need to spend a minimum of $55/person, but on the plus side you get three bottles of wine. However, that was the deal my party of 9 got.   Ordered the filet mignon which was double seared and on a bed of sauteed kale. It was delicious in my book, the chef did well on making it medium rare for me.   I don't recommend ordering the roasted cauliflower. My friend ordered some to meet our $55 quota, however we barely ate it. The seasonings were off and tasted sour, which could have been the pickled chilis.   If you come here to get a special deal to get into the club, just order a main dish and a couple drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted cauliflower.

aI8kDFgLcRwkskZlhhNxlQ.text: Highly recommend. Everything was top quality. Backed Mac and Cheese was phenomenal. Best old fashioned I have ever had.

bsE8rU1pSVV3BLvvxwGpnQ.text: Great service. Appetizers were the best part of the meal. For what you spend on an entree it was incredibly underwhelming. Solid drinks though

0JCZSZMVQ4QE8wwj1UUZeA.text: Arrived in LV late and wanted to grab a quick bite at the hotel.  Front desk recommended this restaurant.  Waitress seated us quickly,  menu is seafood gastropub.  Everything was very well done and came up quickly.  Had a very enjoyable meal.  Took one star off for price and noise level (it's all hard surface, so hard to hear each other talk).  Would come back next time I'm staying at Caesar's.  There are so many great restaurants in LV, not sure I would seek this place out if we're not already nearby.

jlqgrqrBi7yHz2QSaZ6E7w.text: Great spot for pre or after show or pre club at Caesar's. Trendy vibe social setting with open kitchen.   Appetizers I enjoyed and recommend: -Calamari with apples. Not super deep fried and it was like octopus big.  -The biscuit- holy tamole! Buttery honey warm perfection. Came with 3 and I seriously will not share next time.  -shrimp melon salad. Definition of summer salad. Colorful fresh and tasty.   I tried bone marrow for the first time. Actually enjoyed it. They had fog jam and Brussel sprout chip garnish to compliment. I liked it but still have not a bone marrow convert being a regular order yet. I think if your a fan it's well done here with presentation and taste.  Also has pig ears. Very very tasty. I was thinking chicharron but it was softer easy to chewy, does not look gross, and you can eat it like bacon.   Entrees to recommend: -Ribeye. Already sliced and easy to share. Classic char style. Gotta be okay with the ever so good but bad fatty parts -scallops. On top of my favorite two things, mushroom and corn. Simple preparation but hit the spot  Desserts were more on the comfort side. Cookie was nice and classic. I'm a fruity cream based dessert person so I would say dessert not the strongest points for me here. It's ok though... I would have that biscuit for dessert though.   Yes would go back and already have. Service solid a just a good fun time.

Q67osffxArgOYelYXp7faA.text: My friends and I opted to eat at Searsucker instead of Caesar's Palace's buffet. We had a lovely time at this restaurant. However, by the time we were seated with food in front of us, we could have just waited in the buffet line and gotten our tables at the buffet.   I ordered the Tuna Poke. I liked the tuna poke. The portion was significant enough to be eaten as an entree for a small adult for doesn't eat a lot. I also ordered a lovely rose wine that I thought was fairly priced at $11/glass.   Please note that this location sells itself like an upscale bar. This means that during football season, the games are annoyingly playing in the background. I don't recall noise emitting from the games, but having the games on definitely scaled down the restaurant--especially at the price point.   I would probably not go back but it's not because of the staff's fault or anything. They were fine and the food was good. 4-stars for the confusing combination of sports bar and upscale Vegas dining.

2AvQ0Vk-X4luKrrj4bZGxw.text: Well if this one wasn't a nice surprise!  Hubby and I have passed Searsucker several times on past trips to Vegas, but for whatever reason, never going in.  We reviewed the menu online and OH MY so many good things!  We chose to go with shareables as we were headed to the Absinthe show after dinner and on a bit of a time crunch.  I chose the Tomato Soup with grilled cheese just for me - and it was the most delicious tomato soup of my life!  Super velvety and indulgent.  Loved!  Hubby went for the Crispy Ear which was pig ear served in a little to go box with micro green salad on top.  He enjoyed it, although he was kind of hoping for more of a pork rind than a pig ear.  We split the Toast with Fig and Honey, which was an excellent bite!  You get one thick slice of toast which was the perfect amount to share.  It was sweet but not too sweet.  Simple and delicious!  Then we split the Hummus.  It was served with super soft pita and sprinkled with zatar spice.  Loved it!  This was an absolute gem of a restaurant!  Atmosphere was wonderful, service was excellent, menu was to-die-for.  Hubby and I will definitely go back one day to try more things.

y8w6k07hqRoRz90Xuqu6SQ.text: Happy Hour Daily 5-7pm  Happy Hour Specials are $9 Old Fashioned Cocktails, $5 Beer, $6 Wine, $2-$3 Bar Eats  Happy hour has gone downhill a bit.  Their happy hour menu has shrunk considerably.  No more discounted specialty drinks.  Only cocktails on the menu are 4 old fashioned cocktails.  Food options are oysters, sliders or bone marrow.  It's ok.  I just prefer the old happy hour menu.    Be sure to check out the dessert menu.  There are some great cocktails on there that are not on the regular drink menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0boAt3Fi1DWTGjAUJVXk_w.text: Omg, another 5 star rating restaurant!   First of our reservations were for yesterday, however due to crappy breakfast that just skewed our entire day!   Fast forward to today, I find out,  there is Happy Hour @ Seersucker, only on non game days!  I called to confirm.      So here we were @ Seersucker, we were able to sit @ the bar!  The positive side,  we could people watch, eat off the full menu & the Happy Hour menu!  We ended up ordering  The Bone Marrow, the short rib & one of the limited 20 burgers per day!  The bone marrow was spot on, served with what I think was fried type of lettuce, & bread.   The bone marrow was seasoned just right.   Now on to the delectable burger, which was ordered medium rare.  Unfortunately words can't describe how delightful the taste was.  I'm not much into bacon on burgers,  however the bacon jam was perfected. Gouda cheese was melted just perfectly.   Bread so fresh! The burger was the spouses meal.  The French fries with the burger were seasoned & crispy.  I had the short rib.  The short rib the meat was so tender you did not need the knife.  The mash potatoes was omg so creamy just melted with the meat flavors. The honest truth. I would probably order the burger next time, & skip the rib.    Oh sheesh. Almost forgot.  The happy hour margaritas were absolutely smooth, not too tart or sweet!   We ended ordering 5 margaritas.    So yes, people, this place is a m

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3LF2DQG1n49xNeeicoU5Ew.text: Good dinner overall. I came with a large group of 14 people. We were in town for a conference at Caesars. The restaurant was recommended by friend that used to live in Las Vegas. While the food was good, I was expecting somewhat of a grander experience. The restaurant ambience was low key, which was nice for Vegas. For appetizers we had chicken wings, calamari (my favorite dish of the night), duck fat fries, and buratta. I ordered scallops for my main course.   Overall, decent dinner but slightly let down for my expectations.

CNK1TIvtjOKysNLat7S0ug.text: Ate here with some coworkers at the beginning of a conference last week. It was a bit of a mixed bag.  Service was overall very good.  The drinks were great. Lots of varieties of Old Fashioneds were tasty.   The food was hit or miss.   Things I ate: Pork chop special - perfectly cooked, assertively spiced, good sides. Tomato & Burrata appetizer - good if not special Brussels - delicious Mac & cheese - We got this for the table to share. First of all, this was huge. More importantly, it was SO salty that our table of 6 couldn't actually finish it.  Things I didn't eat, but witnessed eaten all by the same coworker, "F": Caesar salad - My coworker loves caesar salads. Seriously, she's a bit nutty about it. She will eat them multiple times/day. She was so disappointed in their caesar that she sent it back after a few bites.  Oysters - After returning the salad, she ordered 4 oysters, 2 each east and west. I'm not sure what she thought of the flavor, but she was very clear that she was annoyed that they were shucked poorly. Still connected to the shell, and then lots of little shell pieces that she had to pull off her tongue. She was too frustrated at this point to bother sending them back.   Filet - She thought this was so salty that she only ate half of it.  Overall, we had a good experience, but if you asked F, she'd probably rate this place a 1-2 star. Personally I'd be willing to go back, but it wasn't so great that it's going to be high on my list when you consider all the other options.

EbNy4DzPG72LqBSTau6BAg.text: A great dining option in a central location on the strip. Fun atmosphere, a wide variety of options for food and cocktails. If you like old fashions they have many unique takes on the original. Great for large parties as well, as they have many long farm tables! Favorite menu items include the yellowtail, duck fat fries, and filet!

iZNZtLAwZBT6I0U5jTxBvQ.text: Came here with a small group as part of the Absinthe package. For an extra $20 / ticket, we were to get a prix fixe dinner here. Frankly, I didn't expect a whole lot, but was ultimately surprised.  The fixed menu included an appetizer per person, an entree, drink, and a shared dessert. The options were pretty limited, but I really enjoyed what I got - pigs ears (very salty, but surprisingly good), pasta, and the mule for a drink. I decided to also try the bananas foster old fashioned, which was AMAZING. With the drink and some espressos, we still ended up paying $50, but had a good experience overall.  I'd come back again just to try some of the other options, including the steak, which smelled incredible.

QidCi0RDxVxGMSWCxn8ecA.text: Recently ate at Searsucker while on a business trip to Las Vegas. We happened on it after looking for somewhere with an open reservation and seeing it had great reviews we went for it. We were not disappointed!  The restaurant is located inside Caesar's Palace and has a cool ambiance. For starters, we had the burrata with tomato, duck fat fries with prosciutto, bone marrow, calamari, and octopus. It was all amazingly good! The burrata/tomato, duck fat fries, and bone marrow were probably my 3 favs, with the marrow as my number 1. It was actually my first time having bone marrow and it had some type of sweet fig spread or something on the top. It was amazing and my next marrow is going to have to try real hard to live up!  For my main course, I had the Salmon with canneli bean ragu, pancetta, and pesto. The salmon was really good, cooked to a perfect medium. The flavors of the beans, pesto, and pancetta were perfectly complimentary. My colleagues ordered various steaks as well as the Brick Chicken and they all really enjoyed theirs as well. In addition to really good food, they also have a nice drink menu with some seriously delicious cocktail choices!  Don't pass up Searsucker for a truly delicious Las Vegas meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon with canelli bean ragu
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone marrow in front, duck fat fries w/ prosciutto in back
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari in front, burrata and tomato in back

XL9TCZL4aDHItEBhaswLJw.text: Just stopped in here for happy hour yesterday. They have some very good and unique cocktails. We had some of the bone marrow which was delicious! We didn't eat entrees so I can't comment on those but everything looked awesome. I'll definitely be back to try more!

7W8RKHWuiY3cfuew6T4kfw.text: This was a delicious option for our first night in Vegas!  We had around ten people in our group and picking something everyone likes can be a nightmare. However, everyone thought Searsucker would be good and we decided to go.   The menu is fish and steak heavy - neither of which I wanted at the time. I ended up ordering a beer marinated flank steak and it was delectable, The steak had a sweet beer flavor yet was still savory. The table ordered two macaroni and cheese sides and both were enough to feed ten people! The mac and cheese was probably the highlight of the meal for everyone.   Others got steak, burgers, and fish and everyone agreed it was delicious. The ambiance is really good as well. I wish that the suckling pig didn't have to be ordered 48 hours in advance however - all of us wanted to try it.

Jai26swZ1yAi6jfgHBDuDQ.text: So clearly had a poor experience here. To start, my food showed up an hour and a half after I ordered it and I ordered it medium rare, it came out rarer than rare...it was literally cold in the middle. The only redeeming quality of this place was the bartender, she was very accommodating and comped 2 beers.   For those of you like me, traveling for work and looking for a place to get a quick bite, steer clearing this place. Do it for your own good and mine....viva Las Vegas!!

bBhWypUBXKvOoO0CRXBwQw.text: One of, if not the best, burger I have ever eaten. They say they only make 20 each day. Very happy I took advantage.  Great drinks too!

9pngcd1Wyouwmq8vniBPIQ.text: Food was mediocre and overpriced.  Cocktails and service were good.  A lot of empty tables on a Saturday evening

7cQQbN-ILxyvNQNXSB2V_w.text: A disappointment. The food was good, and appropriately priced. Tasty cocktails and a nice wine program.  Why two stars? The service. We had an attentive busboy, but that's not the waiter. The waiter was late to the table, so he got the drinks, apps, and meals all at once. The app never came, nor was there water. He offered dessert, but how am I going to want that when there's a late Vegas bight ahead of me?

HsLeo-yhzNeBCbp7SaUjsw.text: I tried Searsucker with a group for a friend's birthday.... This was a great experience cause we got to try a variety of items! For my cocktail I chose the Jalaberry Strawpeno - which is a strawberry jalapeno tequila + lime + agave. This was a great mix of spicy and sweet! For appetizers we shared the cheddar puffers, mussels + chorizo + beer, brie "triple" + cranberry jam, "cowboy caviar" and the shrimp "spicy" + bacon grits.  I have to say that my favorites were the mussels and the shrimp with the grits! YUMM! For my entree I chose the scallops "east coast" israeli couscous + almonds + citrus vinaigrette- this was fabulous! We then shared a variety of desserts- I have to say my favorite was the warm cookies with milk.  I absolutely enjoyed the entire experience at Searsucker! Will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Butter potatoes
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallops &#34;east coast&#34;
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp spicy + bacon grits

g_uwLA4kYtAQ-tYI4y8_vg.text: Came here and sat at bar.  Started with happy hour oysters which were good.  I then ordered the prime NY strip from the menu for around $54.  I was expecting it to be around 14 ounces.  What I got was around 6 ounces of meat, about 2 ounces of which was all fat.  I told the bartender who brought it to the chefs  attention that it seemed real small.  He offered to take it back to the kitchen to ask the chef.  He then came back and told me it was correct and the steaks were partitioned properly.  I'm not sure what that meant.  I ended up eating the steak.  The meat was seasoned properly but it was definitely tougher than what you would get at a high end steakhouse that serves prime steaks.  I also asked for a side of chimichuri sauce with my steak.  That actually ended up being very good.  I also got a side of the Brussels sprouts.  Those were very tart.  As for the service, it was very good.  Unfortunately I felt very dissatisfied after.  I would not recommend going to this restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New York strip is 6 oz at best.  2 oz of which was fat.  This plate is a little bigger than a tea cup saucer.

Fy2w8RGQ8AcvkVm2UcGFwQ.text: I can't say much about the food because we didn't get to have any. Despite making a reservation for 11:30 a.m. brunch on Sunday, and the restaurant itself listing their opening time as 11:00 a.m., Searsucker was not open when we got there. I called the main line and no one answered, then I called again later, and they left me on hold for an unacceptable period of time. Unfortunately for them, they lost my business that day, and my future patronage as well.

76M2c93ytg1jTl7ay2i6ag.text: Hungry on the Strip?...If you're at Caesars, stop here for a quick bite during HH.   Pros 1) We were able to get a seat in the bar area no problem during happy hour 2) Decor and ambiance were nice.  Bathrooms were clean 3) Our server was very prompt and friendly 4) Happy hour menu was decent... $9 bites from 5-7 daily.  $5 beers and $6 wines 5) Food was delicious! We had a few items from the happy hour menu and they arrived promptly and hot! Great quality and fresh!  Cons 1) Sliders only came with 2...They were too good to only get 2!

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tasty Tacos with a delicious side of Guac!
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Only 2? So good, I wish they gave at least 1 more!
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious fries!!

E-mdHxSb-v-ApenpOKXhOw.text: We came here, honestly, because we were here for a show and couldn't get in anywhere else. We were pleasantly surprised. The food is really good. We had the flatiron steak and the snapper, both of which were solid. The Caesar salad was big enough to share, and then some. But oh holy crap, the duck fat fries are off the chain. We couldn't find a single thing to complain about.

reJetEkmPNjVnYKQwKKu7Q.text: Ok, here is my update for a recent visit. They have changed chefs from our Meet up, and have also adjusted the menu, taking away my favorite Pork Belly Benedict which I send people here to try. Also gone, my Ballerina and the Czar cocktail. This makes me sad. :(  I had the eggs and bacon, and also the grilled cheese and tomato basil soup. The eggs and bacon was disappointing, the pork belly here was so dry and crunchy that it was almost inedible. The grilled cheese and tomato basil was pretty good.   This is one of my pet peeves with restaurants, and that's taking good items off the menu. I'm sure there are numbers that say this wasn't selling or whatever. Looking over this menu, I really didn't see much that I enjoyed from our Yelp event left. I was definitely disappointed with the selections.   Alas, I won't be back nor recommending it again. I'm sure people will still enjoy what they have to offer, and they have a great location. Time to find a new Strip restaurant to enjoy and take guests from out of town to.

9QU59wIOrEGUyJEVkDB2cg.text: In town for combined business and pleasure, I went solo to Searsucker for my last dinner before heading home.  I ordered a glass of Malbec and the flat iron steak and potatoes.  All I can say is -- wow! The marinated beef was so flavorful and absolutely delicious. The potatoes were seasoned with garlic, parmesan cheese, onions and jalapenos -- sounds odd but it totally works. This was by far the best meal I've had in the few days I've been here, and I've done a good job of sampling some of the nicer restaurants. Will definitely come back the next time I'm in Vegas.

yYAgwsKsKM1_GWh5608zmQ.text: I LOVE IT HERE! Spectacular service and food from the appetizer to the dessert! I had (shared) the calamari, bone marrow, short ribs, scallops, brussel sprouts, cookies and milk, ice cream sandwiches, and the other one with the marshmallow on top (oh I sound like a pig!). HIGHLY RECOMMEND! Worth the price! Will definitely come back again when visiting

3HOXWIoWv409g2yiDn-Djw.text: As foodies, we like to find interesting and new places to visit. After having been to Vegas a few times and exploring all types of restaurants, we came across Searsucker.  This was our favourite meal we've had in Vegas. The food was out of this world and definitely memorable.  Trust me when I say this... GO EAT HERE!!!
