Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uivPJhD3MkgLdvDDvPm8yQ.text: Friendly staff. But the food is not unlike TGI Fridays or Chili's. And even that wouldn't be a big deal but the kitchen couldn't manage to get food out at the same time. Not sure what the problem is but when you order appetizers and lunch and the order of delivery is: Lunch 1, then Lunch 2 five minutes later, and THEN the appetizer, something is going wrong. Not impressed.

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States

baAAQq_BDfR0TQ-28I5Avw.text: Probably my 10th time eating dining here......Service can be on the slower side, but the food is always consistent.  The tomato soup and grilled cheese is my absolute favorite and now they are doing it table side. It's a big enough meal to not need anything else!! Tonight we tried their newest "melon tomato shrimp" salad. Amazing! Yellow watermelon, yellow and red heirloom tomatoes (a little skimpy on the shrimp-only 3 and for 24$), but a total must try!  They also offer an expedited Omnia nightclub entry when you spend 50$ on dinner which is pretty enticing if your looking to head there.

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp, melon and tomato salad. Must try!!!

FeWwdbimJvvhE01LkMRNHA.text: Adventurous comfort food.  Is that an oxymoron?  Well, go to Searsucker and decide for yourself.  My advice, though, would be to take a good look at the menu first.  You will either spot some unusual dishes that you are dying to try, or (like me) you will decide this just doesn't look like my cup of tea.  I went here only because I was with a group that was staying at Caesar's and chose this restaurant.  I was looking for something less adventurous than the crispy pig's ears and such.  I might have ordered a burger, but the menu trumpets that they only make 20 of them per night.  How pretentious!  You might get one, or not.  I prefer to do my gambling in the casino, so I ordered tomato soup, a Cobb salad, and also split a mac & cheese and an order of cornbread with my wife.  The soup was okay; nothing special.  The Cobb salad wasn't.  I mean it wasn't a Cobb salad.  Greens and bacon mostly, with a vinaigrette dressing - closer to a Spinach salad.  The mac & cheese was very rich and quite good; I guess it's hard to mess up that dish unless you load it up with truffles, which (thank God) they didn't.  The cornbread really should have been the complementary bread plate, but if they insist on charging five bucks for it - well, that's how it goes.  My wife did like her brick chicken.  Seersucker tries to brand itself as a comfortable party place.  I didn't see it that way.  It had a weird ambiance, with giant fish skeletons and pictures of roosters on the walls.  The bar area was not comfortable, and the bar service was slow.  I'm not going to comment on the dining room service because, as I said, we were with a group and it is entirely possible that someone in the group was slowing things down with a lot of questions and dithering.  However, the place did seem to be understaffed.  Well, at least the prices were reasonable (by Caesar's Palace standards).

RwEnp5WiQNX74fEE-EtDLA.text: Amazing in every way. We came around 5:15pm and walked into their Happy Hour (5-7p) and fell in love with the place. We ordered the shishito peppers, Bone Marrow, Tomahawk Steak with roasted mushrooms with herbs and the Walnut Brussel Sprouts. Definitely sit at the bar, it starts to get busy around 6p. Amazing food, awesome drinks and SPECTACULAR SERVICE!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone Marrow was AMAZING!!!!
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8ZQj69vvnxS_AqOjuvi6yg.text: The food was good, my party of 4 had 3 really good dishes. My dish, a chicken with a poached egg was okay.  It was missing something like a thicker sauce ( perhaps a simple wine, cream and morel sauce). However; my hubby's Mahi Mani was Delish! Right amount of sauce, some type of fruit or currant(I don't recall) but great! The Pork Butt, OMG,so good and cooked perfectly. It was a whole meal, there were a few pieces of greens on the plate. My daughter, a 14 year old princess had the $40.00 filet, and she would not give me any! She is a steak conisure and she orders medium and she said it was cooked perfectly. I think she has a picture I will upload. The only downside,it was a lacarte, we didn't eat the sides much, the water at $9, was overpriced so we spent way too much. I think the prices are a little steep but if you hVe the money...go and enjoy!  I almost forgot...the service is great! The Server was really knowledgeble and they are quick to refill and take dirty plates away. Service was top notch!

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet Mignon

NDn7w_p7s0waLQW4AKAcbg.text: Service was poor. Waited 15 minutes before a server greeted us after sitting down. We had the thanksgiving dinner. Food was not good. We were told we'd have more than enough time to order more if necessary but the kitchen closed and we were denied multiple items after being told the order was okay to add.

o5CmA7b3_shr7c0Aw6wTaQ.text: My wife and I had no trouble making a reservation here the day before. When we showed up, the hostesses were polite, but not as welcoming as I would have expected. We were seated promptly.  The menu was very inviting and our server (who did not share her name with us) was very pleasant. She was very good throughout the meal - attentive, but not obtrusive, talkative, but not overly chatty. If I were offering a rating based solely on her service, it would have received a six.  We ordered drinks to start. I got the fizzy lifter and my wife got the blackberry smash. Both were very, very good with plenty of alcohol. In fact, we later ordered a couple more. The server readily provided us with a detailed description of how to make the fizzy lifter when we requested.  Our first appetizer was an order of shisheido peppers. Cooked perfectly, but a little salty. The ponzu sauce was a fantastic addition (its flavor made the small chunks of salt sprinkled on top unnecessary, in my opinion).  Our second appetizer was the short rib. Succulent and cooked perfectly, it was served on a bed of mashed potatoes with a wonderful gravy. This was the best part of our meal.  We split the hanger steak for a main course (we planned in advance for dessert). It was delicious! It was served on small potatoes and mushrooms with an appropriately sized drizzle of a chimichurri sauce that was (1) very good (me), or (2) ok (my wife). Overall, a fine selection to split.  We ordered the ice cream sandwich and the ice cream selection for dessert. While the ice creams were delicious (chocolate, salted caramel and cappuccino), the ice cream sandwich was the star. This is a must if you are a dessert person. Served on caramel and accompanied by a large dollop of fresh whipped cream, I was left attempting to lick the plate.  The decor was tasteful, but it was a little loud, being next to the casino. Overall, a very good place to pop in for a dinner.  We did not experience many of the negative things mentioned by other reviewers. If you go the Searsucker, I hope your experience equals ours.

Lm24K5rU-gFvYyGcImUoWQ.text: Wasn't horribly impressed. The menu is not cohesive enough to give the kitchen any rythym to service, hence, there are huge swings in quality of the food. The duck fat fries were so ovely seasoned it was obscuring the pancetta and the unctuousness of the duck fat. The chicken was under seasoned and dry, traded that out for a mid rare filet that was totally bloody... but we ate it anyway since the demi glace was plentiful and delicious. It was very loud too, too much of everything to be wonderful at anything. You blew it on this one Brian! Chef Jill

15bF99XbcMh32dmPWXrxVg.text: Great location inside of Cesars Casino.  Great views out it's corner inside windows of the action.  The only place that has a Sunday happy hour at the Casino.  The happy hour is actually decent deals for a couple of great items from the menu.  Chicken Slider with crispy chicken topped coleslaw and blue cheese crumbs compliments each other well.    The speciality $9 drinks are heavy on the liquor but high on taste.  The vibe is low key with great tv screens at the bar.    Check them out

xAM29IK29tBhHxJ8LpDsxw.text: We'd been the Searsucker in San Diego a few times and were in Las Vegas for a show so we decided to grab a quick bite and a drink before the show.   Searsucker in Las Vegas did not disappoint.   We had the shortribs and couple other small plates.    They were very good.   The drinks were good.   The Golden Knights drink was the star of the evening.    This is a good place to have a nice bite and drink in Caesars.    Good job folks.  Will we be back?  Sure when we're in the hotel again.

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Old fashions.   Yum!

CVVZm2FixhSlUNuRxOi_XQ.text: We came for Restaurant Week on Friday for the last day and have nothing but great things to say. The hostesses were quick to get us seated near the open kitchen where we could easily watch the plates coming out. Tyler was our server who was attentive, knowledgeable, and perfect on timing our different courses. Bussers were on top of clearing our plates and resetting us with new silverware, and our glasses were always full.   The dishes themselves were amazing. We started with the tostada ceviche and bone marrow: both delightful. I am normally not an octopus fan, but it was diced small enough and meshed very well with the fresh ingredients. Next we had the field greens salad and tomato soup. The field greens was a little too sweet for me, but I also took out the goat cheese which would've helped to cut the sweetness. My boyfriend said that he had never had a tomato soup better! Props to the kitchen. Lastly, we had the flat iron, cooked to perfection with the chimichurri, and the scallops.   We ended with the cookies and milk and cheesecake. Both delicious and rich in flavor! My only gripe was that there was no milk alternative since I am sensitive to dairy, but I sucked it up and dipped my cookies in the milk anyways because they were so good! Thank you Searsucker team for a great meal, awesome presentation of dishes, and great service.

q9lGs0a-JylEAnRNiNdGeg.text: We came here during our stay in Vegas. The best things we had here was their duck fat fries and my short rib dish.

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short Rib

h1dmkCjEQxdL4Q9EsWBs3w.text: A group of friends & I visited for dinner on a Saturday night.   A few things we've ordered: Jalaberry strawpedo- very interesting drink & pretty good!  Crusted Ahi Tuna (5/5)- It came with a few thick slices, paired with a very delicious sauce and some greens.  Oysters (2/5)- I'm an oyster lover so of course I had to try it. I wasn't a fan of how it was prepared. I think because I'm more of a ponzu with my oyster type of person.  Bone marrow (3/5) - I love bone marrow but I didn't like the jelly and bone marrow combination.  Main entrees: *Prime New York (5/5) - very tender and juicy cut with a very delicious truffle butter!!! Yumm  *Scallops (3/5) - it was cooked perfectly but nothing super special about it *Cowboy ribeye (1/5) - very nice cut of steak but LACKED A LOT OF FLAVOR!! Wasn't worth $100 if you asked me.   My overall experience was ok. Our server was really great at first, he would check in to see how we're doing, etc. but when we got our appetizers he was no where to be found. It was hard just to get another drink refilled. I'm kinda upset bc I really enjoyed this place when I first sat down but left unhappy due to the lack of customer service from our server. I'm happy I got to try this place once but I won't be coming back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime New York with truffle butter
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallops

DealZJ_szMU01aebx_03dg.text: I had dinner at Searsucker in a group of 8. They were good at accommodating the size of our big group.   The menu was pretty easy to navigate. A few people at our table gravitated toward the burger ($24 - Vegas prices). (The menu claims that only 20 are made each day.) It was a very good burger, and it's one of the cheaper items on the menu. So if you're looking for red meat, you're golden.  I had to dock a star because it was incredibly complicated to get our bills split. I appreciate that keeping track of 8 bills can be challenging, but our waiter kept coming back to the table multiple times with only some people's checks and then having to go back and correct more mistakes. I certainly want to get the appropriate bill, but make sure you can correct your problems before bringing all the checks to the table.   Definitely on the loud side. Great people watching.

C2pD41EGTDAaV2AepUmHzQ.text: We had fun here! Good for groups. We did a team dinner there before our company party. Yummy cocktails. One of those places you have to get the apps cause your meal might not be too filling, but I think that's always the case when you order scallops. The sides were all delicious. We tried the oysters, chicken sliders, fries, brussel sprouts, calamari, burrata, all very good. Service was great. We asked the waiter to get is a good easy group shot and he picked a good one. Decor is cute inside. It was a fun time there. I like that it's not that far of a walk from the forum shops drop off area. Our party was at Drais, so was a nice quick walk afterwards.

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallops
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burrata
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters

ubQb5jCgII6wSoVYb4e0pA.text: Quietly surpassing four years serving Las Vegas in March, a 2018 transfer from Brian Malarkey to Hakkasan Group leaving the space mostly unchanged save for some menu adjustments, it was Sunday evening that Searsucker was found busy mere moments after opening.   Themed as a place to "Come Early, Stay Late," its location inside Caesars' Palace just steps from Omnia originally intended to catch club-goers both coming and going, modern times instead have seen the Restaurant serving "New American Classics" take a more serious turn, the Drinks less frou-frou and Food more focused on Meats, Sides and Salads.  Popular for both Sports fans and guests pre-revelry, a plethora of televisions on this night showing NBA Playoff action in an environment far more welcoming than Caesars' Sports Book, it was after greetings at the hostess stand that two diners were led to a table near the kitchen, service proving competent yet rushed over the course of two hours.  Still bearing all the original design elements, even a hallway of relics selected by Malarkey en route to the restroom identical from a visit one month after opening, it was on-request that the 5:00p-7:00p menu typically offered at Searsucker's Bar was presented, Dinner starting off with Pig Skins only available during Happy Hour at approximately $1 each with a thick yet crispy consistency and bold spicing with or without Chef's Vinegar.  Moving next to a pair of Buffalo Chicken Sliders offered at $4 a piece, these too only available early at a counter which was already two-deep, both spicy Sandwiches were fine but largely inconsequential in comparison to housemade Pickles or bargain-priced Bone Marrow with accompanying Toast for spreading  and dazzling Chili Glaze.  Unapologetically targeting a wide audience, Raw Plates including $4 Oysters (that are half-off early) passed over in favor of fragrant housemade Hummus, suffice it to say that Searsucker continues to impress with off-cuts in the form of sliced Pig's Ears tinged in Citrus while the limited-edition Burger is worth every penny of its $24 tab thanks to a rich grind topped with plenty of smoked Cheese, mashed Avocado and Bacon Jam.  Equally happy with hand-cut Potatoes double-fried in Duck Fat, the housemade Bun also not lacking in effort or excellence, those seeking something sharable will be happy to know that in addition to Steaks ranging 8oz to two-pounds there is Lobster, Chicken and hand-made Strozzapreti served beneath a generous amount of Wild Boar Ragu.  Scaling back Sweets from day one, only four choices including Ice Cream and Cheesecake currently offered, it is fortunate that what is served ranks amongst the best city-wide in its genre - Bread Pudding made from Croissants steamy and rich beneath Burning Marshmallows while four Chocolate Chip Cookies served warm are bound to make a mess that most will be happy to lick off their fingers.

uI2D9d6W91m6k0YPjKTTpQ.text: Happy Hour 5-7pm daily, service was great but HH food was just OK  Oyster $2 - very tasty, they put pomegranate on top for some color and a citrus touch (no need to squeeze the lemon) Crispy Chicken Sliders $4 - just OK, buffalo sauce was overwhelming.  Beef Bone Marrow with bread $3 - just OK, too oily for my liking Pig Skin - did not like it at all, nothing like the Chinese roast pork skin I was thinking about, but more like Mexican chips

As great as the lobster, steak, and mashed potatoes were, the defining part of our meal was our drinks. I had one of each variation of the Old-Fashioned cocktail that they had to offer. My goodness. Every single one was incredible. But the banana foster old fashioned topped them all!!! Must try!

I tried the oysters apple mignonette and sliders. My bartender pretty much forgot about me but was servicing others very well. Great cozy restaurant.

iXn4PAWrUriZrFXuOnRQQg.text: Good quality meal we got the habanero pickles free for checking in with yelp YES!! We had the calamari it was "steak" style so thick strips not typical to what we have seen. It was good very meaty and not rubbery at like some calamari. Had good flavor we enjoyed it just a little different. Wife had the filet which she though was cooked well and tasted good. I had the drunken flat iron. It had more of a sweet flavor which I am not a fan of but it wasn't overpowering to where I couldn't eat it. It. came with fingerling potato's. Overall a solid meal we would try this place again if in this hotel. We came for a concert. The people beside us got the lobster and it looked amazing we would probably do that's if we come again !

qEmmyX1bm1A_VFlBtw9pjA.text: I really debated between giving this place 3 stars or 4 stars, but landed on 4 stars because of my friends dish that I tried so... there's hope yet!  I went here with a couple of coworkers while we attended CES and we ordered a side of Parmesan fries, calamari, and then our mains (I got the strip steak). The fries were decent - a good taste to them, albeit the seasoning was a bit heavy. The calamari.. was a bit letdown. Image the taste of calamari if it was done sweet and sour style at Panda Express. The calamari was cut into... think potatoes wedge style, and covered in sweet and sour spicy sauce. Literally if I closed my eyes I would've imagined sweet and sour from Panda... although it wasn't deep fried. A bit of a letdown when you think of calamari.  The main dish, the skirt steak was fine, but nothing to write home about. Plate had a fair bit of excess oil dripping around.  However! And this is the saving grace. They have a burger on their menu that my coworker tried that was excellent. They only make 20 of these per day (per meal?) and it was excellent. Smoked Gouda cheese, grilled onions, and a patty that they make in-house. Springy buns and all - the bite I tried was delicious and made me pretty envious of my coworker who got it :) so, I'll give this place a second chance - I'm sure the menu has some other gems like that!

MCWDIvFY8Qjk_CdZIFDWQg.text: Great service, friendly folks behind the bar, wonderful presentation of the food. Enjoyed  the charred octopus and bone marrow.  Had the bone marrow on first meal, went back a couple of days later for the octopus and more bone marrow. Bone marrow is a special during social hour. Came with onion, green, bread , and a wonderful glaze. Would have preferred my octopus salad to have had more octopus (of course). The special Manhattan was very good.

xQUBVtSh5NYnl364hM7GCw.text: We came here for happy hour because my husband had been wanting to for a while. The good news is that happy hour is 5-7 every day, the bad news is it's a very limited menu, especially if you don't drink.  There are only 3 options for happy hour entrees - oysters, sliders, and bone marrow. We didn't get the sliders since they seemed pretty standard. My husband really enjoyed the oysters, but I was disappointed since they were raw (yuck!). If you're a raw oyster fan you will probably enjoy these but if not, nothing to see here.   The bone marrow was not bad at all. Hard to find bone marrow and it's a really good price! Plus it comes with bread. I thought this was a hearty appetizer indeed.  We also purchased a charred octopus from the regular menu. It said sharable but it was really REALLY small. And I felt like the "charred" part overtook the flavor. Honestly I enjoyed the happy hour octopus from Pink Taco (in Hard Rock) a lot more and that was half the price. This one was $17.  So why 3 stars? Simply put, this happy hour is kinda lame. I feel like they could throw a few more unique apps on here and round it out. Apparently at one point there was more stuff but they cut back, which is unfortunate. The bone marrow was pretty neat but it isn't worth going out of your way to the restaurant for. I wish they had a charbroiled oyster option too.   Also be warned you can NOT use your Caesars food credit here. You also can't get points on your TR card or use points. But you can charge to the room, which is kinda misleading.

Goae8rWi7zRz_fLSIM9ueA.text: A group of friends and I spent the day watching NCAA Basketball Tournament games at Searsucker at Caesars Palace.  Searsucker is a fun spot to watch sports because it features multiple televisions, is close to the sports book, and has a great menu.    The drink menu includes two gems.  The PB&J old fashion comes with a small PB&J sandwich and has peanuts infused into the drink, which provides a nice sweet flavor.  The Golden Knights old fashion includes chocolate and Smoke Wagon bourbon, a local product.    From the food menu, I enjoyed the seared albacore sandwich, the ears, and the charred octopus.  The albacore sandwich was perfectly seared on the outside and raw on the inside, with a complementary mayo and bun.  The ears are lightly fried, yet slightly chewy.  The charred octopus was smokey and tender.  The price is about average for a casino restaurant ($13 for drinks, $15 for lunch entrees, and $25 for dinner entrees).  The restaurant was crowded, but not too noisy.  We were able to hear the game and maintain conversation at our table.  The manager, Nick, is extremely personable and welcoming.  He constantly checked on every table, while simultaneously managing the bar.  Our server, Chris, was attentive throughout the day and impressively accommodating to our increasing party.    ALL STAR PEOPLE: Nick and Chris.

esLWjBLYk2hDiJGljENgBg.text: One of the best American Classic restaurant I have been to in while! The food was far from basic, they were all delicious and presented well. The service was great, they attended to us to make sure our food was good and if we needed more water.   My favorite entrees that we ordered are the Short Ribs, the Scallops, and the Calamari Steak. I highly recommend these three items when you visit Searsucker! The short rib with the mashed potatoes melts in your mouth, the short rib is so tender! The Scallops was buttery and was cooked perfectly! The calamari steaks are like no other calamari that you will ever have in your life! Must-Try!  Another great thing about this place is it's so conveniently located next to OMNIA Nightclub! Definitely a great diner spot before entering OMNIA to party! They even sometimes have promotions where if you can get expedited entry to OMNIA after dinner!  Searsucker is located inside Caesars Palace! TRY IT OUT!

CJbFjsVtWc1Gclflyz-ZXA.text: Came here with the Fiance for Happy Hour and had a great experience. We were walking around and wanted a snack and drink. The location is great because it is at the entrance of the casino.  We started with a drink and the chicharron that was on the Happy Hour menu. This is the best thing we ordered and couldn't of probably had 2 orders because it was that good. The sauce is really what makes this snack. The vinegar and chilli sauce was spectacular. It had a nice spicy kick to it. Our drinks included a beer and the PB&J old fashioned which was delicious. We then ordered the ceasar salad which was loaded with shredded fresh Parmesan. The overall service was also great and we will definitely come back.

KBYIJVf9-fBCzB2Xo_p0iQ.text: I recently moved to Vegas this year so I blindly started to find my way around this 24 hour city.. it being the Mecca of gourmet restaurants, I've been excited to explore the culinary side of the strip. I play poker at various casinos but Caesars has been my recurring spot lately. I found Searsucker a few weeks ago and being new to yelp, I realized I could express my experience publicly as the appreciation is properly due. This causal fine dining restaurant falls nothing short to to expectation. They combine a sports like atmosphere with the TV's at the bar and an almost California rustic lay out. The pretty blonde bartender was the most funny, entertaining person. I made a few friends at the bar because she interacted with all of us together, it's actually a pretty amazing talent to give multiple people so much comfortability and attention that it breaks down that awkward barrier everyone has these days, especially with technology in the way. Bars are meant for that. To pull someone away from their phone and space bubble is hard to do. She honestly illuminates that bar with her personality and it shows. All the bartenders helped guide me through the menu and I ended up devouring the recommendations. I like the simple fact that their menu has causal bar food as well as upscale selections with a twist. The frenched lollipop wings, bone marrow and brussels sprouts were outstanding. I wish I could have ordered the calamari and shishito peppers but I will have to wait until next time. Overall the dishes and service were memorable. The way Vegas should be.

zVNlmcikN5sE72MIa_u6Fg.text: Sorry but, I will never eat there again! Not that the food was terrible, but just over priced. Service was lacking and the food was weak. Everything was spicy, which was ok for me but not my mother. She could not even get mustard for her 26$ hamburger, and there is something wrong with that.

StH1ipGzqy6glhL9kbp-hA.text: Awesome ambiance! Took them a minute to find our reservation and get the table ready, but not a big deal. Our group of 5 shared several small plates.  Our group's favorite: Bussel sprouts Short rib Squid Mushroom burrata french toast Shrimp ceviche (so good and very different!) Duck fat fries  Skip: Mussels  Dessert: Ermagahd is delicious Smores is ok  Great waiter and very very attentive service. Would definitely recommend to a friend!

napnlmIU6_t3_2-naeB1fg.text: What a great joint!  Awesome service too.  Seems like the menu has changed.  This is what was there tonight.  Starters: Potato Fries - unreal.  Crunchy and delicious.   Lollipop wings very tasty.  There was a crab and avocado dip with crusted covered chips - unreal.  Few beers on tap.  Good selection.  Specialty cocktails we had: Achilles Peel and the Indian Summer - both delish, but I thought Achilles was stronger!!  (and no complaint on that) ;) ;)  Dinner: The fish & chips is the BEST I've ever had.  Hands down. One diner had the steak and spinach.  Steak was a bit over done but still good and great spinach.  Another diner had the swordfish - was awesome.  Very disappointed on the dessert.  The profiteroles were three teeny tiny puffs and a tablespoon of peanut butter ice cream and gelee squares on the plate.  True profiteroles are BIG puffs with ice cream in the middle.  I get you need to make your artistic mark on your food - but not dessert, people!  Make 'em normal.  Still a great night.  Would recommend and would return.

NJkgldUZnVew_Wm6x672wA.text: Got to preview the menu. Most of everything I tried was incredible. Some things fantastic. Some of the food is indeed standouts. The bone marrow, shrimp and grits, and pork belly are standouts. Duck fat fries, steak entrees and strawberry salad are great. Pumpkin toffee cake was a great way to finish. The atmosphere and people watching is fantastic, definitely a great place to socialize and location is perfect.

LQI2nniU4_ZRF2sz2f1PUg.text: The crab and avocado spread was delicious; skilled bartenders; I personally didn't enjoy the grass-fed strip steak because it was tough on the outside

ARiAXtJfii2WRbSA9dvLvg.text: Our server was so exceptional. Dez, my wife was not feeling well when we arrived and by the time we left Dez had cheered her up and pampered her so much she was in much better spirits. We will defiantly be back, the food was great as well.

0ULLqCWoN-yw1sJC23xskA.text: Try the Ballerina cocktail! Refreshing and delicious! Went in for a few drinks with friends and we were very impressed with the food and customer service!

KbQFuCqdgHPpUdfdD09YVw.text: Oh my goodness. It isn't often that I feel compelled to write a 5-star review, but this place demands it. Hubby and I had the most wonderful meal here. First of all our server, Charles, was hilarious and engaging. This place labels itself as "a social dining experience" (hey, it's on the receipt like that) and I think they mean because from the moment you walk in, they try to get to know you. The hostess asked us a few questions, and clearly passed that onto our server before he came over to our table, because he was prepped with the info. He started off with a little joke of singing something, which my husband and I quickly joined in on, so we immediately started off on the right foot. Dinner consisted of all small plates. We got the duck fat fries, mushroom burrata toast, egg & pork belly, and short ribs. The fries are tied for first place as the best fries I've ever had. They were perfectly light and crispy, without being dry. The mushroom & burrata toast was incredible with such flavorful, rich mushrooms. The pork belly is essentially grown up eggs Benedict on broiche toast with Hollandaise. It was good, but sadly not warm when we finally got around to eating it (we ordered too much food!) and the short rib, while tender, was not terribly exciting in the flavor department (think pot roast) but still well cooked and falling-apart tender. After seeing a bunch of desserts pass by the table, hubby and I had some room left in our tummies from just sticking to small plates, so we ordered three, yes three, desserts. The desserts are awesome here. The apple crostata was a lovely rustic pie crust purse filled with caramelized apples. After the warm apples, we went the other direction and got something cold with the Ermagerd Sundae. The peanut butter gelato in this sundae is heavenly. It had such rich peanut butter flavor without being too heavy or losing it's creaminess. We had them bring one dessert at a time so we could digest enough to press on. After all this, we still had another dessert on the way. The finale was the S'more bar. The honey flavor in the graham cracker crust was very robust and I had tasted that wonderful honey in a couple of other dishes. I would love to know what kind of honey they use, it's a good one. The chocolate on top of the crust is a very heavy bodied, rich chocolate mousse, topped with whipped marshmallow topping that is torched. It was all delicious. Our server was great throughout the whole meal and we enjoyed him a lot. The meal was excellent all around and I will definitely come back here each time I go to Vegas. Do not miss the desserts here.

Ow9PCwy4wTeEkR9lgvbJ7w.text: Cocktails and food were delicious, great atmosphere.  I would give it a 5 but my steak came out well done instead of medium rare the first time but they corrected it with grace.  Definitely will come back.

PTXM4urWHwRNf4GG0sOBcw.text: Went with a large party and had the chance to try tons of small plates. The pork belly appetizer is a stand-out item. We also had the shrimp and grits (good), squid (ok), tuna himachi (heard it was good, don't like sushi), and crab cake (very good). I got the scallops with cous cous. The scallops were perfectly cooked and a decent size. Tried the corn off the cob which was good not awesome, but good. I was stuffed by the end of the meal. Perrier Jouet sold by the glass made this place even better!

cH7H1hu3Ou8zmf_4BZDL7A.text: We decided to try out this place. Overall it is a good place to enjoy a decent meal. Nothing spectacular but defiantly worth mention as they did have some uniqueness  and the atmosphere was good. None of the dishes we had were out of this world, but they were good and worth bringing people for a quick bite to eat either before hitting the town or a late night snack as they are open late!  We tried the squid which was a in a sweat and sour sauce very good and full of flavor. Next the short rib was ok. It lacked a little flavor.  We moved on to the shrimp and grits. I think I had high expectations for that dish and it just was lacking a little bit of spice to make that hold statement. The tartar I could have done without, but the pork with the egg was defiantly unique and I think a must!  For dessert you can't go wrong with sunday. They kept on mentioning the cookies with Milk  so we had them and let me just say stick to the sunday!

qNkvCbbSii62Lpr9gLNZzA.text: If I could give zero stars I would. We made reservations weeks in advance for dinner for a bachelor/bachelorette party for 12 people. Any smart restaurant manager would have that ready and waiting because it is an easy $1000 tab. We got there and waited for 25 minutes and the little snot hostess told us they are cleaning the table for 25 minutes. I asked what is going on that we had a reservation and they are not honoring it, she replied with extreme attitude. I have been several times to the Searsucker in San Diego and loved it so we were excited to celebrate and dine here with our friends. I will never return to eat at this location, as a restaurant manager myself I have never come across such an unprofessional establishment. Shame on you Las Vegas Searsucker.

VXygL_N0pOtZ7RyM80gxWg.text: My boss recommended this place to me because he had heard great reviews from the one in SD. Decided to have my birthday dinner here and overall the food was remarkable. The mussels with chorizo were amazing, the chorizo bits were so tasty gave the whole dish an amazing taste. The squid sweet heat was probably the best squid I have had and this tends to be a dish I order at every restaurant and is by far the best tasting here at Searsucker. All of the appetizers came in large sizes. We also got the duck fat fries with chipotle ketchup towards the end, and OMG, loved them! I'm not a duck fan but you really couldn't taste duck. I got the mahi baja dish the meat was so tender and those almonds and drunken cherries just blended in very well in every bite. My boyfriend got the hanger butcher steak and he thought it was okay. The only disappointing thing and the reason why I didn't give five stars is because the entree is literally just the piece of meat, the dishes don't come with anything else like a side. Good thing we had ordered the duck fat fries along with the entrees. Their cocktail ballerina and the czar was good. To end the dinner our awesome waitress recommended the s'mores bar for dessert, so glad she did! Not one crumb was left of that. Oh, not to mention the service was great our waiter was so friendly and kept checking up on us to make sure our experience was going great, she even started a conversation with us and mentioned how she loved locals coming into Searsucker.

78SWHeZO2AKr7YpFfGxTGw.text: I've been to the Searsucker in San Diego which is amazing so I had high expectations.  Overall, the Vegas Searsucker was only ok.  I think they are still trying to work out their preparation since it's new.  We started with a Ballerina and the Czar cocktail which was amazing.  We had the farm bird lollipops and they were very flavorful.  The shrimp and bacon grits dish was over sauced and the hot sauce flavor was so strong you couldn't taste the bacon.  The mahi mahi was overcooked and had the consistency of chicken.  The short ribs were excellent as was the strawberry and champagne vinegrette salad.  The warm chocolate chip cookies were absolutely to die for.  They bring a cup of cold milk for dipping.

PBgxBcFsZ_v-FkicdiAang.text: Went here without know what to expect, ended up with a new favorite spot.  I was a bit hesitant to go here, because Old Homestead is my absolute favorite restaurant and its literally around the corner from Searsucker.  I decided to change things up a bit and try this brand new spot at Caesars.  Started off with the eggs + bacon "pork belly"and it was outstanding, I highly suggest it, as it's quite a difference from your normal appetizer. Me and my mother split the tomahawk with a side of bacon grits, and I have to say this steak was unbelievable.  Was it as good as Homestead's ribeye?  Obviously this stuff is subjective, and I'm biased towards them,  but I'll definitely say it's up there, and a bit better than STK's ribeye.  Honestly one of the top 10 meals I've ever had, and we didn't even do dessert.

YKwty6ewNOHJ7zEXioMYPQ.text: Favorite place inside Caesars! Get the filet, best thing on the menu next to the fish & chips.

aVms3rXt1rmplOp5EylWxQ.text: I was excited to try this location of Seersucker, since the San Diego location is fun!  However, I would have to say my meal was probably in top 5 grossest things I've ever had in a restaurant and I've had Mexican food in London!  If rating on just my main dish, I would have given zero stars, the 2-star rating is because the place itself is nice and our waiter was pleasant.  For the main dish, both my friend and I ordered the quinoa.  I want to say that I love quinoa dishes and order them frequently around town.  I have always loved them which is why I thought the roasted vegetables and quinoa here would be delicious!  IT WAS NOT.  It was gross - basically soggy tasting dirt.  There was a big mound of really wet quinoa, not flavored at all except for the gross dirt taste, a couple sliced sweet potatoes (that were kind-of hard and just tasted plain) and there might have been a couple slivers of kale.  I kept trying to take some more bites, thinking it couldn't be so gross as I thought, but finally I had to give up.  My friend also thought it tasted gross.  I was kind of surprised the waiter didn't say anything when he took our plates, since both were almost completely untouched, he didn't even ask if we liked it.  Not that I expected anything - I obviously made a bad choice, but thought it was weird all the same.  I will not be coming back here.  I think they should be embarrassed to serve such a bad dish.  For the money we spent I really expected something great or at least edible, not soggy dirt.  Gross!

VUvfcuX9_dZRLcc3IqAjMA.text: I normally wont blast a restaurant on yelp, but this time I had too, especially when spending a lot of money for a great dining experience, and also at a celebrity chefs restaurant.  We came to Searsucker Las Vegas  on Christmas day. We have been to the one in San Diego for drinks, and it was so good we wanted to try vegas. Well it was disappointing. Especially when the GM of the restaurant is leaning agains the counter by the open kitchen, looking out to the tables while constantly being on his phone. We were there for 2 hours and for the 2 hours he was on his phone and didnt look up or come to any tables. The open kitchen is ment to he a show for the dining guests. Everytime i would look up to watch the show I was so distracted by the eye sore of the main manager engulfed in his phone. Grant it he may have been checking important emails but for goodness sake go off the floor to do so. Very taky. Very unprofessional. When i mentioned this to other people they also experienced the GM on his phone. Bad dining experience wont be back.

qyg6zZHxvrzwFwmMQQcPFw.text: At Laurie's birthday 11/20/2015..9:33pm. Party of 14. My New York Steak - worse than gross. Denny's is like Mortons compared to this. I ordered medium. Barely ran past the fire. Lobster Mac n Cheese disgusting. Bearded Waiter - convinced this stuff was going to be good... Maybe it is sometimes. People at our table really liked the bone marrow dish.  Crab cake was good. Calamari was very good.

Lf7Wfdl58k9dNil_LV-Krg.text: Fun atmosphere, kind of like a high end dive bar. Food was invigorating, lots of flavor with ever bite. Fish tacos were great and so was the iced tea lemonade cocktail. The Chef was going around greeting everyone and chatting at tables for all those top chef fans out there.

Ey_kIgXyYp7-InmxmypZ6w.text: The food was excellent food! Really tasty. Albacora with procciuto and quinoa were my favorits

sdYoVB6Sf9LmVmJfAXNSyA.text: We recently had dinner at Searsucker at Caesar's Palace. Never having visited any of their locations, I was a little nervous about their over-emphasis on "social dining" -  sorry, I'm not interested in making new friends during dinner - but, honestly, I didn't notice this in action at the restaurant; we had a four-top for the 4 of us and from what I could see, each group dining had their own space. So that was a relief.  I had no expectations going in and was really very, very pleased with everything we order, from the cocktails to the apps and entrees. We eat a lot in Vegas, like most people, and have eaten both at medium and high end restaurants in that city. For us, particular standouts were the eggs + bacon "pork belly", with pork that I swear melted in your mouth, it was so tender, and my loin "filet" (not sure why they love to put words in quotes so much...), with lobster butter + mushroom demi glace.    Even though this is a positive review, I do need to add one negative note. Here's what drove me crazy about Searsucker: They have a bathroom attendant in both the men and women's bathroom. In this modern day and age, there is absolutely no f*&#ing reason to have an individual in a bathroom whose sole purpose is to hand you a paper towel, and to be tipped for doing so. But what makes it worse here is that, at least the men's bathroom, is TINY- there is only ONE vanity sink, hemmed in a very small area and this tuxedo-clad attendant (who, upon my entry, startled me by yelling "Hey, Boss! Welcome to the Men's Room!") and I had to awkwardly jockey for position in front of it, with him adding value to his service by waving his hand in front of the faucet motion sensor to get my tap started. It's completely ridiculous, awkward and uncomfortable and I know several of us at our table were actually painfully putting off trips to the bathroom just to avoid it. So, if you are reading this Searsucker, ditch the ridiculous bathroom attendants!  But otherwise, we were really very pleased with drinks, food and service. Vegas has too many great places to eat for me to promise to make it back here, but I also wouldn't complain if that ended up happening.

wZMHqrOPmuDdY6eFS2Ji-g.text: This is the first time in Vegas and we arrived late to our hotel (Ceasar's). The searsucker was one of the only restaurants open at the time; the ambiance appeared nice from the outside, so we have it a shot. 1st look at menu revealed extremely high prices ($46 for fish and chips!). Our experience was that food was average at best and not worth the cost. Duck fat fries, which we were told was one of the specialties, was not savory. The best appetizer was the steak calamari. The best part of our experience at this restaurant was service; our waitress was outstanding, attentive, and very friendly. Also, food arrived fast. Overall, we felt food was not worth cost, and being from NYC, I am somewhat accustomed to pricey places but expect quality in return!

5RjT6WDCVzn_Hz4ZYOaJtg.text: Very tasty food. Get the shrimp and grits and you won't be sorry and I know I'm from the south and that was better than my mama's! Great service too.

TW13T-7jOQx25ScuKwRgVw.text: Came here for a group work dinner, the one in San Diego seemed to have better food. We ordered a little bit of everything and when asking the waitress how much to get and what to get she seemed to lack suggestions or portion size experience. Overall I'd might come back to this location, but I've eaten better in Vegas!

mD1_XGYPAUyp4wek8WCWkg.text: I cannot say how fantastic our experience was! We went for an early dinner on a Saturday night and the service was great. We ordered a couple of items I read reviews about on Yelp and they were AMAZING!  I had the eggs and bacon and let me tell you I would drive across town just to have that again and again and again!  We also ordered the short rib. Excellent.  My husband had the Pork Butt entree based on our waitress, Tammy's, recommendation. He was not disappointed!  The table next to us ordered the bone marrow. Apparently, a waiter in the Austin restaurant started a trend of pouring a shot of bourbon through the bone to get any remaining marrow. Keep that in mind if you order the bone marrow! Sounds fantastic.  Dessert was good too. Interesting though that as stellar as the entrees and small plates were the desserts weren't quite as outstanding (and I am a dessert fiend). However, Tammy did recommend the cookies and we opted for the s'mores and sundae. Again, they were very good, just not as outstanding as the other food. Tammy said that she bakes cookies at home and the cookies there are the best she's ever had. Definitely trying the cookies next time.  FYI - the music is loud and there are no soft surroundings. Be prepared for it to be noisy.  We will definitely be returning!

dnVc8oSrYVhB6kqHT-mu_w.text: Came in with a friend, sat at the bar with zero wait. Bartenders name was Juice. Super knowledgable about all cocktails and the menu. Ended up getting a simple gin and tonic to drink. Ordered a few items from there small list. Hamachi was amazing but a little small, beef tartare was great and good size as well, muscles were huge portion and delicious. Over all great experience Juice gave us great suggestions and will definitely be returning to see him.

splky1ho4BD_2zyhvyOI8Q.text: Outstanding. Tasty. Great staff and service. So good to have this in CP.

XASNJH4G64X86HLpVcdapw.text: Perhaps the kitchen was having an off night but the food in here was proactively bad. Short rib was dry/bland. Ceviche was sad/tired and lacked any citrus punch. Mushroom and buratta was flavorless. The only reason I don't give it 1 star are the brussel sprouts were delicious and the service was pretty friendly...although the server didn't ask why we left the short rib completely uneaten. Overall a huge bummer for what we were expecting.

xcmpEp7aaCmasqq3JDmnAQ.text: Awesome experience. Everything we had was delicious. Our bartender Adrian was extremely friendly and insightful about the menu. I highly recommend the "infused" cocktails and the s'mores dessert.

NIdYx5RuLKhNKOkPyFv7pg.text: I shared a couple of plates with my friends.  The short rib with mashed potatoes was the best dish out of all the ones we ordered.  If you are eating here, you have GOT to try it!

o0zxc_lsjrRf3pssc7PHTw.text: I was excited to try one of the newest restaurants in Las Vegas and it did not disappoint! Great atmosphere, amazing menu selection, spectacular food! This restaurant is a MUST TRY! And request Lindsey...she, by far, was the best server I've ever had...very knowledgeable about the menu, attentive to our needs, and pushed this great dining experience over the top!!!

KfqoArZdvHZtkUg-UIhl2g.text: This place is insanely good. Great food, great bar and awesome atmosphere.   Highly recommended!!

DTeMnND9kkS0mjP2EW4r1g.text: Date - June 15, 2015  After have a decent, but not great, dinner at Hakassan we cabbed back to Caesars (our home base) for dessert at Searsucker. The place was fairly crowded but we got seated right away.  The decor is interesting and the ambiance is extremely loud - there is no intimacy and conversation is very difficult.  Our waitress seemed overwhelmed - everything was very slow. At one point she came to check on us well after we had ordered and said, "How is everything? Oh, I see you don't have your desserts yet." That pretty much sums up the experience.  The desserts were OK  ... we had two orders of the warm apple crostata (it wasn't very warm) and one order of cookies and milk. We ended up taking two of the cookies with us and they were thrown away the next day.  I don't need to go back.

Vm13KK88QAn6xatq33x6Yw.text: Fabulous! Excellent service. Excellent food.  Servers really know the menu. Go for the drinks or the food, or (I recommend) both.  Signature drinks are worth your while and then some...but the food...oh my. So good!  The beet salad says it all:  simple, yet fantastic. The goat cheese balls make even the non-salad fan happy.  I have no favorites, it was allllll good.  We had an assortment of "smalls" (appetizers) and entrees and even dessert...each one was superb.  I'm especially a fan of the Squid "Sweet Heat".  Visually intriguing and the taste was appealing!  The bavette "flank" was perfection.

RQpCo850u6JRwn3QxVdkdQ.text: We were welcomed back and they more than made up for it.   My rating as of right now. This is based on the poor customer service I just received. I booked my reservation online and confirmed it via phone. They call today to tell me it is being pushed till later, which was unacceptable due to other plans. It's my wife's birthday and this ruined our evening plans. Would have liked to try the food, maybe another time.

KreRCtcSGxKO1xDrC5Asww.text: I had big hopes for this since the one in San Diego is so good, and the Vegas Searsucker definitely lived up to the name!  We had close to one of everything on the menu, and everything was delicious.  There wasn't much left on anybody's plates.  My favorites were the cheese puffs,  shortribs, scalops, and spicy shrimp.  The loin filet was also amazing.

yuoy0S_Gl3DNyDLURnf4gw.text: What a fun place! Everything from the service to the food was amazing. The overall atmosphere was so lively i will definitely be back to dine on my next trip to vegas!

2NcBU-vJZYRuOMhS_F9wHw.text: Brian Malarkey has joined the bandwagon of celebrity chefs and finally opened his own restaurant in Caesar's. Located right next to Omnia, the offerings aren't limited to seafood. Every Vegas restaurant has to offer steak and Searsucker is no different. But, I like some of the farm offerings as well including pork, chicken, and even rabbit. For Vegas standards, the entree prices are on par, but I see a lot of value in the small plates. We went with a large party for my friend's 30th birthday so we got to try a little bit of everything.   For starters, the cheddar puffers were as addictive as those crack cheddar biscuits from Red Lobster back in the day. Check-in on Yelp for a free serving of the habanero, coriander pickles. A word of warning, the pickles were delicious, but do NOT eat the habaneros (from experience). The roasted shishito peppers in ponzu were some of my favorites. The texture and flavor was almost like that of a shiitake mushroom. Of the small plates, the duck fat fries with chipotle ketchup was outstanding. The mussels were great too, but I didn't get much flavor from the beef tartare.   Seeing as Malarkey is known for seafood, I opted to get the mahi. The drunken cherries and smokey almonds outshined the actual fish. I could eat a whole bowl of just that sauce. The pork butt is another popular dish if you're not feeling the seafood. The desserts were great too and worth sampling. The "ermahgerd" sundae was delicious, but my favorite was the s'mores bar.   I would definitely come back for happy hour, which runs 4:30-6:00 pm. We ended up spending over $75 per person, which was pricey, but ended up getting us into Omnia for free to see Nicky Romero. You bypass the general admission line as well. Win!

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mahi with drunken cherries and smokey almonds

drKFvKiwmuJ6H24AZ40DEw.text: One of the best restaurants in Vegas!! Came here for our one year and got the burger! Best burger I've ever had in my entire life!

JPf0wRk0qQKn-SVZQsSnEw.text: Very cool vibe, fun drinks, and a great bar where you can people watch all the folks lining up for Omnia if you're there on a Saturday night. We had already eaten dinner when we stopped in for a round of drinks, but the menu looked really impressive. We ordered a round, and the drinks were not out of control expensive (It's Vegas, so I'm typically expecting about $15-$20 for a drink depending on which casino you're in)... I got a really nice glass of NZ sav blanc for $13, and the specialty cocktails ran about $15 a pop. Will definitely return the next time I'm at Ceasar's Palace.

DN1yPGHeKU2DjI6GXgfRBA.text: Not really a great place for vegetarians. I can usually find something pretty decent to eat at most restaurants. However, I was pretty disappointed with my menu options. The only entree was the quinoa dish which was basically a soggy mound of quinoa with a little bit of steamed spinach underneath, topped with a few shreds of raw carrots and some micro greens. The dish was very bland and disappointing for $23. The beet salad was pretty good. It had golden beet chunks with a creaming dressing. And there were these two little fried cheese balls that were a nice surprise! Overall, it had a Nice sweet flavor but was a very small portion. The best dish was the side of brussels spouts with walnuts. They were charred with balsamic, tangy and tender.   Service was average, and food was average as well. Nothing stood out about this experience that would warrant s repeat visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States

w3lSBfJjSE1tXCWmUkRP1w.text: It's barely been open for 6 months and is super easy to find! (right next to Omnia and the sportsbook)  but 5 Stars for HAPPY HOUR! It runs from 4:30pm-6:00pm Monday-Friday.  If you want to sample many of their dishes without paying the premium prices! I suggest stopping by for happy hour. Be wary, it's only in the bar area so if the hosts walks you over to the dining area, just let her know you're there for happy hour and drinks.  The menu has about a dozen items and it's significantly discounted! Food comes out "shared" style but to be honest, the portions are fairly large compared to other "small plate" or tapas style places.  We had the:  Farm Bird Lollipops - Chicken meatballs that are seared on a stick. You get three per order and they serve it over an arugala and bleu cheese salad!  Caesar Salad - MAN as a "side salad" this thing was HUGE. Only $6 well worth it.  Spicy Squid - Lightly battered squid in a hot and sour sauce. Pretty tasty, but I wish it was more crispy.   Short Rib - Super moist braised short rib over mashed potatoes. If you're buzzing and need something warm to sober you up, this dish will do the trick. $10 but portion size is fairly decent.  The cocktails and drinks are also discounted too. Most of them are under $7-$8 (marked down from $12-$16).   Service was great. Well worth it! We had all those dishes mentioned and 2 drinks each..came out to about $70. Definitely stop by if you're looking for a good experience!

hLAi1cdZC2cMHlhwyBVZ8Q.text: I really liked the meal I had here. I started off with the field greens and pear salad which was very good. The goat cheese was smeared across one side of plate then salad placed on side. I had never seen that before and it was sorta good but also made me think, what if they just didn't wash this plate? Lol As main course had the beer braised short ribs with horseradish mashed potatoes. That was delicious, I had been on a no carb diet and eating those potatoes was like eating a rainbow for me. Very tasty. I didn't really get the 3 onion rings on top 1 would have been plenty but didn't think it really went with rest of dish.   For dessert had the milk and cookies which was amazing and couldn't finish them all so got some for breakfast snack.  My server was great.

HJ9BaeZlPEQDZ2MvzX4T0w.text: I'm a big Top Chef fan so when I heard Chef Brian Malarkey opened up his San Diego restaurant in Caesars I had to stop by. Not having much time, we decided to just try a few dishes at the bar. BTW, their happy hour menu is really awesome here. I've posted a pic of it.  Crab cake was awesome. I can say the best I've had. Loved all the elements that came with it including the aioli and Tabasco caviar.  Squid was nice. Not your typical fried calamari. It's a slice up a calamari steak, batter, fried and tossed in a sweet mild chili sauce. Think calamari steak fries.  Duck fat fries were nice but chipotle ketchup threw it off for me. We asked if they have regular ketchup, they don't. The fries have a crisp that you won't get frying with typical oil.  After some amazing apps, the short rib underwhelmed. It was very typical and a bit bland.  I like my drinks sweet, this is not the place for sweet drinks. We had the Indian Summer and Achilles Peel. Achilles Peel was better but we had to ask for simple syrup.  Our server Lindsey was super cool. She was friendly, knowledgeable and was on top of everything we needed.  Will be back for dinner next time!

1kV_4n1W_8D3KhgoGNiSgQ.text: Good vibe restaurant in Caesar's. Two of our party of 6 ordered drunken flat iron. We both sent it back. Wasn't good. The re-fire was just as bad.  Everything else was ok but not great.

vPP46fLAy3yAAs6FggRvYQ.text: I love Vegas so much  I visit every few months.  Being a foodie, next to NY or ChiTown, Vegas is the next best thing to finding great food.  Yes everything is glamorized and every casino restaurant has a celebrity chef's name attached to it.  I only know Brian Malarkey from The Taste show.  His take on food is creative, yet comforting and not too out there.  Simple well known flavors that are combined and work well.  We only had three different dishes and all were delicious and tasty.  Brie Triple + Strawberry Jam - Not sure what the "triple" means, but you get three crostinin's, a nice size cut of brie topped with jam to even out the flavor and thickness of the brie.  Good starter!  Egg + Bacon (pork belly) -  This a similar take on eggs benedict.  You have a nice toasted piece of bread, layered with slow cooked tender juicy pork belly and topped with a poached egg and gravy.  Every bite was savory and sumptuous.  For our main entree we both had the Loin Filet (yah we are adventurous).  I guess these new age chefs dont like to call it filet mignon any more, but in essence thats what it was.  It was flavorful, tender and a good sized serving for $40.  The lobster butter and mushroom demi gave it that punch it needed to not make it the boring filet mignon served at your favorite steakhouse.  Service was quick and pleasant, but we didnt have the connection with our servers you can feel when they really enjoy their job.    I liked that it was casual and not stuffy, high end.  Nice addition to the vegas scene.

-BeLvq0Ar963ox9wtCfNrA.text: Dropped by before a concert. BUSY LOUD  and FUN. DUCK fat fries are a must,  also had HAMACHI. BUT the highlight of the the meal were the 3 small biscuits in a small iron skillet. I am from the south and know biscuits but these were the best I have ever eaten-sorry GRANDMA. Light flaky and dusted with sugar we saved them for dessert!

SiD23rmW436ZPZyQSJ52lQ.text: The old fashions were overly sweet and the service was really poor. We waited 40+min to order our main dish and when it was served it was the wrong dish. The "special" was an overpriced piece of beef at $120 per pound! The waiter had told us beef and lobster for $30. Total price with drinks was over $200. Definitely the worst food and service while in Vegas. Would give it zero if it was an option.

TBcjZOLaQfoiwKFSjq04fw.text: This is celebrity chef Brian Malarkey's foray into the Las Vegas food scene. The restaurant is divided into three sections and there's a bar area with eating/drinking overlooking the casino.   Four of us met for dinner and ordered a number of small plates, greens, and main courses.  We shared all items ordered and here's the list:  Egg and pork belly Short ribs Brie and cranberry jam Cowboy caviar Shrimp and grits Mushrooms and burrata Strawberry, champagne, walnut, and goat cheese salad Spinach, bacon, mushroom, and sweetbread salad Jalapeno-chorizo corn off the cob Pork butt with whiskey apples and bacon emulsion Duck with white bean, confit, and fig Brussels sprouts and walnuts Mahi "baja" with drunken cherries and smokey almonds Apple crostata Ermahgerd sundae S'mores Pumpkin cake  While waiting for all four to arrive, two of us were given a container of cheddar puffs and more were brought when we were all seated.  We discussed what each found interesting on the menu.  The head chef joined us and explained the entire menu and he gave us some suggestions.  The outstanding items were the egg and pork belly, cowboy caviar, the strawberry salad, pork butt, Brussels spouts, egg and pork belly, and the mahi.  Of those items, the mahi was the best thing of the night.  The char and the perfect grilling of the mahi made it an incredible dish.  The cowboy caviar, a.k.a. bull testicle, was tender and had a light breading before frying.    The pork belly was quite thick but was tender and cooked well.  I was surprised at how much I liked the strawberry frisee salad.  The champagne dressing with the walnuts and goat cheese was very refreshing and tasty!    The pork butt was done nicely so that it was pull apart goodness.  There was a discussion about the Brussels sprouts.  I was very fond of this dish and I found the crisp char on the sprouts to be just to my liking.  My only disappointment was the brie with cranberry jam.  The brie had lost all flavor and it really needed the jam to give the dish some taste.  I'd skip this one.  As for dessert, we agreed the S'mores topped the others.  The menu describes the dessert as Graham + salted caramel ganache + honey chocolate mousse + marshmallow + chocolate ice cream + cookie crumble.  The Ermahgerd sundae was also good.  It's described as Peanut butter gelato + peanut coffee "rocks" + caramel+brownies + bruleed banana.  The pumpkin cake and the apple crostata were also very good.  I think I could go back and have all five of the desserts but skip the 6th--cookies and milk--and I'd have had a memorable time!  Great ending to our feast!  Service was excellent.  Jeremy--our main server--came from the original Searsucker in San Diego and he was top notch in everything.  We were given clean share plates and utensils for each course.  Jeremy coursed our selections perfectly so we didn't get a whole lot at any one time.  Water was replenished often.  For a new place, they are really doing things well.  Plating was nicely done, the flavors are complex, and the textures are good.    I'll have to get back here if they put back on the menu the rabbit and wild boar chops that are listed online but have been removed from the printed restaurant menu.

0iJx65jiOfwTApeklP9Qvw.text: Absolutely AMAZING! The burger is delicious! And their speciality steak was out of this world! Great macaroni, potatoes and fries! The service is great! I will definitely be coming back! Tyler is awesome!!!

krqguJ7ChAuzXizj1IvAXw.text: Dinner on a Friday evening just a few days after they opened and Searsucker already had a decent amount of people seated, enjoying their food.  We were seated in an awkward table in a walkway on the way to the restroom so my chair got kicked and bumped on a number of occasions. If I were to return I would ask for a more secluded table.  I had the pleasure of enjoying a meal with several dining companions which gave us a chance to order and sample a number of items from the menu.  For a new restaurant service already seemed on point, but that may just have been our good fortune to get the only server in the restaurant that came over from the Searsucker location in San Diego. He was knowledgable, friendly and very attentive.   Our plates came out in a well-balanced manner. Never inundating us with too much food so we were able to sample at a leisurely pace.  My favorites from the evening were the mahi, pork butt, egg and pork belly and surprisingly the strawberry salad. Each of these dishes were well-cooked and the flavors were on point.   The rest of the food was good, but didn't leave a lasting impression with me. I love brussel sprouts but these weren't as crispy as I like and seemed drowned in garlic, not really allowing me to enjoy the flavor of the vegetable. I was in the minority in my opinion of this dish, so it might just be a personal preference.   Of the desserts we sampled, the smores dish came out as a table favorite. Even I, who am neither a huge fan of chocolate or smores, enjoyed it, though I couldn't take more than a bite since it was rich. This dish is best shared. The rest of the desserts didn't really do as much for me, but they were decent. Again, I was in the minority on this opinion, so it may be due to my lack of sweet tooth.   Searsucker is already ahead of the game after opening so recently. Good service, excellent location and decent food to boot. With their eclectic menu and late night availability I see them being successful in catering to the pre-show and after clubbing crowd quite well.

ArYkot-fuHQ1Jbr1UkqJCg.text: Nice service at the bar. Those happy hour sliders were good, but tiny (as in 2-3 bites max). The PBJ Old Fashioned was smoothe and tasty. Their Sucker Punch drink was my fave.
