lAW8aD5yeOt2d8j4BCKCdg.text: My husband had the 8 oz filet minion special which was very good. I had the 6 oz filet on the menu, which was not as good as his.  My cut was thinner and had more salt.

S_MQz7LYDVdRIoibMVBIuA.text: Very nice restaurant and great decor inside. Hanger steak was awesome and the whipped potatoes were delicious. Biscuits I could take a whole batch home if you like sweet honey biscuits.

1SjKUwNd5LVbQ-2ySmW6Jw.text: Shabby sheek.....nice ambiance.  Bar and my waiter were as slow as that old lady in the left lane.  Buuut the kitchen made up for it.  My table had the Salmon (legit!), fillet (solid), short ribs (fantastic), Mac and cheese (can't go wrong), and the Yellow Tail appetizer ......shhheeeeeet it's the best I've ever had.   Awesome place.

ZjHuuRxf7g3pnxcZtb9CHw.text: Tammie  One of my favorite experiences in Vegas... Let's start with the basics... Food - EXCELLENT Service - EXCELLENT  Value - GOOD Decor - Rustic/Sophisticated Hubby and I went in for Happy Hour (5-7pm daily). We arrived around 5:30 and found a table top by the bar. We started off with a Springtime Collins from the HH cocktail menu ($8). Very refreshing and a great start to our meal. We ordered a few items of the HH menu and regular menu (everything looked delicious, I would have ordered one of everything if I could have).  1/2 dozen oysters (reg. menu $3/ea), which happened to be from Washington, HH Tuna Tacos ($9), HH Shishito Peppers ($9), and the Bone Marrow (reg menu $19). Everything was tasty! I'm used to only seeing green shishito peppers but this order came with red and green, very colorful and well-seasoned. The bone marrow was excellent! Pure indulgence. Topped with crispy brussel sprout leaves and served with bruschetta toast to be devoured with the melty buttery marrow goodness. Highly recommend.   And then we have the dessert... WOW! First of all, everything on the dessert menu looks delicious, so you better save room. We ordered the s'mores bar served with a scoop of chocolate ice cream and I would have regretted it if we didn't. Perfect balance of marshmallow to silky honey chocolate mousse to chewy graham cracker base. I usually find many desserts too sweet and I couldn't keep my fork away from this thing. A must order.   And finally... the service, absolutely excellent. Our server Tammie (Tammy?)  was amazing. She knew everything on the menu, in detail, and had a great attitude. One of my favorite experiences in Vegas. Will be back on our next visit for sure.   P.S. I've been to their location in San Diego and it was just as amazing! Praying for a Seattle location!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smores bar - must order.
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone marrow. Holy moly. 3
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters from Washington. Excellent.

0eAzhF1rO4BGYC8On5Tx1Q.text: The ambiance and food is good. We ordered many of their small plates to share: calamari steaks, octopus, hamachi, duck fat fries, brussels, cauliflower and bone marrow. Everything was OK, there was nothing I ate that I would say was exceptional. However, everything did "look" pretty tasty and while it did taste good, again, nothing special.  We ordered the grilled cheese, a couple salads, the tuna tacos and some sliders. I would say the grilled cheese was the best of all these selections. Nice presentation and really tasty as well.  My one gripe about our experience was our waitress, she seems so over it before our wine even came out. It was a bummer because I truly believe the experience is a huge part of eating out (at least for me). She was dry and emotionless and seemed annoyed overall, which put a damper on our experience, unfortunately. Also, the place was pretty empty, which was weird for a Saturday night in Vegas at 9 pm.   I think I prefer Herringbone Las Vegas...but probably wouldn't turn down coming here again, the food was decent enough to try again.

nCsNzxe6NnPuXg6RcBXyBA.text: Really wouldn't waste a trip here again. We waited at our table for about 8-10 minutes before even being greeted by our server. Then, when he did come, he just asked if we were ready; didn't ask if we wanted drinks or explain the menu at all.   We ordered the mushrooms and burrata: it was good. The mushrooms were nicely seasoned but that's about it. We then ordered the shrimp and grits; nothing special. The food runner did great explaining the dishes though, so that was a plus. They then dropped off the lollipops (which we didn't order). I stated that we did not order them and the guy said that they were on the house. We weren't sure why. We tried 2 of them and weren't impressed so we just had them take them back. Our server then informed us that whomever dropped them at the table, made a mistake, so they really weren't "on the house" or compliments of anyone; it was just a mistake.   Based on the two starters, we quickly decided not to waste the money on an entree. We ordered the ermagerd sundae and continued to wait for about 20-25 minutes before getting it. Really?! Being a pastry chef, it was obvious that everything in that dish was premade and just needed to be thrown together. The server came over after about 15 minutes to apologize and tell us that the person who makes the desserts also makes the salads and was in the weeds because of a large party. We got it about 10 minutes later. It was ice cream and two baby brownie bites and bananas; there's nothing bad you can really say about it.  The service really killed the experience. For two of us that work at a semi-fine dining restaurant in Chicago, we really expected more, but weren't that surprised. These places turn over thousands of guests, and it was apparent that they had that mentality. We wanted to spend a good penny here and order a bunch off the menu, but it all just started so poorly. Kinda a shame ..

RfMqQOYL4AQkmPAlvgkxzA.text: The restaurant is located inside Caesars Palace all the way in the back near Mesa Grill.  We ordered the following: -Lt. Dan; an alcoholic ice tea lemonade perfect for those who like strong herbal tea flavors.  -Snake in the grass;  a classic mojito with lots of mint.  -Pan Seared Scallops with Couscous and Citrus Sauce;  three jumbo size scallops cooked to tender perfection on a bed of couscous with pesto and citrus sauce. The  couscous was delicious and blends very well with the thick pesto sauce; however, there was that additional sweet and sour like sauce  that the boyfriend and I weren't fond of because it didn't add to anything.     -The Porkbutt with whiskey apples and bacon emulsion was the most popular and recommended dish, but had mixed reactions from us. I'll admit the pork was so tender, so moist,  and practically melted in our mouths, but I found the porkbutt and bacon emulsion too salty and overwhelming. If you love salty foods like the boyfriend, then this is a must try dish.  I do love the whiskey apples which added a crunchy texture and pickled flavor to combat the salty and fatty porkbutt.   Overall, it was a good experience and we will definitely come back to try the duck next time.

8tKwf1REbKPaX0FAzc-E-Q.text: I remember the days when restaurants in Vegas were cheap so you would come in and gamble!  Now, not so much.  Food was average.  The bone marrow was really sweet, not savory.  Both our entrees (short rib and steak) were low on flavor.  The mac and cheese delivered but when doesn't it?  The cocktails were something I could have made at home. Service was very attentive.  Reservation was needed and they sat us on time.

7lCLMlUGCqWsGiQgyRsDjw.text: Service was excellent, the food was interesting and whimsical even.  I enjoyed the pork belly and bone marrow the most among entrees. The emerghard was probably the best sundae I've ever had.  Only quibble is the little bread they bring out wasn't good and I didn't love the duck fat fries as much as I should've given I love duck fat. It's also somewhat pricey but it's the Strip

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cowboy Caviar--which is actually fried bull&#39;s balls doused w Champagne mustard vinaigrette &amp; served w fried veggies &amp; onion jam
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork belly and eggs yum
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone marrow with fresno bourbon glaze and shallots surrounded by fried Brussel sprouts.

4VPGQ_EeXEsIT4o-zDMaNw.text: We were 3 for dinner here a few nights ago. I have been a big fan of Searsucker since discovering it in San Diego a few years ago. I had mentioned at that time that the Pork Belly entree I had would be a contender as a last meal request should I ever be condemned. On this visit, my wife and I and our friend decided to share some small plates and then choose entrees. We had the Tuna Poke which was excellent and served with crunchy tortilla crackers. We also had the grilled Shishito peppers which  wonderfully seasoned with soy sauce and not too hot, though with Shishitos you never know when you'll get a real burner! We also had the spicy shrimp ceviche which was served with crispy taro root chips. All three were superb! For the mains both our friend and I had the Pork Butt (The Pork Belly I longed for was not on offer) However, the Butt was tender and perfectly cooked, and was served with some sides that I also really liked but don't recall just now. My wife had the scallops, which is always a fave of hers and these did not disappoint! They shared a slice of lemon cheesecake which they described as "pretty awesome!" All around this is a fantastic place for dinner.  The only thing I would say that misses the mark at this location is that it's slightly too bright and they had huge TV's playing Monday night football at top volume, that made it difficult to have a normal conversation. The other Searsucker location was intimate and dim and would be a great date place, this location seems to be more like a sports bar which was incongruent with the food offerings.

hvprrGwtTlvmM6pTlwJuDg.text: Inside Caesars, you find this gem. Loved the decor! We all shared the huge (36oz) and amazing tomahawk steak - feed 6 people. Mac n cheese was bomb! Brussel sprouts and walnuts delish!  Service was good. You won't be disappointed with the food. Only gripe is that we could only do the happy hour drinks at the bar, not offered 5-7pm in dinning room.

PDtxkmNm5LLzSDUFmjpSSQ.text: This was our second visit to Searsuckers and each time the good was excellent.   The fish and chips are some of the best we've ever had. The mac and cheese is superbly made and the lollipop buffalo chicken wings are finger licking good. We ordered multiple items, all were very good.   Dessert is great too, we ordered the rocky road bread pudding and the chocolate chip cookies.

KCsHEpE4_1Ca8TrFMxYoMA.text: As a southerner, searsucker represents classic southern charm and sophistication. This place was definitely shooting for that theme of country chic I guess you could say. They had decorated with pallet wall accents and some food was served in mason jars. The menu (especially apps) seemed to be twists on traditional southern favorites. We had the beef tartare and it was served in a mason jar with a wooden spoon. It came with crunchy toast and a small bowl of insanely good spicy pickles. The tartare hit the mark for sure. We got the pear and goat cheese salad which was also quite delicious. We ordered cocktails and wine during our meal and the service was definitely on point. We didn't wait for anything and our waitress checked in frequently. For the entree we got the swordfish grilled plain (there is an option for sauce that I skipped) and we got the shortrib. The shortrib was excellent although not the best I have ever had. But I can say the only place that ever beat it was a small farm to table restaurant in our hometown. The swordfish was lacking. Maybe I should have gone with a choice of sauce with it but I am a minimalist when it comes to food choosing to really taste the freshness and the quality of a meat over the accoutrements. It was a little over cooked but the side of Brussels was some of the best I've ever tasted. It came with an assortment of roasted peppers that were very tasty as well. We got the duck fat fries as a side for the shortrib and these are a must!   The atmosphere is a mix of country meets Vegas and it comes off a little weird to me. The theme could have been pushed a little more to really drive it home but I understand this is a Caesars palace restaurant and the type of customer it caters to. I can say that the bathroom attendants were very pushy and overbearing but that has nothing really to do with the food. Overall...this is a great restaurant with some unique twists on dishes. I wouldn't say it's spectacular and we did have better food for the same price (around $200 for two people). But I am definitely not regretful we tried it....the beef tartare, pickles, duck fat fries and service made it worth the experience.

O8YiQ-8ed0II1GwFtpaMBQ.text: A last minute find by someone in our group turned out to be a great experience all around!  We all guess that it'll be impossible to get in so quickly in the not so distant future.    Great small plates- anything pork is bound to please.  Lively atmosphere and very friendly and attentive staff.    You won't go wrong here!

NXx9YVKxHw9XoP4Kwx_uIQ.text: Came here after a nice day at the pool and my experience was amazing! Lindsey my waitress was so helpful and made great recommendations. I had the Duck which was out of this world! From the ambiance to the service to the food Searsucker Las Vegas is amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing dish! For sure get the Duck

NNAVd1MH22CzZWL_6hNHnw.text: The first time I came to visit this venue - I was surprised at how quiet it was. There wasn't a lot of traffic at this time. The service was professional - from the time my friend and I sat down until we closed out we were treated as if we were at a 5 star steakhouse. I ordered the Achilles Peel to start - although the drink was more potent than I thought I could still taste the sweet flavor or mixed berry. For an appetizer my friend and I started with an order of crab cakes. The order was smaller than we though and tasted salty - although the garnish on top of the crab cake helped take down our sodium levels. For my entree - I ordered the filet which was super tender and very easy to cut. I wasn't a fan of the sauce that was on top of the filet but the mushroom sauce on the bottom helped with the flavor. For dessert - we ordered the banana bread pudding which was sweet but still crunchy. The server was thoughtful and put Happy Birthday near the bottom of the banana bread. Our overall experience at Searsucker was okay but I would definitely try the place again. It's nice to feel like a VIP on your birthday.

bmdnrUaRt9nBNAq4v7Sr1w.text: Great vibes, great food, and an overall great experience. From the moment I entered Searsucker, I felt a welcoming ambiance that lingered the whole night.  Started the dinner with their duck fat fries with chipotle ketchup and the short ribs. The fries were amazing and the short ribs were tender and succulent.  For mains, I ordered the loin "filet"  with lobster butter and mushroom demi. The filet was cooked to the perfect temperature. I also tried some of the salmon which was also delicious as well.  Now, my absolute favorite part of dinner was the dessert. I tried the S'mores bar and the Cookies  and Milk. Both were perfect toppers to a delicious meal. Never thought a ordinary food combination like milk and cookies could actually taste so unique.  The staff and management were very welcoming and provided me and my group with a unique and great dining experience. Managers stopped by our table to greet us, and even Chef Brian Malarkey stopped by our table to ask us how everything was.   Definitely a must-see in Las Vegas!

No2HKRzuEqBgNFh82bLfBQ.text: I was soo happy to make it this restaurant for dinner on Saturday... We missed our original reservation and had to change it several times that night... Luckily, we made it to the restaurant at 11:40pm and made it for the "late night" menu..  Everything we ordered was bomb, with the exception of one dish...   Need to order: duck fat fries + tomato jam,  "Caesar" romaine + kale + egg + parm, and short rib "the harlot" + horseradish + fried.. ALL TASTY AND YUMMY!!  One dish that was not on the "late night" menu was-- beet + radish + creme fraiche + goat cheese WHICH the kitchen was able to make for us-- AWESOME!! VERY YUMMY!!  Dessert to order: S'mores Bar--  Graham + salted caramel ganache + honey  chocolate mousse + marshmallow + chocolate ice cream + cookie crumble... ABSOLUTELY SCRUMPTIOUS!!  I was disappointed about the-- farm bird lollipops + hot sauce + bleu.  I can handle spicy, but this was soo spicy I couldn't enjoy it.  We didn't ask for it to be taken off the bill, but the waitress should've asked when she noticed we didn't like it when only of the lollipops were missing from the dish (which was on my plate) when we asked her to take it away.    Other than that, our overall experience was great!!  I live in southern California and totally looking forward to visiting the San Diego location in the near future...

DC4NqG4kl7YMmkjadCKOeg.text: Pricey.  I had the beet salad, which had way too much arugula. No one likes arugula that much.   Good service and the water glasses are cool!

_pdC4e8m0rOZRtnF2p7OnQ.text: Brought my wife out for a Vegas vacation.  We don't gamble so food is an important part of this vacation.  Searsucker exceeded my expectations as a foodie!  We were here to see Absinthe and didn't want a huge meal so we went with the small plates.  We did the Tuna Poke, Duck Fat Fries, Scallop special, and S'mores desert.  Each dish was excellent and easily filled us up.  We will come back once more before we leave

zDVHeBN8Q8b5e8i86hUidA.text: My wife and I tried this place last night and it was amazing! There's a tricky first step to get into the restaurant, so watch out for that.   On to the food, I ordered the flank steak and my wife ordered the chicken. The food was absolutely delicious, one of the best meals I've ever eaten in Las Vegas.   Our server did such a great job, took care of us and was on top of everything. Great vibe, food and service.

RNeeJQrj6Fuv9PFgoycH7g.text: Everything about this place is awesome!  Great vibe from the people and the food is delicious!! Definitely recommend the Bone Marrow to start and end with the Hanger steak. This place is the real deal!

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone Marrow!

ukhGJSYbbtBnFTfC4NIjDQ.text: One of the best new restaurants in Vegas!! Brian Malarkey is a huge rising star in the culinary world. So happy this San Diego restaurant has made its way to Vegas. You've got to try everything you can and share the plates.

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Welcome to Vegas
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great stuff!!

kWFTM1V3X5jGOHSFZkQY7A.text: Just had an awesome Thanksgiving feast at this lovely restaurant with a great atmosphere. With the family style serving it was the next best thing to having the family around the dinner table at home. But if I'm honest the turkey was better than mine...and maybe even the sausage stuffing too.

oGYlOJAg_LPsv_keVV4Pqg.text: Went there hoping for some small plates we could share , had sliders that were very good. After that all downhill, tuna tacos were tasteless, split a shortrib..not sure how you can make meat that tender bland, someone should introduce the Chef to herbs, vegetables, salt. It was like they braised in tap water and stopped there. Split 2 sides corn and chorizo which was 50% raw tomato, devoid of chorizo. Potatoes with butter...just mashed potatoes, not bad but not great. We won't be back.

DQ33TteT3mbP3bFNP4-EUQ.text: We selected Searsucker for a large group dinner and were impressed with the service (they accommodated a last-minute party-size change with a smile), ambiance (cool, but not loud), and food (delicious all around). This is a great option for dinner, especially with a bigger party.

cxqUbGmo6rgHh8QshUn1sA.text: Cesar, our server was great so does Efren.  Very attentive!  We're so impressed.  However, the 2 hostesses tonight was !  They seemed to be checking something in the computer but were giggling while we wait to be greeted.  The other male host from Omnia who I thought was a guest was talking to them... I move forward to see what these two hostesses were doing in the computer and they were checking something on line!  While the line builds up!  When the hostess in black felt that I was checking what they were on... She changed the screen to the seating arrangement screen... Busted!!!!  And sat us.  They don't have name tags and we did not bother to ask.  So far food was good especially the crab cake and Mac and cheese!  Again,  just thumbs down on the 2 hostesses.

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5_RUDBpEps2nJOs9myeIxw.text: Came here on Sunday with a group of girls for a bachelorette weekend of fun. This was our last night in Vegas and wanted to have an awesome dinner.   I mostly rated this place based on service..I mean maybe it would have been 3 stars if the food was better.  I was super hungover on Sunday so I only got myself a salad. I did try some of the other girl's food and it wasn't anything too special.  I really wish I remembered what our waiters name was, because for the response be gave me and the type of restaurant this place is, I would have expected kinder service.  One of the girls at the end of dinner asked our waiter for a togo box. As she asked him, I also asked him if I could get a box too. His response was, he pointed his finger in the air and told me to "hold on, I can only do ONE thing at a time" he said "my assistant will box it up" then he looked away and ROLLED HIS EYES AT ME and mummered "okay" to himself with crazy eyes and walked away.  I thought I was totally tripping when he did that to me, but 2 other girls saw what he did so I knew I wasn't tripping, nor did I say anything or give him attitude.  Then, we asked for dessert menu and he handed everyone their Happy Hour menu and walked away really fast. We had to ask "his assistant" for the right menu since he wasn't around.  I really don't know what was up his butt, maybe drugs or something but I've never been talked to that way nor had their eyes roll at me at a restaurant when requesting a box.

AKL5J1YCAbwb7f4TOr4_fg.text: The appetizers were delicious. I had the buffalo wings and calamari, not disappointed. My meal was the skirt steak. It was a little salty, but the chimichurri was good. I would definitely recommend this place for its bar environment. It was a very social scene and the people were friendly.

CUftvgGqUo0jwy_BbSdi-w.text: This is without doubt the best happy hour I ever have here in Vegas as we as in Los Angeles. If you go to this place please try the burrata! It s AMAZING, great quality. Beer is very good as well ! I ll come back for sure!!!

IrCPQ8EZ_J5K4Kkq6qJjOw.text: We had all shared plates. Delicious food made uniquely; octopus, calamari, chicken wings. Service was very helpful and took care of us without interruption. Not the best view nor atmosphere but once the food came it didn't matter. They were also quick to get out the first plates. I would go back again to try other plates and enjoy again some of the previous ones.

kLA3Wzhpb4HGl221zZc_BA.text: Overpriced and didn't let us know until it was time to pay they couldn't split the check up. Server had a poor attitude

NVZ3phBZ3Y1sadxkczK9rg.text: Perfect. Soup, appetizer, food all delicious. I am very picky person and don't give 5 Star easily. This place, ambiance,servers,kitchen all 5 stars. This is the one Of the best place for a dining.

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OznhLcVQbcDxzyh4QT8l2Q.text: This place is very lively for happy hour, I recommend stopping by and grabbing a table at the bar. Our happy hour menu did not look like the ones that people posted on here so they may have updated it or they have different menus different nights.  We ordered a bunch of cocktails but really loved the matador and skinny jenny. We also loved the pork chips, fish tacos and sliders. I could have eaten 3 orders of the pork chips, they were wonderful.   The only things we didn't love were the chicken wings and the shishito peppers, they were both fine just not what we were expecting.

MM34K5GHBJCt2gQsqSUdDw.text: Wandering around on our first night in Vegas during the July 4th holiday. We passed by this place and found it look interesting and decided to give it a try! We got a bone marrow plate and mussels. Food is a bit more on the greasy side. The most refreshing dish turned out to be the appetizer we got! spicy hamachi & avocado. SO. GOOD. and it's fun to eat too! Service was very fast and our waiter was very friendly!

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. spicy hamachi &amp; avocado
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. bone marrow* fresno chili bourbon glaze

T5xxk4Xn44COe7Exo3iTOQ.text: Good food but pricey. I enjoyed our meal, the Yelp check in offer is SPICY but delicious, would purchase next time I go, so good business tactic there. I wouldn't mind trying more food on the menu, we came late at night and sat down close to closing time, but nobody seemed to care and we got good service, but we didn't do the usual appetizer, drink, entree approach; however, the food we did have was tasty and good portions. You might feel out of place in shorts and a tshirt, so go to your room and change if you were just at the pool or something.

AsWueXczfqCdMKzz7mFs1A.text: Where do I even begin?! Searsucker in Las Vegas, NV has become one of my favorite restaurants! Located inside the beautiful Caesars Palace, Searsucker knows how to satisfy every type of craving you may have. The restaurant has a rustic new aged feel with a little romance added in. The best part of course is the food! With so many options to choose from, I love to order from the "Smalls" portion of the menu. These dishes come big enough for your appetite but small enough so you can order more than one. Lets start with one of my favorite dishes, the Duck Fat Fries. Can you say Heaven? These will blow your mind. Crispy on the outside (but not burnt) and a taste that is very different than your normal french fries, this dish is guaranteed to make you want more! Another mouthwatering dish you MUST try is the Brie "Triple", Cranberry Jam and Cowboy Caviar. The flavor from the jam compliments the brie in a way that I can't describe. You get sweet, you get cheese and you get crunchy all in one dish. A must try while in Las Vegas, Searsucker will take you on a flavorful ride that you won't want to get off of. Let's give a big round of applause to Celebrity Chef Brian Malarkey for bringing us, in my opinion, one of the best restaurants Las Vegas has seen in a while. See my full review here: corkedandporked.com/2015...

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TaWC0hYHLFEVU3THOKqqww.text: Terrible.. just to say that the toast was BLACK.. and food just overcooked.. terrible experience

Obyx4SkPuuVLmeHhTcCEJA.text: We stopped in here on a recent trip to Vegas for a quick happy hour tide-over before our late dinner reservations. We went right when they were supposed to open at 5, and we were basically told they weren't ready to open. So we waited for a bit until they were. Then we were seated in the bar area. It took quite some time for a server to approach us, and when she did, she wasn't exactly bursting with excitement about her job. I ordered the sliders and partner ordered some sort of taco thing. Both were okay, but nothing we would have raved about given the other high end options we visited while we were in town. As others have mentioned, it's dark and loud, so while it was fine when we first got there, but about 6 p.m. it was crowded and overbearing. In all, I probably would have gone with 3 on the food and drink alone (and the happy hour deals were nice), but the service was poor enough that I took it down one star.

m0jOwo-MBV3h8XkG8SlpnA.text: My wife and I recently went here and had a great time, great food, and great drinks.  She had the Fish & Chips and I had the Mussels.  The fish & chips presentation was really amazing and the broth from the mussels was so tasty.  I would have to say my favorite thing was the Old Fashioned that my wife suggested.  I've been looking for one ever since we got back.  I would love to stop by here again.  The service was great, very friendly.  Thank you all for a great experience.

x4nCa_x6NAddMaKh2xg_Mw.text: Searsucker has been a the best overall addition to the Caesars restaurant line-up in years.  In both visits, we have opted for appetizers and sides to sample its cuisine.  Flavors here are extraordinary. Best brussels side of any restaurant anywhere and ive had it everywhere. The corn n chorizo side is also stellar rich in citrus flavor. The sliders we ordered was piping burning hot when we bit into them, rich in flame grilled flavor and a nicer portion than at Spago. Both salads were first rate. Loved the lemony zest of the Caesar without thr garlic overkill and the Pear & walnut salad was taken up a notch with the whipped goat cheese garnish   The Calamari was just ok. Liked the asian twist and apples. Would have liked it better served traditionally cut thin in rings and tentacles.  Friendly service at the bar and s'mores dessert was killer good. One day ill get around to ordering an entree. In the meantime, im hopeful Searsucker becomes a Caesars fixture for a long time to come.

bVTJTWuyGSQu6rMI24D3sg.text: Just writing for happy hour.    This was kind of a giggle, my friends and I like to call this our Cheers bar.  You know, where everybody knows your name...lol, see what I did there?  Happy hour is from 400pm to 630pm, everyday.  The happy hour menu is pretty awesome because it includes your usual wells, wines, but for me, what I love is that they have different draft beers on special.  I'm talking $5 drafts on special.  On the Las Vegas strip, that is almost unheard of!  As far as happy hour menu, they have about ten items on special.  My go to is Shishito peppers and duck fat fries.  They just recently changed up the menu and added a few more items.  Last night I tried the pork chips.  It was okay, perfect for when your drinking and the right size portion for complimenting your beer.  For me, too sweet on the pork, but I guess that's to balance the saltiness of the chips.  Staff, always friendly and quick with service.  Service with a smile! Searsucker is awesome!

4etvEYKM9IUH4zbgpgnbdg.text: I would go back here in a SECOND!! The food was LEGIT! So GOOD!!   Definitely make reservations, it was busy! We were seated at a lovely "people watching" window seat. It was great. We were going to see a show, so we kept it pretty simple.  Ordered a caesar salad to split, and our entrees.  The two entrees we had were Beef Ribs with horseradish mash. YUM!!! And very filling!! The other was a piece of grilled swordfish which included a choice of sauce and side. Both were fantastic.  The "share plates" looked so interesting, I want to go back just to site and nibble on little social plates! So many interesting things on there that looked good to try!  As for service, I have noticed many criticisms for bad service, I am happy to say that absolutely was not our experience!! The woman who was helping us was attentive and an asset to the dining experience.

ur7q-9KwSdHN9TnwCwKm3g.text: I was traveling for work and some of my coworkers wanted to find some place nearby for happy hour. They had some really good looking dishes on happy hour but the really selling point was the price! Drinks $5-8 and apps for $9 is pretty much unheard of in Las Vegas, especially on the strip. We each got a drink, nothing special. For apps my favorite was the duck fat prosciutto dusted fries. They were perfectly crispy, probably twice fried. We also got the tomato burrata which was delicious but didn't really fit the theme of the other food. We also got there sliders (opted for lettuce wrapped) and the seasoning of the meat was very good. There was cheddar and bacon mixed into the meat itself which you could tell it really enhanced the flavor. My coworker got the tuna tacos, which were in wonton wrappers. There was a pretty large about of tuna but she said they weren't seasoned very well. All around, I would go back for happy hour by stick to the sliders and fries.

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tomato and burrata
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duck fat prosciutto dusted fries
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna tacos

5UehzM8RBW1-rDJ3in3SmA.text: The food is overpriced but good!  The staff was great.  I had the short ribs.  The horseradish mash wasn't spicy at all and the habenero pickles just tasted like sweet pickles. The grilled cheese was very tasty and the fries were crisp and delicious.

fU4ECxsB_csqWZhCFT4WNw.text: So we decided to try this place for our anniversary (14 years).   It started really well. We had 1/2 dozen east coast oysters. They were delicious (although, I'd have preferred them a little colder).   Next we had bone marrow, also delicious. Seriously, it was very good.   For our entrees, Mike had thr scallops, and I had the burger, medium, which is pertinent to this review.   The burger is supposed to be a big deal, they only make 20 a day.   When my burger arrived, I took a bite out of it, raw. Like, not even warm in the middle.   After I found our server, Giana (she seemed put out to be serving us from the beginning), I sent it back.   Then we waited... and waited...  Then I got my burger, which was the exact burger I had sent back. I know this because I could see the bite I took out of it.   Seriously, if I went to McDonald's they would have made me a new burger, you'd expect a celebrity chef (as stated on the menu) to at least have a service standard on par with a fast food joint.   I started eating. And I just got more angry.   It's a burger with relish and avocado. Why would you reheat that? Gross!  And is it even sanitary?    Do you want to have a steak cooked on a grill after some stranger has taken a bite out of it.   I felt bad for the manager though. He tried. He came over and acknowledged the problem.   Offered some short ribs, which is nice, but I hate that.   I'm supposed to eat by myself, while Mike watches, because a fine dining restaurant doesn't know how to cook a burger.

9Lipn_6VrHinxAaDG-ob5Q.text: First time here. Happy Hour menu is limited (food wise), but the tuna poke was delicious! We ordered the duck fat fries and a slider (chefs choice, tonight was pork belly). All in all the food was good and the drinks are strong. Service was good (we sat at the bar) and the food came out quickly.

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. PB &amp; J old fashioned. Different, but good.
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna Poke was AMAZING! Excellent flavor with just the right spice.

5O5-OnQqfUxTIZQziQUvYg.text: Horrible.  Over seasoned salad.  No chicken on a slider.  Soup tasted horrible.  Fries are super greasy.  Waitress took food before we finished.  We will not be back, Save your time and money.

A0u4lFb-F3bhTXlxMnCT1g.text: Great food and great service. The Assistant General Manager, Nick came by and checked on us. He was extremely friendly and answered any questions we had. Thank you for giving us the story on why the restaurant is called Searsucker!   Try the snickerdoodle ice cream sandwich!! It's AMAZING! Will be back again soon!

uyWHB4ktBwa32MK4Xf-LDQ.text: Really great service and the food was pretty good too. I was super drunk so I can't really remember exactly what it tasted like but I do know that I slammed that Mac and cheese. SO GOOD.

y8K-PpMK2-vNmbvmgsc4ig.text: Had dinner here on Saturday night before seeing the Celine Dion concert. We made a reservation and were sat promptly upon arrival. I ordered the drunken flat iron steak and my two friends ordered the filet. The food was amazing and the service was great. We had the chocolate chip cookies for dessert...divine! I highly recommend Searsucker!

cp9AZCJFkUlXRJ25_HGcdg.text: I really, really wanted to love this place, but I didn't. On the good side, the hostesses seated us early for our reservation and the server was prompt and courteous, but not overly friendly. The appetizer of Toast (charred slice of bread with goat cheese, fig and honey) was delicious. I would have preferred two smaller pieces to one large, but that's not a big deal. Old fashioned cocktails were too sweet for my taste, but nicely made with large ice chunks (preventing too much melt) and Luxardo cherries.  On the bad side, the wild boar pasta was a disaster. They should just take it off the menu. I wish my server had been honest with me when I asked about it. Way too much sauce to pasta - I had to fish around for pieces of pasta. Also, pasta shape was not good - it was a long curled pasta (I might call cavatelloni) that you had to cut in half to eat; this dish should be served with pappardelle or fettuccine. The sauce was ridiculously over salty. I couldn't eat but about a third of it. In hindsight, I should have sent it back. My husband got the limited edition burger (only 20 made per night), which was fine, but nothing special. The bottom bun had become saturated with juices, forcing him to eat it with a knife and fork. Fries that came with the burger were good - also pretty salty.

ZQaHNe7V7JsNPa15MQZ6Gg.text: 19/100 yep challenge  * Price: expensive; $200 dinner for two ( 1 share appetizer, 2 main dishes, 1 share desert, 2 drinks), 10%  higher than nearby gourmet restaurants. their food is delicious and large portion though. 3 star. * Ambience; casual , chic decor, not over the top. 4 star. * Location: Ceasar Palace but off the main food court area and the forum. We had to stop and asked for direction from 3 different restaurant hosts!  3 star. * Meals: delicious! Every bite is tasty and perfect! 5 star. * service: excellent! Everyone is very friendly and helpful! 5 star.  This is averaged to 4 star for me!  Came in on a Wednesday night and the place was half empty. We were a bit nervous but glad that we came.  The meal is perfect! Poke: fresh and perfectly seasoning served with taro chip. $19  Scottish salmon: perfectly glazed and tender! Chimichuri sauce is sweet and tangy taste which went well with the salmon. $36  Fish and chip:moist and tender with thin but crispy shell. $42.  Snore bar: graham, chocolate ganage, chocolate mouse packed in a bar served with chocolate ice cream. Not too sweet. The bar is perfect mixed between sweet, salty, chocolate softness and crunchy. $11.  We always are big fan for chef Brian Malarkey on Top chef and are not disappointed! The only reason that this place is not packed because of the price! Since there are so many restaurants by celebrity chefs nearby with 10-20% less, many people would chose others!

xkBsgl50AjmYyDNgXbSFNQ.text: Loved the service, Tammy was amazing! Ordered the cedar smoked old fashioned, along with the bone marrow is a must,  everything was well presented and tasted great ! Highly recommended. Well be back soon.

GpRJfQnkTN4G3R62alLvog.text: My experience here was so odd and disappointing.  I was intrigued by the menu and good reviews on Yelp, so stopped in this evening for dinner.  We attempted to have a drink at the bar, but were told for 20 minutes that a waitress would come over and no one came. Whatever, still stayed strong and waited for our table.  We never actually met our waitress, but had the manager wait on us.  He was funny at first, until he basically lied and sold us sides like a dirty used car salesman.  He told us that the potatoes with the short rib and the corn with the scallops was minuscule.  He legit said it was 2 small slices of potato and that we needed to order 3 sides.  Because I didn't think we were at a seedy upwelling restaurant, we trusted him and were incredibly surprised when we received our huge meals (large helping of potatoes, not 2 slices) with no need for 3 $18 sides.  The sides were disappointing and in no way worth the price.  The Mac and cheese was apparently "the best on the strip" and stuffers tastes better.  The food was good, but I cannot get past the unprofessionalism of this establishment.  I felt uncomfortable when he came back to check on us, I told him I was disappointed that he misled us and he just laughed it off and we were later presented with our $350 bill.

qfc2p7gCYrBcG8OYE6Uf0A.text: Cool relaxed vibe at Searsucker located within the casino area at Cesar's. Enjoyed the unique bourbon cocktails and interesting variety of IPA beers. While the main course was great, it was our appetizers that made our meal memorable. Must try: calamari with the whiskey marinated apples and the tuna with seaweed crisp.

vdKUjcuc_OaO_QE4sqC78w.text: This place was so good.  We had steak,  lobster, mac and cheese and Brussels sprouts. Everything tasted amazing. Our waiter was great. Would come back.

kADgEQLlp6VNA3zx5ESRcg.text: Had dinner here with a large group recently, and while there was a lot to like, there were some issues as well. We were seated promptly upon arrival, and the space is definitely nice and comfortable. Drink orders were taken and delivered fairly promptly considering how busy the place was (Thursday evening dinner time).   After perusing the menu, we decided to get appetizers and spread them around; this netted us some tasty small plates. Among them, tender and flavorful lollipop wings, which featured a mild but distinct Buffalo style sauce with a delicious bleu cheese fondue for dipping. These were my go-to for the evening. Sliced calamari steak with chili honey glaze had a nice, thin breading giving way to a very tender and not at all rubbery interior; this dish was a major hit with the group. Another standout was the tuna poke and shaved tarot root; this featured a jar of deep red tuna poke with sesame seeds, onion, radish, and a little sriracha for heat, and was delicious on the crispy tarot chips. Unfortunately, an order of shishito peppers didn't make it to the table.  Things took a turn, though, when entrees were delivered. Me and another guest were sharing the bone-in New York strip, requested medium rare; it was delivered quite rare, well outside any notion of medium rare. This is difficult to forgive at this price point and service level. Upon letting our server know, she immediately requested a replacement from the kitchen, and while it was more properly cooked, it had also been pre-sliced, which seemed unusual to me. The flavor and seasoning were nice, but it put us a little out of step servicewise with our fellow guests.   Finally, we topped off the meal with a dessert that featured small ice cream cookie sandwiches; these were very good, with cookies that were fresh and decadent, and creamy ice cream that was very far from ordinary.   The service errors with the appetizer and steak, combined with cost, are what brings this review down. Other than the steak, the food items we received were very good, and I'd definitely eat here again.

fSM4vC2M5e44xGHmjqYjeg.text: I've been putting off writing this review since I was such a big fan of the restaurant in Scottsdale (which is now closed) but unfortunately my experience at the Vegas location was not a good one. A big issue was the staff; everyone from the hostess to the bussers seemed to not want to be there. Our server was very short with us while ordering and never really came back after that. Another dude brought us our food and he wasn't very friendly either. I burnt my hand pretty badly (it bubbled into a blister the next day) on one of the metal dishes they serve the food (straight from the oven?!?!) in and it took us forever to find someone to give us some ice since our water glasses were never even refilled.  The food was a disappointment as well. The menu was probably half the size of the AZ location so there wasn't much variety. Since it was late we decided on a few small plates to share. We got the corn (cooked well but very bland), the Mac and Cheese (really awful... the sauce was white and curdled) and also the small fried blobs they tried to pass off as tacos.  The decor in the place was nice but it was loud since it is open to the casino and also very dark for some unknown reason. Just not a pleasant experience. There are other better and cheaper places to go in Caesars so I will not be back.

l-vCsBuQO5Nz2RT1z-mJqA.text: Being the good wife that I am, I took my husband out for dinner at Searsucker.  Having dined here before I knew he would enjoy their tasty dishes.    I originally just wanted to stop in for happy hour but since they had an event going on in the bar area, we stepped in for a full dining experience.  Service was great! Before we met our waiter, another waiter stopped over for drink orders.  He noticed ours was busy with another table and didn't want us to go unnoticed.  Very thoughtful and attentive! During the rest of our meal service was nothing less than excellent.  He was professional and courteous.   We started with the lollipop buffalo wings with the blue cheese fondue.  Well it isn't really fondue so much as it is just a small cup blue cheese dressing.  But the wings are good.  The meat came right off the bone so easily.  Tasty starter for sure.    The delicious meals we ordered were wonderful! I enjoyed the beer braised short ribs served over horseradish potatoes topped with two onion rings.  So tender, flavorful and mouthwatering.  I should have stopped at eating half but it was just too good to stop.    My husband ordered the filet medium rare as usual.  His belief is that a steak should not need any sauce to be good.  Well they nailed it here.  The perfectly cooked steak was before him.  There wasn't any doubt it was good since he cleaned the plate.    Chef Malarkey has done a fine job with Searsucker.  I'm looking forward to my next visit!

77-MqvW2vAPPsH_1F72hrA.text: Seersucker surpasses my expectations with a prefixed bachelor party meal.  The restaurant is located right next to Caesar's sports book.  The name implies Southern food, and I didn't see their normal menu although the food was actual culturally diverse.  Which I was good with as live in the South and didn't want southern food in Vegas.  We had two apps of hummus and himachi.  Both were decent.  The main course had options and I got something like skirt steak which was very good.  There were mashed potatoes and brusse sprouts to share.  I would have never visited just walking by, but I was pleased with my meal going in with less than high expectations.

yC7oT_qiPAHRccnIuF3OPg.text: I ordered the drunken steak, description said it was a beer grilled steak with crispy potatoes.  They did bring me a steak and crispy potatoes but the steak was a thin, pre-sliced steak with chimichurry sauce and an entire ocean worth of salt. It was disgusting. The crispy potatoes weren't any better, they were drenched in salt and had grilled jalapenos and onions mixed in with parmesean cheese. I don't think the fries would have been too bad if they didn't have so. much. salt.  I was so convinced that they didn't bring me the right dish that I even asked the waiter, who confirmed that it was indeed the drunken steak. I'm still not convinced he didn't mishear me.  The service was mediocre. It took about 10 minutes to get my check after I asked for it.

7ZaIZze5HrEFLi8Su6mXrw.text: Went here for my bachelorette dinner and they were so accommodating to our big group of girls. Food was amazing left us all wanting more and love the ambiance of the restaurant! Will definitely be back!

ArekUVdCJdD71QgGDutVUA.text: I've been wanting to try this place for awhile and finally had a chance to get here for dinner with one of my girlfriends. The location is kind of a pain to get to if you're a local and parking in Caesars self park. Be prepared for a long walk. Luckily the wait times were reasonable and the ambiance is sort of trendy and fun.   Now on to the stuff that really matters, the food. We opted to try some shareable items to get the most out of our stomachs. To start we had the beef tartare. Amazing! If I had to recommend any one item here it'd be that! The other food was good, but not in comparison to the tartare.   For dessert we got the milk and cookies which was warm and fresh just like mom would make them. I did wish this was a bit more shareable maybe with two milk glasses instead of just one but that's just me being picky.  I definitely want to come back again soon and try more of the shareable options. I noticed they also do birthday songs & dessert which is nice for birthday party groups.

kfd341E5ie0lU18JZbujUg.text: Great place, great food, great service, great ambiance! I had the wild boar pasta, very delicious! My husband had the chicken, amazing! Most of all I absolutely gotta bring recognition to Efran!!! He was the best!! Very kind, friendly, we were in complete awe of him. He was doing so much for every table. Making sure everyone was ok, in need of anything & nothing because he had it taken care of. He was non stop everywhere. Such an amazing work ethic & awesome with customers.

kiMJiQzOWVnqMGmwpKA-8A.text: I decided to dine here before seeing Celine Dion (which was canceled that day because she got sick). The menu looked pretty enticing online and I was eager to try a few dishes.   Unfortunately, I wasn't impressed. I felt the food was mediocre and overpriced.   I went with small plates so I could sample different things:  Pig ears - I was so excited to see pig ears on the menu. Growing up in Taiwan, pig ears is a common dish where they marinade with Chinese five spice and make it crunchy but not rubbery. I haven't had pig ears for couple of decades so I was looking forward to this dish. Unfortunately, it wasn't what I expected. The ears were chewy/rubbery and way too salty. I guess if you are drinking beer, this would be good beer bar food. It's not very good on its own.   Calamari steak with chili honey glaze - The server recommended it to me. While the portion is decent and the meat cooked right, the flavor isn't impressive. Maybe it's because I grew up in Taiwan so I'm so used to the sauces that it's nothing new to me. They basically flash fried the calamari steak and the tossed them in some Chinese spicy and sweet sauce that you can buy at 99 Ranch store and call it the day.   Duck fat fries - Tasted just like regular fries. Nothing special.   I was quite disappointed with this experience. If you aren't used to Asian flavors, you might enjoy this place. Otherwise, skip it.

cCtfaQP2pqWREd523zRYOA.text: 6 of use came into this bar to try out some of their drinks, I have the pB&J old fashion, it was very tasty, the only suggestion I have is maybe they can toast the small sandwich with a blow torch or something. But over all the drinks were great!  Service was mediocre, as we had to wait till the bartenders finished their long conversation.

7E7NfKIZ8c7gq7mTYOk9pQ.text: Went here for a date night dinner and was pleasantly surprised! We normally stay off of the strip as locals, and ventured out to try this place after reading yelp reviews  We went on a weekend at 8 and were surprised it wasn't packed. The hostess was super friendly and sat us right away. We decided to order the whiskey peanut butter drink that everyone has mentioned in their reviews and HOLY CRAP. It was amazing. I drank my fiance's since she was just on the fence.   She ordered the steak, and I got the salmon. Both delish, and the fries in duck fat were delicious. I definitely recommend this place for a date night and we plan to go back for a happy hour!

uwJlEXA69fPb65k5cEPg9Q.text: A short review as I don't have much to say about the restaraunt.  I came here with 8 other people so we ordered a bunch of different appetizers. The Brussel sprouts and the calamari stood out but everything else was very average.  I then went to order the hanger steak. I was fairly disappointed as it was salty and the extremely basic.   The only food I really enjoyed was their dessert. I ordered the chocolate croissant with marshmallows (forgot the actual name). It was amazing and very unique.  For the price, there are much better options in Vegas. I enjoyed Mesa grill much more than Sear... Both are in ceaser's palace.

w-mu7QQ08nWT2IuC257gcw.text: I had one of the best meals of my life at Searsucker on this trip to Vegas. The atmosphere is amazing, the servers were awesome, and amazing at accommodating my gluten allergy! Can't recommend this place highly enough. Holy wow the meal was seriously so good - if/when i go back, I don't even know what I'll order because everything was so amazing!! Our favorite dishes of the night:   Drinks: - Strawberry Jalapeno (if you like spicy margaritas, get this!!) - Fizzy Lifter  Dinner: - Short rib with horseradish potatoes - Roasted cauliflower with pickled chilis, pine nuts, citrus - Heirloom roasted carrots with thai pesto and crushed peanuts - Scallops over kabocha squash puree, caramelized mushrooms, butternut squash and bacon bits - 36 - Salmon with white bean ragout and herbs - 29  Also. For dessert, we had the daily scoop - mango sorbet and salted caramel ice cream (or gelato)? AMAZING.

bKEPI1VhF7AzFpT2vo8ZNA.text: We came for the happy hour bone marrow and it was divine. Oysters were great, definitely would come back to try there dinner menu

5tTX9UuUoMB8TKqAW9Deow.text: What can I say about Searsucker?  I was blown away.  Literally.  Never have I wished I could give a sixth star on a review before.  We went to Searsucker on a Saturday night before a Penn and Teller show.  We started off with the Frites - usually just fries.  But these were other-worldly.  Seasoned perfectly, and fried to perfection.  I went to heaven.  Thinking we were in some carb induced haze, we ordered the sliders after that.  A small bite of perfection.  Thinking we needed some veggies, my dining partner ordered the brussel sprouts and I ordered the heirloom carrots.  We were both blown away again and I can say it's the only time I have ever tasted brussel sprouts and thought they were good.  Like really good.  Back on the protein trail, we ordered the short ribs and this was the coup de gras.  This was easily the best "small plate" dinner we have ever had.  The service was also outstanding.  I just wish I was back in Vegas to go again and try more of their tasty food.  Do yourself a favor and get over to Searsucker as fast as you can.  You won't be disappointed.

8q1rgipCeP5wYZCthYyLWg.text: Tonight was our second time at Searsucker. The first time was great, tonight, obviously not.  We moved to Las Vegas for work last year and our families are elsewhere, given that the first time dinner and service were great we decided to come in to "celebrate" Thanksgiving since they were offering a special thanksgiving menu.   We sat and our server Gabriel S. Took a while to come by. When he did, we ordered a taste of a wine they had by the bottle and by the glass and he mumbled "just a taste?", maybe he hasn't been fully trained in hospitality but people order a taste to see if they like the wine so they can order a bottle. His comment was rude and he paused and waited for an answer so my bf actually told him nicely "yes, so we can see if we like it, but we're probably gonna get it since we want to order a bottle". So right off the bat he's starting a 2 top with a $60 bottle of wine. That's clearly not enough for him so he proceeds to ignore us the whole night. We had to pour our wine, had to ask several food runners for salt & pepper; more gravy, etc. The prix fix menu I got was $59 per person for the Thanksgiving Dinner which was also all you can eat. I didn't care to eat more, but he never came to check if I wanted to. My bf ordered a filet mignon with some sides and he never came to see how the meat was cooked; which wasn't actually at the temperate he requested. We waited so long for him to bus our plates that we stacked them and moved them out of place. When he did show up he asked "anything else from the kitchen?" Without even looking at us, so we just asked for the check, paid and left.   I was trying to excuse him because it's thanksgiving, but we both work as servers in town and we have worked holidays before and never treat our guests this badly. Aside from the fact that it was also our holiday being far from home and all, and that working in the industry in town means we had a thousand options for a $200 mediocre turkey dinner yet this is where we decided to spend our evening and he didn't even care to try to do his job.

LE0xEB9mFIlA55NRfOZhxQ.text: If you're planning on clubbing at Omnia, Searsucker is a great choice for dinner. Casual ambiance with fancy beer food and a ton of carbs so your body can handle the dance and drink throughout the night.  I tried the following:  -Bone Marrow: Massive! Usually with bone marrow, you're fighting over it with the people you're with because you're all sharing one dinky bone. But one order here has 3 massive bones topped with a chutney and tons of crisped brussel sprout leaves.  -Mac n Cheese: I've never seen mac n cheese made with the wheel-shaped pasta that you see in kids' meals. It works though because the cheese sits in between the crevices. And if it wasn't already creamy enough, there's a huge dollop of sour cream on top.  -Sliders: Taste was fine but it was over cooked and too charred.   -Duck Fat Fries: Definitely a must get! I don't how they cook these but every millimeter of the fries are crispy. The ketchup tastes housemade too (not sure if it is).  -Biscuits: My favorite item of the night. You can taste the butter that went into the making of the dough and then top it with more butter. It just gets better and better. It's not extremely flakey but super moist. It comes out piping hot.   Portions are huge. Service was so so. Water was always filled but when we told the server about the over cooked sliders, she didn't offer to take it off the bill. She just said she wish we told her earlier so she could make us a new plate. It wasn't until we told the manager that they compensated us for it.

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone marrow... Three pieces!

dJTAj0kwHzLlNxetW_4HSw.text: This restaurant was a good size and well decor with cool lights.   Bacon eggs (4/5)  Bone marrow (5/5) - I wish there was more bone marrow Mexican shrimps (4/5)  Mac and cheese (3/5) - the mac was not as soft as I like Calamari steak (5/5)  Bread pudding (4/5) Cookie ice cream (4/5)   Overall, great food and nice ambiance. I think the appetizers and shared plates section had better food choices than the main entrees. I definitely would come Back

yMl3Q5kOBFydMlTJIjS6eA.text: Cool spot along casino floor, trendy, tasty food without being pretentious  Small hiccup with order but everyone was apologetic and made it right

fFf9mcuUfbaNPggVYnp5Vg.text: I had the roasted chicken here. It was well seasoned. The decor is great here. The service was great.

201jAShQaIK1bwDF4Ydwdg.text: My friends and I bought tickets to attend the #VegasStrong benefit show at Omnia, and Oliver at the Hakkasan concierge group reached out to me with a dinner deal at Searsucker. $55 a person for either the prix fixe menu, or spend $55 on the a la carte menu. The entrees are around $30ish, so if you get a cocktail and an appetizer or dessert you're pretty much set. The bonus was a bottle of wine for each four people, and expedited entry into Omnia, which is a huge plus because the lines can get pretty crazy.  I don't remember our server's name, but he handled our party of 12 really well. We opted to do family style sharing plates, so he basically just ordered the menu highlights for us and made it work out to $55 a person. I think we probably would've gotten more food if we would have ordered on our own, but I'm much more of a tapas girl so small portions and bigger variety are right up my alley. They were super nice and even brought out different plates for my gluten-intolerant friend. I lost count, but we probably had about a dozen dishes in all.   Highlights were the burrata, scallops and the skirt steak. The beer marinade on the drunken skirt steak is amazing. The calamari was also really good - strip cut instead of rings and tentacles - super tender, with a yummy chili honey glaze. I'm a huge fan of short ribs and had high expectations for theirs, but it wasn't as "fall apart" as some other ones I've had. We also had hummus, poke, wings, heirloom carrots, brussels, and the brick chicken - everything was good, just nothing super special. I also had a smoked old fashioned, which was really well done. I wish I would have stirred it first though, because I had a sip that was all smoked maple syrup and almost dropped my glass. But once everything was mixed together the flavors were amazing! We skipped dessert because we had to head into Omnia for the show, but I could've easily put down an ice cream sandwich.   Ambiance wise, the restaurant was packed, not a ton of room between tables. EDM music is blasting; I assume because of their partnership with Omnia. Luckily for me that's right up my alley, but it's loud enough that I couldn't hear my friend two seats away. If you're going for dinner and convo, this probably isn't the place for you. But overall, I think it's a decently priced place on the strip with good food, and a great place to grab drinks and small bites before a night out.

-_tw2wAmcexZK_sl4fkYcA.text: I wouldn't even waste money to go there again. The food is pretty horrible. I got a salmon and it was that worst I had in a long time. The location I would say is nice and inviting but that's pretty much it

FGc_c_gEVNXHv6u-vn4FSQ.text: Amazing service and the bartenders are attentive and knowledgeable. Recommend the burger (homemade along with all of the homemade toppings) and PB&J old fashioner! I will be back for sure!!

NpY_kHsFmVVDrAJP-iQySQ.text: Thursday night, after seeing Absinthe. Go to Seersucker, oh wait. You're closed. WTF!

dqUarKyhM7Ry6mCuis9oTA.text: Food was delicious, but our service was absolutely phenomenal. Alyssa was amazing and made great recommendations per my food allergy. Highly recommend you visit this restaurant while in Vegas.

hn8w5wlvq79unanr5MG0fw.text: First time diner. Nothing to complain about really. They had a peanut butter and jelly old fashion which was delicious, but everything else we ordered was pretty mediocre.  We asked for our steak sliced and it came cut in half, which I thought was odd but not a big deal.  From what I believe was a manager, came by and dropped off one of our drinks. Didn't say a word just put it on the table smiled and walked away. Which we both thought was a little weird.  And it was extremely loud.  Nothing really stood out, just another spot.  Probably won't return by choice

UIyfBxCX3JJ44dfukMvBNw.text: Three of us went there on 1/25/2019 at eight o'clock and I ordered their burger but they ere out and asked why it is only eight and was told we only prepare 20 burgers and was disappointed and ordered short ribs which was so salty and could not finish it. My friend ordered the tomato soup which was cold and the salad was so salty as well. I complained to the waitress and she could not care less and never came back to ask us if we liked another drink.  I asked the assistant manager and she did not do anything about it.  They were not that busy either.  Overall horrible food and customer service. will never go there again and I hope the upper management reads this.

o0s6HNveAptwTTNrFKCzig.text: Unbelievable Old Fashions!  We stopped here before seeing Celine at Caesar's and their world famous Old Fashions are incredible.  The food was fantastic and we had a great time.  Try the PB&J Old Fashion...it's their most popular drink.

ELMdYcrJa3WJLaDmI3JgoQ.text: Came here for the happy hour to try the Duck fries because I heard they were amazing. They were good, but not the best fries in town. I'll have to come back & try more.

U2vBYN13moZnonxgCogQFg.text: Pretty delicious, trendy place inside of Caesars. If you're staying at Caesars, definitely check out happy hour!   The food is pretty delicious, and the drinks are very good! We had the duck fat fries (pretty darn good), the short rib with horseradish mash (really good), and the spicy shrimp and grits (sooooo spicy, but delicious).  Plus, the Happy Hour drinks were creative, and strong!   It was a great place to stop for snacks and drinks, but I wouldn't pay the full menu prices for the food we had. Go during happy hour, it's totally worth it.  We got dinner and 3 drinks for $55.

GxWwFDQDKxw_B49jo42Sjg.text: This place is amazing! We went back 2 nights in a row! What brought us back was the strawberry jalapeno margarita (SO good) but we also tried several dishes. All were amazing. Ambience is modern with a fun twist.

The cocktails and atmosphere were a bit lacking.

CTCdKt8hqei5l4F-k3EB4A.text: The bartenders and drinks were great.  The service at the bar was awesome.  I do know people sitting near the bar ca

vLoLbg-KcgsB43U_5jzG_A.text: Excellent service!   Food--We ordered 4 small dishes since there are so many yummy choices and also highly recommended by the waiter.  -tuna tartar: excellent dish we might come back just for this. -bacon pork belly: it's served on a piece of toast and topped with a poached egg and hollandaise sauce (egg Benedict style). Overall it's good however we couldn't overlook the fatty layers. -short rib: it's basically s piece of roast beef, served on bed of mashed potato and topped with shredded fried onions. The roast beef is very bland.  -bone marrow: would not recommend this dish. The amount of bone marrow wasn't enough to spread on 4 pieces of baguettes. It's extremely fatty. I'm not sure how to justify the price on bones that otherwise get thrown away. The bed of toast Brussel sprouts were burned.   The habanero coriander pickles are very pickle-y. Pickle lovers would totally enjoy it. Thanks for the free Yelp checkin offer!!  Overall the experience would have been a lot better if we didn't order the fatty dishes (visible fat and running oil). The room temperature was soooo cold that having fat in the palette just didn't work.

Perfect if you will be going to the club next door after dinner. :)

Salmon was very very good. Hamachi in a jar and the tacos were delicious! The manager came by to check on us but it didn't seem like he was listening. Maybe Caesar should run this place!

gINdyIZ0G0dm6oz7RQNEpw.text: Let me start by saying we should have known things would not be outstanding based on the crowd. It was completely dead!!!!! We stopped in for quick appetizers and drinks before omnia. Drinks were delicious and decently priced. Food, not so good! Jars on the menu is quite literal... The food comes in s jar. We ordered about 6 appetizers for 5 girls and that was enough. I absolutely loved the crab and avocado but that's about it. Beef tartare came up short, as did the tuna tartare and honestly the rest of the food was so mediocre I can't even remember what else we ordered. The scene is cute and it's a great location but not really up to par with the competition.

RMcef4lxsd16sDMyGWubMw.text: First the good - our food was excellent! As a group of 10, we ordered a dozen items from the menu and everyone of them was well prepared and enjoyed. Great food - bravo to the chef. Our waiter was good although he 'disappeared' several times and we had to request assistance from the table attendants when we wanted anything. They were kind and each time said they would tell our waiter. I would have preferred the waiter to have checked in more regularly especially in a restaurant trying to promote a 'social' restaurant format. If we had not been experienced in social dining and got help from the table attendants we would not have had a good experience. Last, the hostess. She was offensive, rude, and incompetent. First we confirmed the restaurant had availability using Open Table. Then we called the restaurant as a courtesy to the restaurant since we were a large group of 10. She seemed to struggle with whether they could accommodate us 'since they are a social restaurant'. Really? Then she says they need an hour and a half to seat us. Really? Then, when we arrive, she looks right over my head and asks if she can help the man standing behind me. Unfortunately for her, that man was my husband and we have had enough of that kind of rude behavior from service industry employees. She didn't stop there but I will. Her behavior is enough to not go back to the restaurant. Too bad because social dining is fun and the food was very good.

5BLr-y4X3n77ATy_EUncmg.text: Searsucker never disappoints. The filet I had was amoung the best I've had. The staff was friendly and the service outstanding.

aDkF4QXVJG8m4M_yzAPgpA.text: Definitely not worth the money.... food was cold  and awful I had the drunkenskirt steak..salty and undercooked I asked for med well and got med rare. Fries were awful as well. My husband had the Thanksgiving meal it was just ok but definitely not worth $49....at best I wud say $19.99. The service was less than stellar. Had to ask for stuff a minimum of 3 times before I got it. Needless to say won't be going back!!

cflIzYsQK2sd7z_i2wfQCA.text: Originally it was a review in Seven magazine that sparked my interest in this spot, so I decided to check it out myself to see if it lived up to the hype. It met every expectation and more!   We were 20 minutes late for our reservation but called ahead to let them know and were seated right away (this could have been attributed to the fact that it was a relaxed Sunday night and wasn't super busy). The menus were pretty simple in that they didn't necessarily list all the ingredients in each dish. This was done to invoke questions and a more interactive experience, according to the server. Our server, Alyssa, was incredibly knowledgable and accurate in her descriptions of the menu items, and after much deliberation, we decided on:  -Duck fat fries with prosciutto bits (an absolute must- very flavorful) -Cowboy caviar (Rocky Mountain oysters with toasted kale and sweet potato with a balsamic drizzle- my favorite part of the meal!) -Pork butt with whiskey apples (melt in your mouth goodness) -Warm toffee pumpkin pudding cake (we didn't think we would have enough room for dessert but we're glad we ordered it!)  The dishes were as simplistic in their delivery as the menu had been, yet were still presented beautifully on each plate. This is not a restaurant that makes you question your knowledge of which fork to use- rather, it's a relaxed, inviting atmosphere where the servers are as unpretentious as the dishes themselves. Each bite was delicious, and the overall experience left you feeling happy and fulfilled. Would definitely return!

photos.caption: Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duck fat fries with prosciutto bits
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cowboy Caviar aka Rocky Mountain Oysters
Photo of Searsucker - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork butt with whiskey apples

BmIsqgiFLORpF8w7N1_G4g.text: Eric was an amazing server and so helpful. He was amazing at blending the needs of the group with his own recommendations. And his recommendations were spot on- the braised beef was some of the best I've had (and I'm from the Bay Area, home of braised beef). Overall, an amazing experience for is and our bachelorette group of 12.  Also, from the bachelorette party organizers, this place is perfect for flexibility of a large party and also lets you count drinks toward the max (which some places done).   So good!!

J9AgNC7hGPrcOthnPk9hVA.text: The server we had tonight was super sweet didn't get her name she had bangs though !! Too bad the hostess are pretty rude and unwelcoming. I've been to there SD location as well and it wasn't all that great. Thought I'd give it a shot again in Vegas. Probably the last time I'll be visiting this chain of restaurants. Not much of anything special. Especially since there service is average.

crJVj1frc1cUuKIuqkfNJw.text: Had dinner at this place. Loved the decor and the drinking cups it's a mixture of classy, relaxed and country not sure how to explain it. The service was good the food was awesome although the shareable tacos were incredibly small. Great dinner menu and not mad prices, located inside the Caesars palace which is great if you're thinking of going to omnia or Fat Tuesday after dinner. Bar was really good and the service was friendly I definitely recommend

K91whbIjh-tFDyGpSWekww.text: Frustrating with the manager as they told us that this place is full but wasn't even full and force us pay 60 per person  Poor management and will not return.  Brought over 18 customers.  Thanks for providing horrible experience at the end.

PVmYog4DTqYPE4Gs34tKdA.text: I like the decor and vibe at this restaurant. The cocktails were pretty good. I went with the Skinny Jenny and then had a champagne cocktail.   The hamachi appetizer is excellent. The beef tartar was also good. It could have used more quail egg.   My boyfriend and I split the Tomahawk ribeye. I was so excited for this, but it was lackluster. Especially for an $85 steak. I found it to be tough and too fatty. And to the smart ass (Erik S) who called out that I should get a clue about a ribeye being fatty, I understand that the fat is what makes a ribeye delicious but when half the steak is fat I don't feel like I'm getting my money's worth. I've had plenty of ribeye steaks that are more meaty. My review, my opinion.   My friend had the pork belly entree and said the flavors were good, but it was too rich to eat more than half of it. Pork belly is rich so you have to be in the mood for it.   This place is worth a try, but I'm not running back.

L5ZNvSkBKyAkQ07E9w87Qg.text: Food was ok I was hoping it would be the same as the sear sucker  in San Diego but the food was just bland . The squid was good though just too saucy for me . We also had the duck fat fries nothing special , tuna albacore and spinach salad. This place is next to the omnia night club.

lpNVFO9X9njhehyElcUSQg.text: The pork butt was so moist and delicious, with the apple slaw on top it set it off. The Brussels sprouts were under cooked and did not have good flavor. The duck fat fries were amazing!

As for food the chorizo corn off the cob was the best, tasty and spicy. The filet was a too salty, but definitely much better than their Cesar salad. E7mfeSFwoce1vTH_EcH61Q.text: Went here for my birthday dinner, just the boyfriend and I. We shared two tapa like plates (short ribs and spicy shrimp with grits) both very delicious especially the shrimp and grits and we also shared a main plate (tuna wrapped in prosciutto) this was ok kind of bland tasting. The service was excellent and they brought out our ordered dessert with a candle and sang happy birthday to me...the cocktail I also got was delicious, definitely had a kick... jalaberry strawpeno!
