-A4D7qlrFBrqi83cz01Z2g.text: Incredibly bad service. Took 3 hours from when we sat down till they finally figured out our bill. The manager was busy flirty with all off the waitstaff. The entire serving staff was talking and not paying attention to our table. I had to go to the bar on several occasions to get our drinks.   At the end of the meal our server took 45 minutes. ( not exaggerating) to get the ticket right. I was added items that I did not order. Finally after asking the manager to fix the error I paid 20 bucks extra in cash just to leave.   Food was not worth all the hassle. Plenty of options I would stay clear until they fix the service. Ruined the night.

H7QuB05_wgYUCDbWekV93g.text: Very disappointing.  In general, I felt the food was over seasoned and that always makes me think the restaurant is compensating for poor quality.  The service was prompt but the staff had zero personality.  Crab cake app - good amount of lump crab but the cake was basically burned on the top and bottom; I liked the side of sauce and tabasco pearls.  Side of bacon grits - Gross. The grits were a horrible texture...like overcooked oatmeal.  I could have cut them with a knife!  Also way too salty.  Side of Jalapeno-chorizo corn off the cob - this was tasty but again was probably over spiced  Duck with white bean, confit, and fig - The meat was overcooked and incredibly  tough and the rest of the dish was bland.  I didn't even bother eating it.  It's Vegas, people.  Spend your money elsewhere.

OfTMwOinKfSOicI20xlYww.text: Had such an AMAZING dinner! The food was fantastic, ambiance was great and our server Chris made our experience. He was so helpful and gave great recommendations. Would definitely recommend the calamari, NY steak, and SCALLOPS. The craft cocktails were really tasty. Can't wait to try other locations. Will be back for sure!

d4dpixaPy1XuPvtAMx_SCw.text: Inside Caesar's Palace. Really nice atmosphere. Great wait staff. A good island of casual calm inside the loud hustle and bustle of the casino. Yummy bites too!!

eSktcFrl6UQoh7djE79o7Q.text: Much better than I was expecting. The beer list included some interesting options. The bartenders were fun and lively and engaging. The crab and avocado appetizer was killer... big chunks of crab and fresh avocado and nice subtle spice. I wish they included more than 4 chips, but that would be my only complaint. The short rib entree was cooked perfectly and dwarfed the short rib I had at Gordan Ramsay's a couple nights prior. The portion was very generous. This is a strong contender.

RvXhNGNG0h44gb4XA0M1kQ.text: Hosted a group event here on a Monday night. We had the bar/lounge area to ourselves which was great. The waiters came around and took drink orders, they were very fast and efficient. Our group of 30 was sat a two large tables in a partially private area. We started with the lollipop wings, ahi tuna tacos and calamari steak. WOW. The lollipop wings were amazing, the heat on them was seriously perfect. I loved the way they were trimmed too, the least messy wings I have ever encountered. For my entree I got the steak that came with a roasted pepper. There were brussels sprouts for sharing as well. The steak was seasoned perfect, I ordered mine medium and it was a tad under, I didn't eat the center because it was a bit too purple for me, but that's personal preference. For dessert we had the assorted cakes and chocolate chip cookies, these were probably the best chocolate chip cookies I have ever had. I'm not a huge sweets person but I ate 3. THREE.   The service during dinner was great as well.   Prior to planning the dinner the event staff was awesome! They were always quick to respond to any questions I had, adjusted our time when I arrived late for the event and were accommodating when a guest didn't want anything from the preset menu. Thank you so much for a great evening!!

TumzA8x6cXfqHpu4mnrNUQ.text: Brought my girlfriend here for her birthday. The meal was awesome! My girlfriend is a vegetarian, although I've recently gotten her to try some fish. They made small plates special for her. First was a salad with mixed greens, strawberries, candied walnuts,  and a raspberry vinaigrette...very good. For me they brought the pork belly...delicious!!! 2nd round they unfortunately brought her another salad...not the ideal place for vegetarians I must say, nonetheless, the 2nd salad had figs and goat cheese and greens with a delicious dressing...she said it was excellent, I liked it too! With the delicious, spicy bread balls we had initially, we were already feeling full, so she canceled her main course and we split the tuna. My vegetarian girlfriend loved it! lol I also really enjoyed it! Sushi grade with the skin attached...really tasty! Overall, a great restaurant...highly recommend!

D6RFqvEpeR-Aj7DkXRrbAQ.text: Staff needs an attitude adjustment. We we greeted with a bitchy face and no warm greeting. We made it in time for happy hour, but our server took so long to get to us that we couldn't order it. One of my friends had the tacos and got FOOD POISONING because of the very questionable meat. The prices are too high for the amount of food. And service wasn't helpful when one dish needed to be sent back. None of the staff was smiling. Except Curtis the busser. He was incredibly kind and sociable. He gave our table more attention than our server.  We felt judged being younger customers since we didn't buy alcohol, but we could still afford to pay and tip well... We never got our beverages refilled.

h8aVIzQbsBKXaHbTPsMcAA.text: Funky menu but one of the only late night options at Ceasar's.  We had the steak tartare which is very good with a raw egg- but not Paris good.  Not too filling either- probably good have doubled the portion.  Service was good but somewhat distracted.  Would I go back? Yes!

vtgkrmCgydJQ6IE1NiQE2g.text: The food reminded me of Applebee's and Fridays, not bad just not what I was expecting.

KKuIGhY5s0ySWK33eM8tWA.text: This is by far my favorite meal in Vegas! Take my advice, and go to this place around 5-6pm. They have a great happy hour menu.  I've had a lot of burgers in my life, and this HAS to be the best I've had. Upgrade to the duck fat fries for a dollar, trust me you won't regret that extra dollar.  This place is A++ in my book and would highly recommend it. For you whiskey drinkers, get the "Bad Bad." All in all, this place is fairly pricey, but if you go during the happy hour menu, you won't pay through the nose for a fantastic meal.
